title: A great dishwasher!
txt: We recently had to replace our old dishwasher from another manufacturer.  I had heard good things about Bosch dishwashers so wanted to to buy one as a replacement.  This new Bosch is the best ever!  It gets super hot and cleans so much better.  Also somehow it is even quieter then our old one, we can only tell it is on when we hear the drain.  Also really like the physical buttons on the front and countdown timer as it makes it easy to see the settings and know when it will be complete. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Dishwasher Standout
txt: This is one quiet dishwasher.  We love the delay setting so it pretty much runs after we go to bed.  That said, we can run it when we are watching TV and not be bothered by the sound.  After having installed 4 other makes of dishwashers I must say that this dishwasher was by far the easiest to install.  The leveling controls are simple and really well designed.  We are very pleased with the cleaning results of the dishwasher and yes, we do not have to rinse the dishes.  Simply put, we are impressed. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Surprisingly spacious
txt: We bought this Bosch 300 dishwasher to replace a 7 year old dishwasher. We researched various brands and Bosch kept being listed first in various categories. But we chose this particular model due to one important factor (for us), heated drying! Most Bosch dishwashers use a system of superheated rinse water, then "pop" the door and allow natural convection to dry the dishes. That would not cut it for us! From the initial cycle, this dishwasher has lived up to it's well deserved reputation. The dishes are clean, the pots and pans too. The automatic setting is what we use the most, but you may use alternative settings to clean too. The interior space is ample for loading large pots and the middle rack is adjustable for plates and bowls. The top rack has been a hidden gem, it allows you to place serving utensils and smaller items to be cleaned without slipping out of place when hit by a jet of water. The front controls are ok'd-school red LED, with countdown timer. A dedicated power button will keep it from accidentally starting up. My wife and I are very pleased with it! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Air dry feature is the BEST
txt: While remodeling we replaced our 11-year-old Bosch with another Bosch of course. The old one worked just fine but didn't match. I have to say how much I love this new washer. Three racks are perfect. It keeps lids in place.The auto air feature is exactly what I need. Improved rack layout holds more dishes than before. Cleans. Silent. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Our new Diswasher rocks!
txt: We love our new BOSCH diswasher, 300 Series. It has all the features I've been looking for and works like a charm! I love the buttons on front, not hidden. I can always see what cycle is running and it's easy to tell when it's done. It's quiet as a mouse and it's simple to operate. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Love my new Dishwasher
txt: I did a lot of research for over six months to find the perfect dishwasher in my price range. I need up choosing this one and I do not regret my decision at all. It is so quiet I can't even tell if it's running or not. My dishes come out perfectly clean no matter which cycle are use. This dishwasher holds so many more dishes than my 10-year-old GE. Are used to have to run my dishwasher every day and I can go almost 3to 4 days without running it. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Dr. Candace A. Strawn
txt: Excellent, very quiet dishwasher!!!  The door is strong enough to hold our Boston Terrier's weight!

title: Perfection!
txt: I was looking for an appliance that had the reputation, style and functionallity.  I found the Bosch 300 Series to be the dishwasher met all 3 criteria.  I am so happy I chose a Bosch dishwasher, as it has met and surpass my expectations! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Crack above front control panel
txt: I purchased this in Jan. with an extended warranty. There is now a crack in the stainless above the control panel and the rinse aid leaks.  I called and was told I would have to pay $100 to replace the part because it is considered "wear and tear."  I can't understand how this is wear and tear, definitely a defect in the construction. I don't have any problems with the way it operates, just this crack.

title: Great dishwasher!
txt: We replaced our old leaking dishwasher with a Samsung.  It was so bad we returned after 4 months and ordered this Bosch model.  The first one we had to refuse delivery because the outter insulation pad was soaking wet and dripping all over the floor.  After many phone calls we got the replacement Bosch.  It works amazingly compared to the Samsung.  I definitely recommend this model.  I just wish we had a better purchasing experience.  We are a family of 5 and we run our dishwasher daily, especially during Quarantine.  I think some days we could run it twice!  We definitely put household appliances to the test. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Great machine. Surprisingly large amount of space....
txt: Great machine. Surprisingly large amount of space.

title: The Best!
txt: Finally I have a dishwasher in our home. Absolutely love this dishwasher, especially the sanitize cycle! It is so quiet. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Yes, like the features it has and how quiet it is..

title: Totally wonderful

It always state how quiet this products is but I really never know when it running.You can believe I will always have a Bosch Dishwasher. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: This dishwasher is so quiet ... you can barely hear anything! It's very efficient in cleaning and...
txt: This dishwasher is so quiet ... you can barely hear anything! It's very efficient in cleaning and has great interior features for placement of dishes, glasses, silverware, etc.... I love the extra tray on top! It's a very solid dishwasher for the price. I'm happy I chose this model!

title: Unfortunately multiple issues with this item and the installation: arrived with installers withou...
txt: Unfortunately multiple issues with this item and the installation: arrived with installers without an electrical cord, was then told by installers couldn't do install because under sink water valve was dripping (however hadn't been prior to him turning it). Why would a purchase come without an electrical cord? weird. After paying AGAIN to have it installed, it didn't dry dishes, and smelled inside, left food at bottom. The instructions were so difficult to understand due to mismatched diagrams, no instructions how to operate, had to finally call in, was then met by a very annoyed lady (I wasn't rude or anything, i just think she didn't like her on call job since it was after 5pm PST when I called), she couldn't explain how to operate, was frustrated, then said, give it some time to run a few times in order to dry the dishes. End result=if you want your dishes dry you have to add on that function which will add on another 40 min to the cycle. Really? Almost 3 hours to run the sanitize cycle? Bummer! purchase was 2/23/20 but wanted to wait until had info on dishwasher quality before submitting this.

title: Does not dry dishes, but is quiet and easy to instal. Pro it’s very easy to install, I Am a woman...
txt: Does not dry dishes, but is quiet and easy to instal. Pro it’s very easy to install, I Am a woman I installed it myself, extremely quiet, cons dishes remain ridiculously wet and it was a super tight squeeze to get under cabinet. You can install it no problem if there is already an electrical outlet under cabinet next to washer cabinet from prior dishwasher. It comes with all extra parts you don’t need to purchase anything additional. I recommend you run it before sliding it into cabinet to check for leaking water. Super tight squeeze, (see pictures) I have an older home under cabinet is extract minimum space required. I am replacing floor soon so I was able to cut some flooring out in front of dishwasher cabinet space (see pictures) to drop it down low enough to slide under counter. There is a lip on the back side so I had to slightly tip it to get under counter edge(see pictures). I used two wide butcher knives between insulation and counter top (see picture)to reduce insulation bunching up as I slid dishwasher under cabinet. BIG flaw dishes remain VERY VERY WET (see picture) this is not what I expected. I ran it on extra dry, dishes are MORE WET than when I hand wash and rinse in hot water. I’ll try the sanitize cycle next hoping that will fix the problem. I will update if I resolve the LACKING ABILITY TO DRY dishes problem.

title: Top Notch Clean Dishes and Runs quietly
txt: We've had our dishwasher now for nearly 6 months and everything comes out crisp and clean. Sometimes I need to double check if it's on because it runs so quietly. Running smoothly! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Finally ! Our dishes are very clean. After years of struggling with a leaking machine that never ...
txt: Finally ! Our dishes are very clean. After years of struggling with a leaking machine that never got our dishes clean after multiple cycles, we bought this machine. We waited too long. The dishes come out very clean and sparkly. No leaks. Very happy with it.

title: Best dishwasher
txt: Love the 300 series. Extremely lightweight door, love controls on the outside, rinse aid alert, efficient use of space in loading and I adore the 3rd rack! Does an incredible job of cleaning, sanitizing and dishes are DRY! Would buy again. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: I love this thing. I have put it to the test with some real stuck on dishes and have yet to be di...
txt: I love this thing. I have put it to the test with some real stuck on dishes and have yet to be disappointed! Previous was GE and was regularly displeased with it's performance. After 7 years that one failed (began to leak) so we replaced it with this fine machine.

title: In These Times: A Great Relief
txt: Our new dishwasher, the 300 series, is a lifesaver in these times of coronavirus. We replaced our old dishwasher which was at least 20 years old a few months ago.Our new dishwasher, the 300 series, is a lifesaver in these times of coronavirus. We replaced our old dishwasher which was at least 20 years old a few months ago. It was such a dilapidated machine, and so noisy, that we were reluctant to use it at all. Then we were so lucky to get this dishwasher. I can't believe how quiet it is. When I first ran it, I couldn't believe that it was running. I had to put my ear against the door. The first load that I washed was an eye-opener. A glass that I had assumed would be forever cloudy had miraculously become crystal-clear. I was ecstatic. Nowadays, most of our food is prepared at home. That generates so many dirty dishes every single day. But no problem! The dishes go in easily, we hit clean at the end of the night, and wake to beautifully clean and dry dishware. While I do have time on my hands because of the coronavirusBut no problem! The dishes go in easily, we hit clean at the end of the night, and wake to beautifully clean and dry dishware. While I do have time on my hands because of the coronavirus, I am not wasting it handwashing dishes, or re-washing dishes that weren't washed correctly in the old dishwasher. I marvel every day at the quality of this dishwasher and the work it does. Thank you so much. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Silent Performance
txt:
We recently selected all new appliances for our newly constructed home which features a large open area for the kitchen, eating area, and living room. We knew we needed appliances that would be efficient and quiet, so Bosch was on the top of the list. We've been completely pleased -- it's stylish, fits our decor, is very quiet, has an excellent capacity and flexibility, and cleans better than any dishwasher we've had before.

Thanks! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Bosch, if you want them clean!
txt: My third bosch.  This one replaced a non-Bosch dishwasher that was only 3 years old.  I'd had a service guy work on it about a year ago (when it was only 2 years old).  They charged me nearly the cost of a new machine to replace the motherboard.  A year later it was dead again.  This time I did what I should have done the first time, gotten a Bosch.  Install was a breeze.  It worked right from day one and has never failed to clean completely whatever dirty dishes I've put into it.  Clean, wicked hot dry, quiet, energy efficent.  It even has a third (upper) tray for silverware, does that work good or what???  What more could you ask for? [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Love my Bosch!

title: Quiet and cleans wonderfully
txt: Best dishwasher I've ever had. It truly is so quiet that you don't know that its on. Love the top flatware tray which frees up space for dishes when you remove the usual holder. Cleans everything thoroughly!

title: Love My Bosch dishwasher
txt: This is my second Bosch dishwasher of the exact same model that I have purchased. We bought one early last year but unfortunately sold our house quickly and had to leave it behind. So when we got to the new house of course we have to buy the same new Bosch. We love it it is quiet efficient and cleans the dishes beautifully! My husband will even let me run it while there's a football game on! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

My only comment - and it’s not a real negative - is that even with using the Extra Dry option, some things are still not totally dry - as we expected from the reviews.

title: This is a great dishwasher. So great, in fact, I now own two. One I had installed in one home a...
txt: This is a great dishwasher. So great, in fact, I now own two. One I had installed in one home and had no issues and has been great and the second I bought from Home Depot and is sitting in the corner of my new home because it has not been installed and cannot be returned (48 hour return policy). The features that stand out most about this Bosch are: cleans really well, very quiet, dependable and stylish appearance. I have owned the old one for a year and the new one for 10 days -- not sure how well the new one works yet because no one has installed it (despite paying). I would not say it meets expectations because I paid for a dishwasher that would be installed and wash dishes and did not receive that product and I cannot use the dishwasher with it sitting in the corner uninstalled. I dislike the fact that it is not useful for washing dishes and the cost was so high and it is not returnable. So basically I would not do this again.

title: I have had this dishwasher a couple of months.  I don't really think that reviewing a product whe...
txt: I have had this dishwasher a couple of months.  I don't really think that reviewing a product when it is so new is the best idea since you haven't experienced it long enough to give a accurate review.  I have tried to wait and then do reviews but usually the link won't work it you wait so I'll review what I know.  So far it has been great compared to the Maytag which I only kept 9 months.  I like the quietness, ability to clean, front controls, utensil & flatware rack, adjustable top rack, the countdown time, adjustable tines.  There are 2 of us and I wash dishes every other day.   The racks design still needs work.  If I place dinner plates, mixing bowls cookware on the bottom then the upper rack must be up and then cereal/soup bowls, saucers, mugs, drinking glasses won't fit.  And then of course the reverse is true.  I have left the basket out to give me more room and that helps but the non-movable tines limit what you can place on the bottom rack.  Drying is good.  Doesn't dry plastic or anything that will hold water (like bottom of cups).  The design of the upper rack is challenging to try to get cups, glasses, sauces, small bowls or plastic ware to fit in it.   So far I like this dishwasher and would recommend it as a best choice available today.

title: Impressive
txt: This is my 2nd bosch dishwasher. My first one was sold with my previous home bit it was 5 years old and very used with a family of 4 who 2 of thosewere young children.  This washer has the best cycle time and will clean all plates and dry 99% of the water off. Quiet easy to operate. The 3 tier rack is very nice idea. wash all utensils on top , remove the utensils container on bottom shelf and poof more room for dishes. We did our research and after owning a few other brands , we are convinced this in the best manufacture of dish washers. The perticular model best fit our budget and couldnt be happier. I will never buy a different manufacture of dishwasher again. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Bosch SHEM63W55N!
txt:
I have had this dishwasher for 5 months now and I am very happy with its performance! It can accumulate a few days of dishes at times. It does hold a lot of dishes. I didnt think I would like the 3rd rack but I do like it for the flatware now that I got used to it. I mostly use the Auto cycle, it washes flawlessly. This machine is very quiet but very powerful. I use rinseaid (jetdry) as suggested! It will tell me on the console when to add more jetdry. I wish it would let me know before it actually before it runs out so I am not pressed to add it just when I am starting a new cycle! I am also pleased with the drying performance. I have read so many complaints about the drying but those people probably arent using the jetdry! I had been using cascade platinum pods because I was stocked with it! Since I ran out I followed the Bosch recommendation and am currently using finish quantum pods. Both are really good but I do find the Cascade will shile the pots and flatware just a bit better! I also have soft water and I dont know if that has anything to do with it! Can Bosch give me a explination as to why they recommend Finish? I also forgot to mention I have my rinse aid set at low #2 because I am in a soft water area! I also wish Bosch would have given a better loading diagram because I use a few cutting boards at a time as well as odd shaped corning ware. I do manage to get everything in however! 
I give this dishwasher a 5 Star. I would like to hear back from Bosch on my comments. It took me a long time to get to this review because I run the machine 2 to 4 times a week, so I really wanted to test it out! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Pros: It is very quiet, which is really nice, washes...
txt: Pros: It is very quiet, which is really nice, washes well, and the third utensil rack is a nice feature. Cons: The buttons seem really cheap and flimsy. And we’ve been very disappointed in the drying. Using both the drying and sanitizing cycles, dishes still come out wet.

Leaves food on the the dish’s, leaves food  on the door of the dishwasher, when it releases the detergent it drops it in the handle of the top rack so it will not dissolve. If I put JUST GLASSES in the dishwasher they come out with I k inside them. All around a bd design. Wish I had stuck with the Samsung.

title: Bottom line, read the manual that comes with it, and load and use the dishwasher like it was desi...
txt:
Bottom line, read the manual that comes with it, and load and use the dishwasher like it was designed for, and you won't be disappointed.

After extensive and somewhat obsessive analysis of reviews both here at Home Depot and on Consumer Reports, I almost didn't buy this because of some common themes the negative reviews had. A sale and a coupon convinced me to take a leap however, and my fears have been so far unfounded and after about a month of use, this dishwasher works far better than any previous dishwasher I've ever had. 

As the first dishwasher I've ever installed, I can only advise to read the instructions, and if in doubt or they don't make sense at the time, follow them anyway, and it will become clear once you do what it says.  

Now to address some of the complaints previous purchasers have mentioned.  First off, the lack of a heating element to dry the dishes seems to cause some people problems, and frankly it was hard for me to get my head around the idea.  I've now tried all the cycles and all of them seem to work very well, even the 60 minute fast cycle (which is only for lightly soiled dishes, by the way).  The default cycle is Auto, without the Extra Dry option turned on, which uses an optical sensor to see how dirty the water is and adjusts the run time accordingly.  That is the one I use most, but there will be a little water left on top of cups if they aren't tilted, but that was the same with my old dishwasher.  With Extra Dry on, there isn't even that, and even plastic is dry unless you have something turned up the wrong way.  

So what's the secret?  Let the dishwasher do it's job the way it is designed to do it, and don't mess with it until it's done.  That means after it's finished washing, which is 2 hours 9 minutes on Auto with no other options (2:30 with Extra Dry on), LEAVE IT ALONE.  Do NOT open the door and let the steam out like some have said.  In fact, I usually let it sit for another 2 hours for good measure.  After that, put away your very clean and very dry dishes.  There is a heating element that super heats the final rinse water to heat up the dishes, which then causes the water to condense on the stainless tub and is then pulled off the dishes. Letting the steam out defeats the purpose, and opening the door too soon interrupts the process. 

Also, the use of a rinse aid like Jet Dry is a requirement for this dishwasher to work as it is designed.  

Second, there were some complaints about the display staying on, flimsy doors, etc.  The manual tells you how to reprogram a lot of settings and turn them on or off.  You can even alter the amount of rinse aid that gets dispensed, how long the display stays on after it finishes, and more.  As far as the door being flimsy - if you take it and try and flex it without the dishwasher being attached, it does seem a bit flimsy.  For comparison, I tried flexing my 20 year old Kenmore dishwasher door after I pulled it out, and it was even more flimsy - and it probably weighed less than this Bosch.

This is NOT a dishwasher for you if you are in a hurry, but if you work with it instead of against it, it works fantastic. I can probably put 50% more in this dishwasher than my previous one, and have even put in some really baked on and dried on food dishes, and it works amazingly well.  The adjustable top rack and the utensil tray are fantastic options, and I just removed the regular utensil caddy from the bottom rack entirely and only use the top tray now.

The only negatives were a minor scorched rubber smell when you open the door that has slowly dissipated over the past month, and there was a tiny scratch on the door when I unpacked it - which I simply fixed with a tiny touch of white enamel paint; you can't even tell it was ever there.  

Oh, and this thing is so quiet, I had to put my ear against the door to even tell if it was spraying.  There is a very low faint hum that comes from it that may bother some people sensitive to low frequencies, but that's a stretch, and could be affected by the flooring it is installed on.  Sorry for the long review, but I hope it helps someone with making a choice.

title: Bosch Dishwasher 300 Series - wimpy baskets
txt: I love everything about this dishwasher EXCEPT the silverware basket.  I looked at ALL of the models in the lineup at multiple stores.  All Bosch models (high & low) have TINY baskets vs. the competition.  Why would a company go to such lengths to manufacturer the BEST dishwasher and then put cut corners on such an inexpensive part?? txt: Where should I even begin ... this happens to be my second Bosch dishwasher. My first Bosch dishwasher lasted over 15 years. I was told that the average life of a dishwasher is anywhere from 7 to 10 years so the Bosch brand certainly speaks for itself. I can go on and on about my new Bosch dishwasher -- here are  important, self-selling facts:  I know to only expect the highest durability, the best, truly excellent performance factor, easiest directions for operation,  and the quietest decibel level while in operation. The saying is, "you get your money's worth" well I certainly did!! Please do not hesitate to purchase your own Bosch dishwasher today. You will get the utmost satisfaction from your Bosch dishwasher purchase. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Bosch is the best
txt: So quite you hardly know it’s running!! Works greater and my dishes are super clean!!! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Overrated but ok. It's a dishwasher. It does a good job of making dishes shine but I put in clean...
txt:
Overrated but ok. It's a dishwasher. It does a good job of making dishes shine but I put in clean dishes.  (Why? I wouldn't put garbage in a sink full of dishwater, either.)  It isn't easy to figure out the best placement for the varied sizes of plates and bowls. I also can't figure out how to fill rinse dispenser as it seems to leak out as I pour it in. I still have to call Bosch about that. 

The unit did not fit particularly well into same space occupied by three previous dishwashers. Installers didn't really care, and left a required new outlet box on floor of the cabinet under the sink instead of screwing it to wall, where it would have fit. 

Neither the side trim nor kick plate covers gaps between walls of dishwasher space, especially below the door hinge. The kick plate is small and installed with black screws although the appliance and plate are white.  Other Bosch dishwashers seem to have plates that click on the dishwasher, but that wasn't something I would or could have checked when I ordered it yes 

I went to Home Depot with pictures in evening after install. They said they'd contact the installer to correct issues.  The sales person followed up with a reassuring phone call the next day but it's been a week and we've heard nothing else. That's probably ok since we don't want Mario and Luigi trying to fix their own work.

title: Very Satisfied with Bosch 300 Series Dishwasher
txt: This seems to be a very nice dishwasher; it operates very quietly and has given us no problem in the 6 weeks we have had it.  But, the shortest wash cycle we can set is for 1 hour and 30 minutes.  We wish there was a shorter wash cycle.  Although we followed the manual's directions for programming the shut off time, we could never get it to work.  It just stays on after the wash cycle is finished until we hit the off switch.  This is a minor complaint and is of no real importance.  It does a really great job of washing and drying the dishes.  Couldn't be done better!

title: I installed this dishwasher myself a little over a month ago. So far, so good. This is a nice dis...
txt:
I installed this dishwasher myself a little over a month ago. So far, so good. This is a nice dishwasher and I hope it lasts at least as long a the old Whirlpool it replaced.
Pros:
-Easy installation (as long as you have space in the adjacent cabinet for the power junction box)
-Clear instructions
-Extremely quiet operation
-Straightforward controls with real buttons
-Good capacity and flexibility for arranging the dishes and cutlery
-The third upper rack is pretty handy for small items
-Racks seem sturdy--moreso that a lot of other models I looked at--with good coating
-Nice aesthetics and thoughtful design
Cons:
-Leaves quite a bit of residual water unless you use the Extra Dry or Sanitize wash options
-Can get somewhat smelly in between washes (the quick rinse feature helps with this)
-The need to use a rinse agent per instructions is something I've never had to do this with any dishwasher I've used in the past
-Somewhat expensive--I think I could have been just as happy with the slightly louder Bosch model that doesn't have the third rack which was a couple hundred less--but if it lasts, the extra initial outlay will have been long forgotten.
-I was fortunate that the adjacent base cabinet had *just* enough space to mount the power junction box behind the drawers--I can imagine this requirement could complicate some installations.

title: So far after one day of use I like this dishwasher. I test ran it before pushing it into the cab...
txt: So far after one day of use I like this dishwasher. I test ran it before pushing it into the cabinet and it was quieter than than our old one and we can barely tell its on now that it is in the cabinet. I bought Bosh because of the Aquastop leak detection system as i am in the process of replacing my wood floors from the previous dishwashers leak. This dishwasher has an "ON?OFF" button which is a bit confusing to me as none of my other kitchen appliances have this. The top band of the appliance which contains the handle is plastic across the entire width of the unit which i am disappointed about.. Installation was a challenge near the end (I installed myself) because the feet on the front are difficult to rotate even with no weight on them and there is no space for a tool (to work around this lower the feet to be flush with the bottom of the unit prior to install within the cabinet.). Also, if you want to INSTALL YOURSELF have it DELIVERED ON A WEEK DAY, because the Bosch INSTALLATION HELP LINE IS ONLY OPEN MONDAY - FRIDAY. That said, if I needed install assistance or if my unit was broken it would have to be reported to the manufacturer, THEREFORE ITS BETTER TO HAVE HOME DEPOT INSTALL IT SO IF SOMETHING GOES WRONG IN THE FIRS 24-48 HRS HOME DEPOT HAS TO FIX IT. I wish the Home Depot sales lady would have told me both of those things.

title: This is the one!
txt: This is the one my wife wanted and was highly recommended by family that has one as well. The first time I started it I had to put my hand on it to  be sure that it was running, it really is that quiet! I have had no issues with this one so far and am very happy with this choice. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Everything promised about it is great. Fast quiet thorough wash. The longest it takes even on the...
txt:
Everything promised about it is great. Fast quiet thorough wash. The longest it takes even on the heavy cycle with extra dry is about 2.5 hours, as opposed to 4 hours on some brands. T

I wish the top rack would adjust easier, it can be difficult to maneuver.

It has strangely-angled tines. The photos in the instructions don't do a good job of illustrating how to load the bottom rack dishes with the oddly angled tines.I can't tell from the official Bosch You tube videos, either. The dishes can be slanted two ways, and one way angles them upward. If I slant them downward, they tend to "clamshell." 

Better illustrations in the instructions would be helpful.

The third rack is a great must-have.

I've had to replace every dishwasher in the last four houses I have owned, and this one is by far, the best!

title: Very good Dishwasher
txt:
I researched and found this to be a really nice working quiet machine .
Some of the loading choices could be better but satisfactory 
Installed it which was handy having the plug attached to a junction box already 
The machine work very good and am very happy about spending the time to research and go through the deal to get this 
Would buy  the same if given the choice over again ! 
Don’t even notice it running and my house is an open floor plan 
Get one !! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Is exceptionally quiet and cleans dishes very well.
txt: Is exceptionally quiet and cleans dishes very well.

title: I rarely write product reviews, but I feel compelled to this time because you NEED TO KNOW how gr...
txt:
I rarely write product reviews, but I feel compelled to this time because you NEED TO KNOW how great this dishwasher is. Disclaimers: I might have been more blown away because prior to installing this, I dealt with a dishwasher-less kitchen for 18 months, but I am well familiar with dishwashers, having had the luxury of one for 95% of my entire life. Also, we've been using it for about three weeks at this juncture, so the longevity of it is not something I can address yet.

In any case, from a looks perspective - of course, it's beautiful. I bought the white front-control one because I like white appliances, but in the store, the other colors were just as attractive.

All of its claims are true. I have found that you truly do not need to rinse the dishes. I have never pulled a dish out that was dirty. In fact, I tested the lengths of what it can do yesterday when I put a peanut butter-covered butter knife in there without getting the peanut butter off first. I put it in the top rack, and it was spotless when I pulled it out. I have never encountered that before.

It is so quiet, that sometimes we cannot tell when it is running. It is very water and electricity efficient. It does a really decent job of drying the dishes due to the stainless steel tub. If you upgrade to glass tupperware even better.

My fiance and I were talking the other day and we both were like, why would anyone even spend additional money on the more expensive models? This one is the best, so if you're a little hesitant to buy the 300, know that from my perspective, I can't imagine it doing anything any better.

title: Love it!
txt: After searching and reading reviews to buy my first dishwasher I decided to get this Bosch, it’s been about two months using it and so far I love it. It does its job cleaning and drying, though this the first one I own, I have used other ones in my previous jobs and did not like them, that is why I did make my research and found this one. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: GREAT purchase!
txt: I recently researched my options for a new dishwasher and found the Bosch Recessed Handle 300 series to be my best option.  All options I needed and more were found.  In addition, the high quality materials I desired and ease of installation were exceeded!  The quiet operation and enormous room for all of my dishes has shocked me and I wondered why I waited to so long to make this purchase.  I struggled because I had other brand name appliances in my kitchen but I would hands down make the decision to choose Bosch for my future appliances!  GREAT purchase and a Bosch customer for life! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Beautiful and SOOOO quiet!!!
txt: I am new to BOSCH producTs and purchased this dishwasher on recommendation from my sister who owns a Bosch. I am so glad I listened to her! It is soooo quiet and so pretty.  I love that it has some black on the display because I’m beginning to have to replace other appliances due to age and it goes with my black appliances.  Couldn’t ask for cleaner or drier dishes! Love it!! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Dishwasher looks great. Very quiet. It replaced a 20 year old whirlpool. Only problem I had was ...
txt: Dishwasher looks great. Very quiet. It replaced a 20 year old whirlpool. Only problem I had was that the installers sent out by Home Depot would not do the install because the water valve is located behind the dishwasher. I got my plumber to do the install and he was slightly cheaper, but now I have to haul away the old dishwasher myself.

title: Beautiful dishwasher! Runs very quietly (I forget I have it running, except for the red light ind...
txt: Beautiful dishwasher! Runs very quietly (I forget I have it running, except for the red light indicator), holds much more than our ancient dishwasher, and cleans thoroughly! Very pleased with it!

title: Easy to install, runs very quiet and cleans dishes very well.
txt: Easy to install, runs very quiet and cleans dishes very well.

title: Great features, so quiet, clean dishes!
txt: We updated our kitchen in March. Originally we we were planning on a different different brand, so glad we went with Bosch. This dishwasher has a stainless steel tub, it is more durable than our previous two dishwashers. It has a lot of features that we have not even used all of them yet. The biggest selling point for us was the utensil rack on the top. It is awesome. No stupid basket to deal with or take up space. The second rack is adjustable. We had some taller glasses and it was easy to lower the rack to make the fit. It is so quiet, you need to open the door to see if it is running. We really love this dishwasher. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Only had this dishwasher for a little over a month now but it is awesome!!! Dishes come out dry ...
txt: Only had this dishwasher for a little over a month now but it is awesome!!! Dishes come out dry and clean and I only use the 'Normal" cycle. The racks are great. Love the top rack for utensils also. Only thing is my Gatorade bottles are getting warped where the lid doesn't fit anymore but that's ok. Dishwasher is the quietest one I have ever owned and the noise of one never bothered me either but now I wonder if it's running because I can't hear it. Lights on the front are exactly what I like too so that when I am passing by I can check the time left. 5 stars so far!!!

title: Bought this dishwasher to replace 10-year-old Bosch that was having serious issues. I installed i...
txt:
Bought this dishwasher to replace 10-year-old Bosch that was having serious issues. I installed it myself (as I did the original), not quite plug-n-play as the new Bosch comes with an electrical junction box you have to mount under the sink, connecting the household wiring to the Bosch-provided appliance plug. I mistakenly forgot to remove the water line adapter from the old unit before they hauled it off, so had to buy another (few bucks at local hardware). Also had an issue adjusting the leveling "foot" at the rear of the dishwasher that you raise and lower via a threaded control in the front after the dishwasher is installed under the cabinet, either mine maxed out before I got the unit perfectly level or something is funky with my cabinet or floor (entirely possible!). But it's close enough that it looks fine.

Operationally, it's similar to the old Bosch but with some noticeable differences. Definitely quieter. Also makes different types of noises and seems to have more complex cycles. I typically use the AUTO setting, which takes about 2.5 hours. Tried the 60 minute setting also (the short cycle on the old Bosch was 30 minutes). Dishes come out clean. We're using Ecover powder, just switched after having issues with previous brand. 

Stainless interior is very nice. Racks seem to hold more than the old Bosch. Huge silverware holder. Comes with a third rack that goes in the very top, haven't used that one yet.

Seems like a solid unit. Time will tell. So far so good. Will give it a good cleaning with LemiShine dishwasher cleaner once a month, that really seems to help with odors, accumulated mineral deposits, general grime, and clogged spray arms.

title: I have owned and used the Bosch 300 series tall tub dishwasher with front control for just over f...
txt:
I have owned and used the Bosch 300 series tall tub dishwasher with front control for just over five weeks now, and so far I'm impressed and satisfied with its performance. The features I like the most are that it's very quiet at 44 dB. You can hardly hear it running. According to a chart I found, most dishwashers have a dB rating of 75-80; the silverware basket with its odd-size openings, which is great for inserting my thick-handled silverware; the hidden handle on the door; no more stick-out door handle (which admittedly was useful for hanging a hand towel, however, I found a suction-cup hook on the door holds a hand towel just as well); and the magnetic surface of the door. I'm not sure if it's the fact that its magnetic, but it doesn't tend to collect water droplets. On two previous stainless steel dishwashers I owned, the stainless steel (non-magnetic) doors tended to collect water droplets (from accidental sprayings from the kitchen faucet since the dishwasher is located right next to the sink) which caused streaky runs, which over time caused discoloration of the stainless steel surface. I have noticed that has not been happening with the door on this dishwasher, which is definitely a plus for me. 
As far as the dishwashing performance, I'm satisfied. Sure, there have been a few occasions where some dishes (mostly large utensils in the 3rd uppermost rack) didn't get entirely clean, possibly due to the fact that I didn't position them correctly, but for the most part my dishes have come out sparkling clean and dry. It is recommended to use rinse aid at all times, which helps to leave dishes spot-free as well as improves drying performance. The control panel will light up when more rinse aid needs to be added, so the dishwasher never has to run out of this. Bosch also recommends using the Finish brand of dishwasher detergent. 
There are four main programs: Heavy, Auto, Normal, and Speed60, and several extra options, which are Rinse (for pre-rinsing dishes, useful if dirty dishes sit in the dishwasher for several hours and to reduce odors) Delay Start, Sanitize (for baby bottles, chopping boards, canning jars, etc.), Half-Load (for smaller, lightly soiled loads; uses less water), and Extra-Dry. Be mindful that the Sanitize and Extra-Dry options increase program cycle time and also use more energy. 
The control panel is easy to operate with light push buttons (not touch control). The digital display is in bright red, which I find a bit garish (light blue or green would've been preferable), but fortunately this is only visible when the dishwasher is turned on and running. 
The third rack is useful for placing large cooking tools and serving utensils which don't really fit in the silverware basket, unless you flip up the lid, or you can use this rack to place silverware instead of/or in addition to using the silverware basket . The middle rack is can be lowered or raised with the Rackmatic function, and it also has small cup shelves (which can be folded up) as well as foldable flip tines. The bottom rack also has foldable flip tines. 
The dishwasher comes with a very detailed instruction booklet. Of course, it includes a section on care and maintenance as well as troubleshooting. The dishwasher comes with a 365 day warranty from the date of purchase and includes defects in materials and workmanship. 
I had my dishwasher installed professionally and the process seemed to be problem-free for the installers. Be aware that because Bosch is a European brand, this dishwasher comes with a separate electrical supply junction box. So it doesn't plug directly into your outlet, it first plugs into the junction box which is then plugged into a standard 120v outlet. It is recommended that this junction box be attached in an accessible cabinet next to your dishwasher, not behind the dishwasher itself.

title: I wrote one before but don’t see option to edit, so writing update. I love this dishwasher. Looks...
txt:
I wrote one before but don’t see option to edit, so writing update. I love this dishwasher. Looks great and works great. Its been 3 weeks since I bought it. When I run it for 2+ hrs the default one, even the dried up dishes like my lunch box get cleaned but 60min quick clean didn’t clean it well. So silent I run it in the night sometimes. In my 2 bed condo I don’t even notice it’s running. Top tray for big spoons is very useful. I buy the recommended pods.
Bought it from Reston,VA store. Mac is a great guy, he said he was not from Appliances section but very knowledgeable, explained all well, took my order and scheduled installation effeciently. Very customer oriented. 
On the whole, I am a happy customer with a warranty for 4yrs in my hand

title: There are places on the internet that really dis Bosch dishwashers, so I wanted to write a review...
txt:
There are places on the internet that really dis Bosch dishwashers, so I wanted to write a review of my experience, which is all positive.  This is the second Bosch dishwasher I have had, so my experience is not just with this one.  

I think the criticism comes from 1) customers who get a dishwasher that doesn't work, or breaks down soon after installation and 2) customers who want the dishwasher to perform like the noisy, energy-inefficient models that existed in previous years.  Bosch has certain goals with their product that may not agree with what other manufacturers produce.  My needs match what Bosch manufactures.

Above all, this is the quietest dishwasher I have ever had, even quieter than the more expensive Bosch I had before.  After sweating out a lengthy and difficult installation (not related to the dishwasher but to my particular situation in the kitchen), I loaded it up and turned it on with dirty dishes.  I was frustrated and angry that the dishwasher did not appear to be working.  The dishwasher that was replaced (not a Bosch) made all kinds of sounds (spraying water, clicks in the control mechanism, pump noises) and I used this to determine if the dishwasher was running.  After pushing buttons and cursing for several hours, I finally determined that the Bosch I had just installed was indeed working!  It was so quiet that I simply could not hear it.

Without modifying the controls set out of the box, dishes do have a slight moisture on them.  I don't have any problem with this at all, and I know that I am saving $$$ by not having an extended drying period at the end.  This can be reset, and I am experimenting with that now.

In that first load I put in some dishes that had dried on ketchup and mustard, peanut butter, dried coffee stains, etc., and all came out perfectly clean.  Magic!

In reviews on other sites, I heard tell of the fact that the water connection on the dishwasher was some weird type that the individual installing could not find a matching fitting for.  So, I ordered the installation kit.  In fact, the supply tubing they supplied had the same fittings as every other dishwasher in the universe, a 3/8" fine pitch type used on your standard supply valve.  It appears this is a non-issue.

I did have one slight issue with the installation kit I purchased.  The tubing is about 6' long, and I needed about 8'.  Rather than purchasing a longer supply hose, I simply used a 2' piece of copper tubing I had to extend the supply hose across the back of the dishwasher, terminating at the right back corner.  The flexible hose then continued to the outlet under the sink, and gave me the flexibility I needed to get the dishwasher in and out during installation.

At this point, I have no complaints whatsoever.  This is a beautiful dishwasher, even though it is in the mid-range of their models.

title: Unique and Quiet
txt:
Unlike any other dishwasher I've ever seen (but I really don't get out much... just kidding!) I've installed more than my fair share of dishwashers in my time but this was a new experience. The entire machine including all the components normally visible underneath are in an entirely sealed enclosure. I assume this is to help reduce noise. 

Because of this, the power and water supply connections are at the rear (see photos) which I thought was convenient until I discovered this presented some installation challenges which might require drilling new holes in the cabinet side wall and some electrical circuit juggling since power must be connected using their supplied proprietary cord and junction box... if the existing wiring (receptacle or hard wire cable) is in the dishwasher cavity it will have to be rerouted out into the adjacent cabinet to be connected to the supplied junction box which will in turn send the power back to the washer with its special plug. There simply isn't enough room in most dishwasher cutouts for their junction box. Checking for water connection leaks is also challenging since once the dishwasher is installed the water line connection is absolutely not visible because of the sealed enclosure. For the first few days I left the front skirt off the front bottom so I could check for the presence of water seeping out. No problems so far so I'm confident all is good.

Machine has only three leveling feet... two in the front and one in the rear middle. The two front feet are individually adjustable but once the machine is level, a special screw located between the two feet can raise or lower the front of the machine without disturbing the relationship set by the individual adjustments... someone burned midnight oil dreaming this up.

Too many features to list them all so here are some highlights:
• RackMatic – An adjustable upper rack with three different height levels
• 24/7 AquaStop – A redesigned base meant to contain leaks, complete with a sensor and pump that will shut down the dishwasher and drain water if a leak should occur at any time, not just when the dishwasher is in use
• New 3rd Rack – All Bosch dishwashers get a 3rd rack, and they've been tweaked to fit more than just silverware
• Speed60 Cycle – A quick cycle that's designed to clean and dry in about an hour (a few models feature a less-intense half-hour Clean30 cycle for less-soiled dishes)
• ExtraDry – Raises temperatures during the drying phase for improved moisture evaporation... I did discover that if you simply leave the door closed until the machine cools off (might be a few hours if you have the time) using the standard cycles the dishes will be much drier due to the evaporative style of drying this machine uses unlike most other types of dishwashers for which opening the door when the cycle ends results in air-drying to speed things up
• FlexSpace Tines – Most 300 Series dishwashers have a redesigned adjustable tine format for easier loading of thicker dishes, including adjustable tines on both the upper and lower racks.
• EasyGlide Wheels – Both upper and lower racks slide in and out more smoothly

Last but not least, the wife thinks this washer is "sexy" but I was afraid to ask her if it was more or less than I am... upon reflection I've decided that sometimes ignorance is a good thing [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Very nice! If you're looking for a great looking, super-quiet dishwasher, this is the one. This w...
txt: Very nice! If you're looking for a great looking, super-quiet dishwasher, this is the one. This washer replaced a 15 year old Whirlpool that I had quite a few problems with over the years. Replaced two main boards on it as well as the heating element. Luckily, I'm a big DYI-er, so I was able to replace them myself saving tons of $$ for labor. First off, I must say, Bosch has AMAZING customer service. After ordering this dishwasher, I received two separate calls from Bosch letting me know the details on how/when my new dishwasher will be delivered and installed. Very kind. Comforting to know in the event I need to contact them in the future. Second, the installation co. was courteous, professional, reliable and efficient. The first thing I noticed after running the dishwasher for the first time was that it's SUPER quiet! After pressing the START button, I literally could not hear the water filling into the tank. Very strange at first. I actually pressed the Stop button, and then started it again to make sure it was actually running. WOW! After the load finished, I was quite pleased with the cleaning results. So far, we've done about 4 full loads using Finish brand Quantum packs. The dishes come out clean and smelling fresh each time. I've noticed (like my old washer) that it's best to use the Extra Dry setting if you want glasses and plastic storage containers to come out more dry after the cycle is done. -- which I'm fine with. The drawers have a good amount of room for dishes, and I love how the height of the top rack can be adjusted up/down a few inches to compensate for taller glasses. It also has a slim rack above that which is great for flat items like additional silverware or larger cooking spoons. The buttons are "push-button" style, which I prefer much more over the "touch" display type. Initially, I was thinking that the timer indicator was showing long washing times (2+ hours), but recently discovered that the timer includes the drying time as well, so the actual wash time is only about 1.5 hours - if that. I'm very happy so far. Functionality, operation, ease of use, etc. Another big plus is that it looks absolutely beautiful in our kitchen. Very nice "flush-mount" design and the stainless finish looks durable and sleek. Give this one a try. It would be hard to say anything negative about it. After all, it is a "Bosch." From what I hear, they are the best in the biz when it comes to dishwashers. Looking forward to having this one for many years to come.

title: So far, so good! Loading the Bosch is very easy. There is quite a bit of room and a sink full of ...
txt:
So far, so good! Loading the Bosch is very easy. There is quite a bit of room and a sink full of dishes fit with minimal effort. I also decided to try out how well it would wash really dirty dishes by placing some more difficult to wash items in the tub, and it completed the job without any issues. Five stars from this mother of 3 dragons and hater of dishes.

The detergent receptacle closes easily. There was no remaining detergent or residue after the cycle completed. 

The Bosch is very easy to operate and self explanatory. There is little noise while it is in operation and, therefore, does not contribute to the low roar that is already happening in the kitchen with a busy family. 

I had no issues with the drying cycle. I don't often use the drying cycle, but I may actually start to with the Bosch as it was very useful and completed the job thoroughly. Recommended!

title: Amazing DW- first Bosch will never settle for less
txt: I bought this DW and could not be happier! A dishwasher should take egg off dishes, My Bosch does. I never pre rinse because I don’t have to. It’s so quiet, it took retraining my husband to look at the display to see if it was actually running. the third rack for silverware is constantly used. For unloading , I just grab all the spoons, forks and knives. They can’t next so no food pieces on them. I have told so many people about my GREAT dishwasher. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Very quiet. Cleans well. Only owned it for a month....
txt: Very quiet. Cleans well. Only owned it for a month. Hoping for good longevity.

title: I've owned this dishwasher for less than a month. The...
txt: I've owned this dishwasher for less than a month. The washing itself is good, and we've had no issues in that department. However, we always hand wash anything tough. The PureDry feature is lackluster. Pools of water remain, regardless of the amount of plastic ware present. The washing itself is quiet, but the drain pump kicks on like a fire hose and drowns out any other sound nearby. It is quite loud. Overall, I would not recommend this unit for the money we spent. We only hope that the unit lasts a long time to make up for the annoyances.

title: does not dry dishes very well
txt: does not dry dishes very well

title: We have been using the dishwasher for a couple weeks now. I'm amazed at how QUIET it is. It d...
txt: We have been using the dishwasher for a couple weeks now. I'm amazed at how QUIET it is. It does a very good job (and neither my wife nor I had to learn a new language)!

title: Most quiet and versatile machine yet!
txt: I love the third rack and the half load option. I have recommended this machine to several family members. I love the silverware being up top and being able to remove basket permanently for more dishes. Racks adjust in so many ways(more tines, less tines, wine glass row, up, down and out). It is so quiet we can sit right by it and watch tv. We have had it for a year now.  COVID safe with sanitizer.

title: Easy to install, very sharp looking. It’s extremely quiet. Sometimes...
txt: Easy to install, very sharp looking. It’s extremely quiet. Sometimes we wonder if it is even on. It does have a red light that let you know when it’s working and it shut off when the cycle is done. We are very happy with the product!!

title: Pure Garbage
txt: Every time we need to use it, we have to reset it & cross our fingers, that it completes a complete cycle. Contacted Home Depot as soon as we started having problems & they said they have a 48-hour window, to accept returns, so too bad, because they won't stand behind the JUNK, that they sell, regardless of us buying the service plan. Called the factory & they gave us some dummy's phone number, which took a week, to get around to showing up. Then he said I didn't read the directions, on how to reset it, if it gives us problems, which I told him we were already doing this, because the auto sensor mode, doesn't work, so we are FORCED to have to reset it, to use the normal selection EVERY TIME, and cross our fingers & hope it completes that cycle because it won't let me select ANY cycle, without having to reset it. The mechanic wouldn't even stick around to watch it cycle, so we are basically SCREWED!!

title: Bosch 300 had error code after installed. Home Depot installers...
txt: Bosch 300 had error code after installed. Home Depot installers did not do anything about it, said I needed to call Bosch. That was a Friday. After calling Bosch and finding out it would take 10 days for service, I decided to contact Home Depot to cancel the order and get another dishwasher from another company. Too late, Monday morning was outside Home Depot’s 48 hour return window. What a pain in the Butt. Never again

title: I have run the dishwasher 4 times and in all...
txt: I have run the dishwasher 4 times and in all cases the dishes remained  dirty , absolutely no drying and the Finish tablets used were found at the bottom of the dishwasher almost 80% whole.   Contacted customer service.   Was told to increase the hot water temp on my hotter heater,  Did that.  Did not work. Called another customer service rep and was told to get service.   Not available till January 2021.   Did give me a name of an independent service contractor who will be here Nov 24th.   I am broken hearted as I thought Bosch had a great reputation.

Home Deport CS: It was a big mess, a lot of problems and the worst CS of all time. 3 or 4 delivery dates were moved to different dates. A new order was created on 08/14/20, delivery was on 10/06/20. So there was no dishwasher from 05/26/20 to 10/06/20.

Very well designed and manufactured dishwasher.

When it was delivered the young man told me I would not be disappointed with it and he was right.  I have used it everyday, sometimes twice a day since I bought it.  Have not regretted my decision in the least!!

title: Its extremely quiet and lots of room for dishes. However...
txt: Its extremely quiet and lots of room for dishes. However it does not really dry the dishes which was a big disappoint. I added quickly dry solution and the extra dry cycle and it didnt change the amount of water still left on the dishes.

title: In a normal time I could have walked into Home...
txt:
In a normal time I could have walked into Home Depot and bought this dishwasher. But, it's covid-19 time, so it took about six weeks after I ordered to get it built and delivered.

That is my only complaint. I installed the dishwasher and it is OUTSTANDING. It is absolutely the most quiet dishwasher I've ever (not) heard.  It's not completely inaudible, but it does not interfere with TV or radio at all like all my past dishwashers did.

the design is smart. The adjustable top rack was something I used multiple times in the first week, and the top row of silverware rack is THE BOMB.  It frees up so much space, and I think the silverware in that top rack gets cleaner.

Love it, love it, love it.

title: Good, but even with extra dry feature dishes are wet...
txt: Good, but even with extra dry feature dishes are wet

title: Bosch 300 series-its ok
txt: This dishwasher replaced my Bosch Ascenta model that was giving us so many issues. I researched and read about the top dishwasher models and Bosch was always on top . This model seems smaller in size, I removed the cutlery basket on the bottom rack to make more room . I use the top third rack for cutlery and small utensils. It's very quiet when it's running , but when it's draining it's very loud . The red info light that's supposed to show on the kitchen floor never worked from day one . Cleaning is ok , I was expecting better performance for a dishwasher of this brand and cost , and I do use Finish detergent and rinse aid .Overall I'd give it an 7.5 /10 [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: 300 Series Performance
txt: Great cleaning performance. Extremely quiet during entire wash cycle. My only issue is the green "Clean" LED does not light at end of any cycle. Hopefully, Bosch will schedule a repair date for this issue. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Not ecstatic
txt: The third rack for silverware is great but no place to put measuring spoons. Because of the design, I can't always fit small bowls and plates in the dishware rack. Only one wine glass per load will fit due to a bad alignment between fold-down stem holder and area where the balance of the glass rests. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Not ecstatic

Only one wine glass per load will fit due to a bad alignment between fold-down stem holder and area where the balance of the glass rests. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: love door front controls
txt: The previous washer had the controls on the top edge of the door. It is the worst place to place them. Every time you close the door touching the control touch pad was imposible to avoid causing inadvertent cycle changes. Love the third shelf. Do wish the tines had two rowes of alternate fold down tines for more fry pan placement. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Everything I expected it to do and more.
txt:
This machine is so much quieter, and cleans much better than our old Kenmore. We typically do not use the drying feature, so I can't comment on that. But dishes come out quite warm and quickly evaporate the water.
We also do not need to pre-wash the dishes any longer, as this machine does such a great job of removing any minor food residue that might remain. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Bosch Dishwasher
txt: The dishwasher is very quiet and cleans the dishes well.  We are happy with it and hope to buy another Bosch appliance when needed.

title: Great dishwasher - very quiet and cleans thoroughly. I dropped...
txt: Great dishwasher - very quiet and cleans thoroughly. I dropped one star because of the amount of water remaining on the wall of the tub after it’s finished, seems like a lot.

title: Quiet and efficient.
txt: Love the options we have especially a quicker cycle and the delay option.  The top tray fits silverware, utensils and small bowls.  It is easy to load and can handle a large load. And, very quiet!

title: New dishwasher
txt:
it will be a critical review, so don't be discouraged.
The third rack was a selling point, but results are mixed, utensils not that clean sometimes. It cuts space from the second rack. It is removable and it's a good thing.

The auto washing cycle is lacking, dishes not always clean, but Normal and Heavy works fine.

it is quite, very quite.
longevity, yet to be seen [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: "Is this thing on?"
txt:
I feel like a comic flopping in a stand up club.  "Is this thing on?"  Seriously.  The only thing that I hear is when water drains into my disposal.  AND my Corelle bowls fit.  I actually took my dishes to the store to see which model was practical and things FIT.  

I am not having success selecting all the options as listed in the quick start guide, but dishes are coming clean in the 60 minute short wash.  2 loads in.

title: very quiet but does not dry dishes well
txt: Washes very well and is very quiet, but doen't dry very well  Dishes require additional drying even after "extra dry" cycle. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Cleans well
txt: We had a GE dishwasher that broke down after just 5 years. Reviews on Bosch were good, so we are trying it. One month in so far and we are very pleased with how well it cleans. I like having the countdown timer on the front panel so I know how long until the wash is finished. Whether it lasts a long time, we'll have to wait and see. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Bosch dishwasher
txt: Very nice. It's quiet and efficient. Love the upper silverware rack. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Good machine

title: Bosch 300 is Great
txt: It is a wonderful improvement over the previous dishwasher that we had for only 8 years until it broke. The Bosch cleans everything thouroughly, and we only use the Speed60 setting. Bravo! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: So far, amazing!
txt: So far we are loving our dishwasher. We've had it for about a month and it's the quietest one we have ever owned. It cleans and dries so well and we could not be happier with the decision. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: This dishwasher replaced an 11 year old Bosch dishwasher, which...
txt: This dishwasher replaced an 11 year old Bosch dishwasher, which was leaving a film on the dishes.  It turned out the problem was not the dishwasher, but our water softener, which had stopped working.  So it turns out we replaced it prematurely.  The new dishwasher was also leaving a film until we figured out the problem with the water softener.  Water softener was fixed, and now the dishwasher works perfectly.  We always run the cycles with Extra Dry, and do not have a problem with dishes getting adequately dry (but not perfectly dry).  One criticism I have is that the cutlery basket is very large, thus taking up a lot of space.  Our previous Bosch had a basket that was in two pieces, so you could choose to use just one piece and save space.  With the third top rack, we find the basket is superfluous, so we do not use it, or we use the smaller one saved from the prior dishwasher.  Lesson learned- water quality, i.e. softness, plays a significant role in dishwasher functioning.  If I had hard water and no softener, I would choose a dishwasher that had the ability to accept salt for softening.

title: Extra dry always required
txt: This dishwasher is very quiet and seems to run very smoothly. Dishes are clean, but are only dry if the Extra Dry feature is selected. Bottom rack has rather narrow slots for the dishes and bowls are a pain to organize - not sure if the valuable real estate of the bottom rack is most efficiently designed. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Love it
txt:
It's everything that I expected. 
It's very quiet, don't even know that it is running. Cleans very well [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Pretty great with some minor design oddities
txt: This is a great machine. The installation adjustments are clever and easily used once you figure it out. It cleans incredibly well. I am a fan of the third flatware rack at the top. This leads me to my only real criticism. The bottom rack has a very large kitchen tool holder that ordinarily would be used for flatware. It uses up a lot of territory. I have removed it but there really isn't a good way to stack bowls or dishes or really much over there without moving a lot of things around. Also, it is quiet but not as quiet as advertised...I checked with a sound meter. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Quiet, Efficient and Amazing!
txt: I'm so glad we invested in a Bosch dishwasher. We run it 1-2 times/day and it is so quiet! We used to have to wait for our old dishwasher to stop running before we could listen to music or watch TV, because it was so loud! It was a bit of a learning curve (figuring out the rinse aid, what sanitizing does, etc.) but once we figured out the details, all went smoothly. I hightly recommend Bosch products! txt: Installation was easy (I did it myself). Dishwasher is perfoming as expected but we're still learning how to load the dishes since the racks are totally different than the old Kenmore it replaced. The tray at the top isn't quite as useful as we'd hoped for silverware since it doesn't come out as easily as the bottom silverware basket when unloading the diswasher. But it IS quiet!!! title: Perfect performance
txt:
Sparkles and clean dishes all around. Dishes are really hot when it's done and the cycle is really quiet. We have mainly used the 60 min cycle and it's perfectly capable of doing a great job. The several racks are useful for different items. The rinse aid creates dry and spot free dishes. 
A user manual beyond the quick start guide would have helped me figure some things out more quickly than by trial and error. I believe there is probably one online. With 10 people in our family I run the dishwasher multiple times a day and I no longer have to worry about them being spotted with junk when I take them out. I'm excited to load and unload the dishwasher now. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: I'ts SUPER quiet, let me just start by saying that. its the MAIN reason we bought it. It does a d...

I'ts SUPER quiet, let me just start by saying that. its the MAIN reason we bought it.
It does a decent job of cleaning, the 3rd rack is pretty cool and usefull.
Myonly critique is the front panel and the racks feel flimsy.
Our old K-A was built much sturdier as far as feel when opening the door or sliding the racks in and out.
with that said i dont feel its totally worth the 850.00 i paid but as long as it keeps working and doing the job well after the warranty period.
Was really hoping the Bosch brand would stomp all over KA and WP but we will see.
In all it meets all that i require to do, i just think some padding behind the front SS panel would feel sturdier as well as better rack tracks.
still not disappointed in its performance.

txt: I love it. I'm glad I finally got this brand again, because Bosch is the best! It cleans everything great. My only concern is the amount of water remaining  on the back wall of the tub after the cycle is complete and dishes are dry. Even if I select Extra Dry, there's water remaining on the walls. I'm just wondering if this is normal. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Unless quietness is your top priority, I wouldn't necessarily recommend...
txt: Unless quietness is your top priority, I wouldn't necessarily recommend this dishwasher. Pros: I love the top rack and the organization of it--fits a lot of stuff. It also cleans very effectively and is insanely quiet. Cons: It doesn't dry. Even on the "extra dry" setting my dishes come out wet and the interior walls of the dishwasher are always coated in condensation. I worry that we could develop a mold problem in there, so I run it on the sanitize setting frequently and we try to keep the door open as much as possible (which is pretty inconvenient--we all trip over it constantly). For the price, I expected better.

title: Very Quiet
txt: Recently purchased the Bosch 300 series dishwasher. It far exceeded my expectations. I wasn’t expecting it so be so quiet and clean as well as it does. We are on well water and I had been living under the assumption my dishes would always have spots. Since I purchased the dishwasher, my dishes have come out spotless. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Like a Charm
txt: This dishwasher has been our favorite one to date. It gets the job done, very well and every time. It is dependable and I know the dishes will come out looking sparkling after each load. I would highly recommend! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Really like it but...
txt: I really like this dishwasher as far as functionality. It holds a large load and is extremely quiet. The third shelf is an awesome feature and allows me to place items like carving knives, can caps and spatulas etc in there for cleaning. I have yet to use all the features in the month that I have had it but navigation thus far is simple. My only issue thus far is the after smell!!  It can just stink.  I’m not sure if it is because it is so well insulated that I can feel the interior is still warm the next day after running a load, or what is causing the malodor but the reek is taking some getting used to. And since reviews from two years ago mention this smell issue, well I’d think they should have resolved the problem by now.  Thus my middle of the road overall rating.

title: Bosch Dishwashers are the best!
txt: This dishwasher cleans all of my silverwear and dishes spotless everytime! I have put dried spagetti sauce, chocolate, and coffee stained dished and cups in there and they come out clean EVERY TIME! I couldn't be happier! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

txt: I love how quiet this dishwasher is and how clean the dishes are when they come out of the dishwasher. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Dishes Come Out Sparkling Clean
txt:
We couldn't be happier with our new Bosch dishwasher. We use the "Speed60" setting, which runs for 1 hr 10 min, with regular liquid detergent and no rinse aid. Dishes and glasses come out sparkling clean.  

We always run the dishwasher in the evening and then open it a little to let the dishes dry overnight. 

And did I mention this thing is QUIET!!  Even when the air gap (internal) is working.

One other thing, the location of the filter makes it easy to clean on a regular basis. 

There was one small glitch right after install. The wash setting was stuck on "Auto" and no matter what I did, I could not select a different setting. The "Auto" setting runs for over 2 hours and I found it wasn't necessary to get dishes clean. I googled and pressing the start button for 5 sec reset the unit. So far, the issue has not recurred. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

The efficiency of the cleaning is matched by the quietness of the cycle. The wash cycle is long, so plan head. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Bosch SHEM63E55N
txt: First time I've had a dishwasher that you REALLY  don't have to RINSE the dishes before you put them in. Others say you don't have to rinse but they come out dirty. In my Bosch, you REALLY don't have to!  AND YJEY ARE CLEAN! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: good/bad points
txt:
Good design, relatively easy to install, plenty of wash cycle choices.
Does not dry dishes very well and does not turn off automatically when the cycle is finished. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Dishwasher lasted for a few years, but failed in a big way
txt: I had this dishwasher for five years, the dispenser failed at 3 years and at 5 a leak appeared at the bottom of the washer. Many parts were replaced including the inlet valve, hoses, and drain line. Nothing helped, as it turns out the stainless tub was leaking. It is spot welded with an elastomer seal in between and when this leaks there is no way to fix this, including rewelding. So despite the "heavy duty" stainless interior appearance, it becomes a boat anchor after a few years.

title: Don't waste your money! Bosch is the worst.
txt: I bought this dishwasher 13 months ago, I spent over $1000 including installation. It has stopped draining and gives the error message E24 (draining problem, no kidding). There is standing water and it is unusable. I had a plumber over twice today to snake the drain, it still won't drain. The problem is the pump inside the dishwasher, it won't pump the water out to drain. Bosch's customer service website is down, "under maintenance," and when you call customer service, a recording says there is an unusually high call volume and you are told to CALL BACK LATER. Unbelievable. I thought Bosch was supposed to be a good premium brand, it is not. Don't waste your money on this garbage. I am furious.

title: Great dishwasher!
txt: We are so happy with our new Bosch. Cleans beautifully with no noise. I would buy another Bosch in a heartbeat [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Surprised me
txt: So I knew Bosch had a reputation for making great dishwashers.  However we bought one of their cheaper models, so I wasn't sure if their reputation would follow to their lower end stuff.  I am pleased to say it does.  Things that would require hand scrubbing on our old dishwasher just straight up get clean in the Bosch.  I really like the top rack for the utinsils.  I wasn't sure if it would be that big of a deal, but it's handy being able to seperate them into the slots and know they will get clean.  Putting them in the bins on the bottom shelf in our old dishwasher meant that some would clump together, and not get clean.  The only gripe I have is that after a month or two, the bottom rack started falling down out of the rails inside the washing machine.  This obstructed the bottom sprayer, and the dishes wouldn't get cleaned.  It was also a pain to pull the rack out since it wasn't on the rails.  We put in a support ticket, and the repair man was prepared to order us a new rack as the washer rails themselves looked fine and the walls weren't bowed.  However, it occurred to him that we might be able to bend the wheel holders on the rack itself some.  He did so, and now it's a great fit and we haven't had a single issue since.  So if anyone ends up with this same problem, that's a super easy thing to try.  Everything else has been golden, and I'd be happy to reccomend to anyone else the same purchase.  Well worth the cost. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Great Dishwasher

To our pleasant surprise, we have found that we are very happy with the cleaning AND drying performance of this machine.  We also wanted a dishwasher that is quiet, and this one is very quiet.  The features of this Bosche dishwasher are also on par or better than any other brand in this price range we considered. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]
