title: High quality clean but the heated dry is terrible
txt: This dishwasher has a lot of great features. It’s excellent at cleaning dishes. You can easily run it with the TV on, because it’s so quiet. It has a nice digital display that allows you to delay the wash up to nineteen hours. The downside is that the heated dry is terrible. The dishes come out soaking wet, almost as if there’s no heated dry feature at all. We need to let the dishes air dry. That’s how bad it is. If I had known the drying element was seemingly non-existent, I would not have bought this dishwasher. I can’t recommend a dishwasher that doesn’t dry dishes when there are so many out there that at least do an average job.

title: First Dishwasher
txt:
I bought this dishwasher for my wife for Christmas. It is her first dishwasher and she was so thrilled to get one. Before buying this one, I looked up various reviews and this seemed to be a highly ranked/reviewed dishwasher.

Everything was great until we connected the hot water to the dishwasher in the back of the unit. The hot water line connects to a elbow adaptor and the adaptor connects to a plastic inlet hose in the back. Since the hose is plastic, the thread is very easily worn down and connecting the elbow to the plastic thread proved to be very difficult. It's difficult for three reasons: 1) there isn't much clearance in the back for a wrench to tighten the elbow, 2) it's difficult to know if the elbow is connecting to the plastic threads at an angle since the plastic will give a little bit, 3) it's hard to know if the elbow has been tightened enough. I'm not sure why Bosch didn't make this connection out of metal. That would have solved all these issues.

Because of the plastic thread, our dishwasher has been dripping water in the back ever since we installed it over 10 months ago. I've checked the connection about a dozen times. I've completely pulled out the dishwasher and disconnected the hot water and reconnected it about 6 times in the last 10 months (this is a huge hassle). I've added Teflon tape and pipe thread sealant to seal the drip. I've replaced the brass elbow several times. I've removed the plastic inlet valve to inspect it. No matter what I do, there is still a drip in the back. So that the drip does not ruin our wood floor and cabinets, I've secured a clear plastic sheet inside the space where the dishwasher sits. For the moment, this is the only solution I can think of that will keep the drip contained. Once there is enough water pooling below the dishwasher, we are able to see it from the front. I don't want to pay for a new dishwasher or a new inlet valve so this solution will just have to do.

title: Took a while to break in, but great dishwasher
txt:
This dishwasher was easy enough to install, it's pretty to look at and complements the rest of my kitchen, and it's nearly silent when running.  The indicator light to add JetDry is helpful.  It did arrive with a strong mildew smell in the unit that gave way to a chemical smell for a couple of weeks, and it took probably a dozen wash cycles to remove the odor entirely.  Overall though, it's an efficient, quiet, gorgeous appliance that I expect will serve me well for many years.  

I suspect most people know by now that Bosch dishwashers don't dry the dishes, but it bears repeating:  if the expectation is that the dishwasher dries with a heating element, this is not the machine for you. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: If I could give this a 2.5, I would.   Is it quiet? Yes.   Does it clean? Yes, although we have n...
txt: If I could give this a 2.5, I would.   Is it quiet? Yes.   Does it clean? Yes, although we have not tried anything tough on it yet - only 1 month old so far.   Does it dry?  No, not at all, even with the "Extra Dry" option selected.    Does it take a long time - yes, typically 2:25 for a normal cycle, but if you normally run it after dinner its not a big deal.  A minor complaint - The front door has a really stiff spring, so if you close it, it closes pretty tight which I don't like since its always dripping wet inside.  I have to wedge something in the door to keep it partially open so it will dry out.  Another complaint - the thing takes up the entire space under the counter top with very little wiggle room for hoses, power cords, etc to run behind it and it comes with a pretty short power cord, so you might be tempted to wall mount an outlet box behind it but the dishwasher won't fit if you do.  The supposed solution to this is to buy a custom junction box/cord made for the custom power connector on the unit but its short too, so trying to run the junction box just into the cabinet next to the dishwasher is almost impossible.    All in all - its not a terrible dishwasher, but it could be a lot better, and the installation could be much easier with another foot of power cord.

title: Very Good Dishwasher
txt:
(The email link for the review sent me to this unit.  I purchased the 800 series dishwasher, and this review is for that one).

I have had this dishwasher for a couple of months now.  At first, I wasn't impressed for the cost of this dishwasher.  That is, until I read the manual and followed the recommended settings. Some of the things that I had to adjust to make this a really good dishwasher are:

1. The drying feature of this dishwasher is poor.  This is because it doesn't have the typical heating element in the bottom that steams off the water, (and can melt plastic-ware in the bottom rack).  The manual suggests using rinse-aid, which I have never used before in my previous dishwahsers.  There is also a feature that pop-opens the door at the end of the wash cycle to help the water evaporate.  With both of those used, it dries just as good as my last dishwasher did. 

2. My last dishwasher allowed for all the bottom rungs to fold down.  This model only allowed for a few of them to collapse.  I was concerned about this when I bought it, and almost passed over this model because of that one feature.  I am so glad I didn't.  With the height adjustable top rack, I can fit almost twice as many dishes in this unit than I could with my old one.  I have acutally put in 14 dishes, 7 bowls, and two pans in this dishwasher at the same time.  And no food particles left over.

3. This dishwasher is so quiet.  It really is.  I didn't believe the reviews.  My last dishawasher was so loud that I had to turn up my TV two rooms away when it was running.  You can literally have a conversation right next to this machine without even talking louder.  We have actually said many times that we have to look at the projected light on the floor to know its running.

4. The racks in the store seemed a bit stiff, and the unit was that way for the first couple of weeks.  Now that we've used it for a while, they glide very easily.

The only con I have is that the stainless steel face shows every fingerprint, and isn't "stainless".  We accidentally spilled a couple drops of beet juice down the front, and weeks later it's still stained.

Other than the stainless steel, I can't say enough good things about the 800 series dishwasher.  It was definitely worth the money. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Buy Something Else
txt: The Bosch units do not dry the dishes using a heating element, they depend on the heat generated by the water inside making everything hot enough to eventually dry.  This does not work, you better have a dish towel handy when you unload the washer because the plastic racks stay wet so the bottom of everything in the washer will be wet.  Bosch recommends your water temperature to be between 125 and 140 degrees so I set it at 135 and everything is still wet on the bottom.  How is it energy saving when you have to jack up the temperature on the water heater?  And you can forget about anything plastic being dry because they don't hold heat like dishes or silverware.  My wife picked the unit out because Bosch is supposed to be a good name in dishwashers but the 13 year old Maytag we replaced did a much better job overall.  We are highly disappointed with this unit, Home Depot doesn't take returns on appliances and since there are just the 2 of us we'll just do dishes by hand again because you have to dry everything by hand anyway.  Save yourself some grief and money and buy another brand that has an internal heating element to dry your dishes.  Consider us highly dissatisfied customers.

The reason the store gave me was that they put them through a test and sometimes there is water left behind ... I have purchased at least 6 -8 dishwashers in my lifetime between my own homes and rental properties and I have NEVER received one with water in it :(  Hoping I get this resolved soon my husband refuses to install it and wants a new one ...the store managers said they cannot do that ... but I can pay a restocking fee and buy a different model ... doesn't make any sense to me!!

Yes, it does leave water on the dishes.  For the experienced person who has had the great opportunity of having a dishwasher forever, this may be an annoyance.  We sometimes do an extra dry and leave the dishwasher open or sometimes we simply dry the dishes a little.  This thing is so quiet in our house that the only sound we can hear is the water running from our noisy sink to the dishwasher.  I recommend it.

title: Updated Review
txt:
I wrote a review recently stating that the dishwasher seemed to give inconsistent results. Sometimes cleaning very well and then sometimes not very well. Sometimes the detergent pod would be dissolved and sometimes not. Then, it got worse and would not clean even after multiple washings, particularly 
 items on the top racks. Well, after much consternation I decided to pull the dishwasher out and see if I could find the problem. Lo and behold, I discovered a kink in the drain line. Once I got that straightened out, the dishwasher has been working consistently with beautiful results. My guess is since the dishwasher could not fully drain because of the kink, the float or water level mechanism was not sending the signal for more water and the dishwasher would fail to add enough water to engage the top level spray arms. Now, all is well. Such a relief!

title: Best ever!

title: Great value
txt: We're very happy with this dishwasher.   It's so quiet that you literally don't know it's running untill you go right up to it and listen carefully.  If you run it on auto it very reliably washes everything you put in it, and with a litte rinse agent (you can set it to use just a little), things come out clean and dry.  I like having the ability to delay the cycle for up to 24 hours (in one hour increments), and to turn off extra heating to save energy.  The one complaint we have is that it seems harder to arrange larger items in the lower rack, but you get used to it and it's more than compensated for by their unique top rack for silverware and small items - it's a great feature.  The machine feels solid too.  All in all we're happy, especially since the price was modest - not low but not high either. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

But Bosch: give Finish a tweak encouraging them to amp up production. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Fantastic at cleaning!
txt:
We struggled with a near 20 year old dishwasher that cleaned so poorly (even after clearing filters, checking water pressure, and all the maint that could be done), that I had to practically hand wash everything before loading.  With this this new Bosch, I didn't believe the instructions when they said to scrape the food, but don't rinse.  How could it get that much off?!  But it does - it really does! It's become a game - putting in a scraped, but still super-dirty dishes, and see if it comes out clean- haven't been disappointed yet. And with the rinse aid, not only is it clean, it's sparkling.  Totally get the rinse aid.
Nothing in this world is perfect so I will say that the dishes could be dryer when the cycle is done, but if you load dishes carefully to avoid creating puddles, it's really no big deal. I'm also not worried about melting plastic containers on the bottom rack, so it's a decent trade off. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: After researching dishwashers and reading tons of reviews, we chose the Bosch 300 series. Trying...
txt:
After researching dishwashers and reading tons of reviews, we chose the Bosch 300 series. Trying to find the best dishwasher ( or any appliance ) nowadays can be challenging. Especially when half the reviews received are through some sort promotion.. if I were to get a product at reduced price/or free I would probably give it great reviews as well...just saying. 
I have had my dishwasher for about a month now...and I absolutely love it. All the concerns I read about in reviews...dishes not drying...smelly inside...all of which were legitimate concerns before I got my dishwasher, all turned out to be non issues. 
My dishes dry perfectly, every time. Will there be water in bowls or cups that have non flat surface where water can pool...obviously... did the dishwasher smell a bit at first..yes..like they stated it may...but it never affected my dishes ...cleaning your dishwasher properly weekly with finish tabs or however you choose to clean dishwasher will also prevent future smells.
My dishes come out perfectly clean, and most times I just use the speed 60 cycle/extra dry. The dishwasher is also so quiet! You do not hear it running at all, which is amazing. 
The arrangement of how to put my dishes in, at first was bit challenging...however once you get the hang of it, you will love it. I love how the second rack is adjustable. The third rack...not totally necessary, I could have it or not have it...but it's there so, I use it. 
All in all this dishwasher exceeded my expectations. When I purchased it, I really was expecting to have issues and was worried I wasted my money. Not the case at all.

title: Very quiet and gets the dishes clean. Some of the...
txt: Very quiet and gets the dishes clean. Some of the rack tines are a little close together so some dishes don’t fit well, but there are several ways to adjust.

txt: Was easy to install, comes with a 3 prong plug and own drain hose. Seems very well built versus other brands I have had. Once running it is great, cleans very well, is very quiet.  Buttons are easy to use and see.  The racks are very versatile and the top drawer feature is great.  Would highly recommend.

The automatic set feature is nice, i never use any other buttons to start it.  A lot of newer dishwashers works well and are quiet nowadays, the big question is how reliable it is over 5-6 years.

title: DO NOT BUY THIS DISHWASHER

DISHWASHER DOES NOT RUN A FULL CYCLE. BOSCH SENT OUT A 3RD RATE REPAIR PERSON "TWICE" AND HE DID NOT FIX THE ISSUE. Home Depot WILL NOT RETURN IT BECAUSE THE SAY THEY ARE THE 3RD PARTY! DISHWASHER IS STILL UNDER WARRANTY AND NO ONE WANTS TO TOUCH IT BECAUSE IT WILL VOID WARRANTY. THIS NIGHTMARE HAS BEEN GOING ON FOR 6 WEEKS. I AM OUT $1100.00 AND I WILL NEVER SHOP HD AGAIN! TERRIBLE SERVICE FROM ALL PARTIES.

What this means is - 1) Any inside moisture never dries out unless I prop the door open.Living in Arizona, everything gets dry within a day so when the inside of my dishwasher is still wet 5 days later - it’s a problem for me.2) Since its so air tight and never dries completely - it smells.

title: Great dishwasher
txt: The Bosch dishwasher does an excellent job washing dishes.  Amazingly, without a heating element, it manages to get most of the dishes dry.  Plastics remain a problem, but they never dried in my heated Jenn-Air, either.  And at least now I can put plastic items on the bottom rack without worry of melting.  My only complaint is that it does not feel as roomy as my previous dishwasher.  I had to take the 3rd tier silverware rack out in order for the water glasses to go on the 2nd tier and my stoneware plates on the 1st tier.  So I lose the ability to take out the silverware container to allow for bulkier pieces.  The tines are pretty close together, which makes it hard to put in more than one 1/2 gallon container or large popcorn bowl.  And I can't figure out how to lower the tines.  It's not self evident and everything has to be looked up online.  But it is an excellent product. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Well it was a rough start but so far the...
txt: Well it was a rough start but so far the dishwasher is working great.  After an extra week was added because it was backordered I installed it myself following every instruction!  When the instructions say DO NOT OVERTIGHTEN the connection between the hot water hose and the plastic fixture - thats a lie!  leaked all over...you have to tighten it hard...had the service tech come out and he tightened it HARD!!  yes we were being too cautious so as not to break it, but why do they put that in the instructions???  so you pay for an install that is really easy to do yourself!  Used I a few times now and it is VERY quiet and dishes are clean!   Customer service was confused many times by giving me wrong info...So glad it worked out in the end because my confidence in the brand was shaken!

It can still be a little tricky fitting in tall wine glasses, but since they can go on the bottom shelf we are still fitting them in. The only thing I would change is to have the silverware removable basket be segmented into two parts. We often use a few large utensils that need to be set upright in the basket, but don't have enough to fill the basket, so there is some wasted space. title: Weird little fan blocked top rack
txt:
This product seems okay, it ran a cycle and is quieter than the one it's replacing. It was installed this week.
The top (3rd) cutlery rack wouldn't pull out more than about 4 inches. There was a little plastic fan in a plastic cage in the middle of the ceiling that totally stopped the rack right it its track. We popped it off, not sure what it was (easy to pop on if needed). 
I called the customer service number, and she finally allowed as how it was just to circulate air. Wasn't sure why top rack wouldn't pull out. 
I thought it was maybe a sprayer thing for tall items which should attach to the back -- but that is an Extra not included in my model. The manual, which I downloaded, is extremely unclear about this whole area. Not easy to use. 
Default settings are very high for rinse agent.

txt: I replaced my old one with Bosch 300 series.  I really like it.  This one has the 3rd rack and it is very practical. The 2nd rack is height adjustable too. Other than this, this is near perfect dishwasher.  I highly recomment this. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: It's quiet, but doesn't dry well
txt:
Due to the pandemic, there were not a lot of choices for appliances in our area, so we decided to go with this unit due to the third rack and the availability. It's an okay machine but not my favorite.

Pros:  Dishes are clean, machine is so quiet, its hard to tell if it is running, third rack gets silverware clean and keeps it from nesting, delay feature is convenient

Cons:  Due to lack of a heating element, the interior of unit is almost always wet, plastics do not dry well, split or smaller silverware basket would be more useful since unit has the third rack [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Good product
txt: First time buying a Bosch dishwasher the reviews were  good. Had some problems in the begining had to call customer service had a error code . Was not cleaning well for me and leaving the dishes still wet. I decided to call customer support  and was recommended to use Finish Jet-Dry rinse aid for the wettness on the dishes and now also usingh Finish Max in 1 Powerball Detergent working well now because the dishwasher does not have a heating element to dry because the Bosch use Condensing Drying with no heating element. Also brought the extended warranty for the dishwasher. Customer service is good and helpful.

title: Five star dishwasher
txt: I have only had this washer for about a month it so but so far we love it. It's quiet when running and the dishes come out feeling really clean . It's pretty simple to use. Adjusting the shelves is very easy. I like the extra small top shelve for the silverware . I have had many other brands over the years with not much luck. The reviews for Bosch are very good so I'm hoping this one lasts as long as my first one many years ago which was a Kitchen Aid.

title: My new lovely dishwasher!
txt: I absolutely love my new Bosch dishwasher. It is so quite that I have put my ear to the unit to make sure it is on.  It takes a little longer than my old one to finish the job, but I believe the dishes are cleaner.  I have not used it for pots because I have teflon coatec pots and pans and it is not recommended to put them in the dishwasher

title: Great Dishwasher, but Starting is Crazy and Complicated. The silverware shelf is great. HOWEVER: ...
txt:
Great Dishwasher, but Starting is Crazy and Complicated.
The silverware shelf is great. HOWEVER:
Suppose you press the Start button and then decide not to start right away. 
Tomorrow you press On, and then want to select the Heavy or Normal cycle. You can't. The BUTTONS WON"T WORK. You press them, and nothing happens. 
Your dishwasher isn't broken. You need to 
1) Press and Hold the Start button for 3 seconds, then 
2) Turn the dishwasher Off and then back On. 
That's a terrible, crazy design decision. I had to call Customer Support to find out how to get my dishwasher working again. The reason they did it this way: So children won't accidentally turn the dishwasher on.

title: Complaint of Dishwasher
txt: The only complaint is that the door holding the disk of cleaner does not open on it's on during the cleaning cycle!

title: Awesome Dishwasher
txt: We love our new Bosch dishwasher! It's amazingly quiet, has plenty of room for all of our dishes, and the third rack for utensils makes sure everything comes out super clean. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Love my new Bosch  dishwasher
txt: This new dishwasher is quiet, efficient, and does a great job. Love the silverware slide out in the top. My only “complaint” is that itt holds so much, my husband and I run out of dishes or silverware before it is full. Very happy with it! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

txt: Overall we are pleased with this dishwasher. I love the three racks and the room it has compared to our older unit. I can't seem to find a setting where the dishes come out dry, even with extra dry setting used. There is a bit of a weird smell even now after a dozen or so cycles. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Bosch Dishwasher
txt: I am loving our new dishwasher.  It is so much easier to load.  I love the third tray too.  Unloading is quicker for me.  Our dishwasher is so quite and love having the controls in front.  If or whenever we move, we are replacing the dishwasher to Bosch.

title: Very pleased with dhsiwasher
txt:
We've been using this dishwasher for over a month now and I can't find much to complain about at all. It's super quiet compared to the old one we had and I love the silverware tray on top which makes unloading such a breeze. 
Read reviews on wirecutter before buying it and it's a great buy. 
The only thing I can grumble a little about is the fact that the shortest quick cycle is still an hour so when you're in a punch be aware of that.

title: Reliable Bosch
txt:
Our new Bosch dishwasher is great.  It is solid, works well, and is amazingly quiet.  We have found that the two issues we read about in reviews before buying it are easily addressed as follows:

1 - Smell - It's true that the dishwasher can get a bad odor.  We started by having our appliance company open the dishwasher door a week before they delivered it to us, to dry out the residual water inside the appliance that comes from the factory test wash that is done on each machine before it is shipped out.  Now that we own it, we open the door and let it dry out overnight after running it, and after 2-3 days of sitting without being run.  As long as it is allowed to dry out periodically, it does fine.  

2 - Drying cycle - With a regular wash cycle (we use "Auto"), the Bosch's unique condensation drying method results in a pretty broad "okay" on its own.  Plastics don't dry well, but everything else gets mostly dry.  However, as soon as you add in the Sanitize cycle as well, drying improves a whole lot.  We haven't even tried adding the "Extra Dry" cycle; it's doing fine without it.  And since we want to sanitize the dishes anyway, we're happy. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Ehh not so great.
txt: I went by the reviews and am disappointed.  Loads awkwardly, which is OK, but it does not clean as well as my old cheap dishwasher!  This one is expensive and even on the strongest sanitizing setting, I constantly have to hand wash or put something through another cycle.  I thoroughly rinse my dishes and such, so I don't understand.  I clean the filter constantly, just in case and I use Finish and now Lemi Shine (which has helped), but I just don't understand why this machine is getting such high ratings!

title: Nice!
txt: Quietest dishwasher we've owned. Love the 3rd rack. Lots of option on cleaning/drying. Would buy again! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Outstanding!
txt: This is our first Bosch dishwasher, but it won't be our last. Installed about six weeks ago, it's quiet, efficient and effective. It is everything we expected - and more. In a word, it's outstanding! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Never thought I would be excited over a dishwasher
txt: I will be honest  I never thought I would be excited over a dishwasher but this one is amazing.  I can't even tell its on and it cleans the dishes great. My GE one which wasn't even very old was so loud I couldn't watch TV in my living room. Well worth the investment. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

txt: Dishes come out spotless and it's the quietest dishwasher I'e deer had [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Very quiet, not always completely clean
txt: This dishwasher is so quiet that I find myself grateful for the digital display counting down the time the load has to run, otherwise I might not know it is on at all. Most of the time, the dishes come completely clean. However there are a couple plastic dishes that just don't seem to get properly cleaned. Instead, dirty watermarks are left behind on them. This is not something that happens all the time (we've had the machine for a month and a half and run it daily), but I'm surprised it's happening at all. Otherwise it's a great machine. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: 300 Series - Pro's and Con's
txt:
Unit is 1" narrower than a domestically produced dishwasher causing us to have to buy some trim molding to fill a standard gap (replacing a GE Dishwsher). The rubber molding/gasket was not large enough to cover the opening.  Does not dry well, even with Sanitize and  extra dry. Have to empty it and leave the door open for an hour or so in order to dry the inside to avoid developing smell and mold. I now also keep a dry pack of silica gel in it to keep moisture out with the door closed in between uses. Love the adjustable middle rack and top silverware rack, normally don't even need to use the silverware basket.  Cleans the dshes nicely. If it weren't for the light that displays on the floor during use,  I wouldn't know it was even running, very quiet.
. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: SOLID
txt: Quiet, sturdy, much room especially if you use the top rack for utensils and remove the bottom utensil drawer. Cleans great. Awesome customer service. After a year of use, the face plate showed a tiny crack, where the handle is at the top, due to incredible suction inside the machine and required hand pressure to pull it open. One call to Customer Service, which patiently worked with us to find the correct part and shipped it to us immediately and free of charge. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Best Dishwasher Ever!
txt: Our old dishwasher died on us and we did many reviews to look for a new one. I always heard Bosch was the best. I was skeptical at first until we used it for the first time! This dishwasher is amazing. It cleans the dishes so well and has so much space! It's super versatile and the space that's inside is out of this world. I love the third rack and the middle rack height adjustments. I would recommend Bosch dishwashers to anyone! They are the only brand I would be. I understand now why they are top of the class in the dish washing Industry. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Super quiet
txt: You don't even know this dishwasher is running, it's so quiet. Does a great job cleaning also. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Very happy overall
txt: This is my second Bosch dishwasher, and overall I am very happy with it. The "Extra Dry" feature, which my last model did not have, really does seem to make a difference and avoid excessive hand drying. And I enjoy having the third rack up top for some larger items. My one complaint would be that the layout of the racks seems less efficient for loading that my old model, and I believe that I might actually be able to get less into it, despite the third rack. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: After waiting over 2 months for this dishwasher to arrive, we finally have it installed and it do...
txt: After waiting over 2 months for this dishwasher to arrive, we finally have it installed and it doesn't dry the dishes at all. I'm talking soaking wet even after opening the door to air it out. I don't understand it. It even has an 'exra dry' setting! We paid $800 for a dishwasher that turns out to be inferior to our old $100 machine from 1999.

title: Product Review
txt: I have owned several Bosch appliances over the years and I am very disappointed in the performance of this dishwasher. It does not do a good job cleaning dishes and is not as quiet as older models. Very disappointing. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Great Dishwasher
txt: We're now a few months into using our Bosch 300 dishwasher and I've been very pleased with its performance. It has consistantly done a fantastic job of getting dishes clean and spotless, even when I've left some pretty hardset crud on them. The machine is very quiet, to the point I've been worried it isn't working because I can't hear it. I'll also mention that it was easy to install and came with good instructions. This was my first time installing a dishwasher and it was a straightforward process and I didn't have any trouble. Overall, very pleased with the product. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Love our new BOSCH dishwasher!
txt: We are extremely pleased with our purchase of the BOSCH dishwasher.  Very sleek look, so quiet you forget you turned it on and looks great in our kitchen.  Will recommend this brand and model to friends and family!  Great product! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Did you press start?
txt: The title of this review is, "Did you press start?" but I also could have called it, "Is this thing even on?". Those are the two sentences you would hear most when we are using this dishwasher at home. This is the quietest machine I've ever heard (or not heard!). Thank goodness it has the countdown timer lights on the front panel or else it would be so hard to tell when it is running. I replaced a 25-year-old machine that I thought was good, but this Bosch Dishwasher is so much better. Old wine glasses look like new after a cycle in this diswasher. I love the versatility of the racks and how pieces can flip up or down to make way for different-sized dishes, pot, pans and utensils. I would highly recommend this model to anyone looking for a new dishwasher. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Glad we chose Bosch

There is usually some water on the mugs and wine glasses but we don't miss the heat element drying or the hot steam that came out the top of our older machine.  This  machine is also very quiet.  We are very happy with the quality by Bosch. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Reviewing Bosch Purchase
txt:
We have had the Bosch for over one month and still find the racks most incovenient for loading compared to our previous dishwasher. 
 In addition, even on extended drying, the dishes are frequently still wet.  The Bosch dishwasher is quieter than our previous model. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Great Dishwasher
txt: I love this dishwasher.  It is very quite and I love the third rack for my utensils, etc.  I also love the fact that the middle rack can be raised or lower which allows me to put taller items in it depending upon what is in the bottom rack.  It is well put together and the controls are easy to use.  Definitely would recommend this for anyone looking for a new or replacement dishwasher.  Truly worth it!!! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: This is the dishwasher you need!
txt: I was looking for a new dishwasher for my newly remodeled kitchen.  With so many options available online, I was struggling to decide.  Reading reviews from other dishwashers, I kept seeing things like, "I wish I had bought another Bosch".  Well, that told me what I needed to know!  And I haven't been sorry for a second that I bought this one.  No more rinsing dishes!  I just scrape off the food and load them into the dishwasher, and they come out clean!  Every time!  Even when there is cold melted cheese stuck to plates or pans!  And I use cheap detergent, too.  You won't be sorry for spending a little extra.  This baby does the job, for sure! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: bosch dishwasher
txt: I have had this dishwasher for over a year and it cleans great but I have issues with the rack designs.  The bottom rack tines don't line up and the spacing between the tines is too close or at an odd angle.  It's really hard to place a cutting board or platter in the bottom rack.  I also think the spacing and angle of the middle rack tines is not efficient. I have also had issues with the bottom rack falling off the side tracks when loaded as shown in the manual.  My kids also think it smells funny.  I love how it cleans but I get very frustrated with loading it due to the odd rack design.

title: My old Whirlpool dishwasher started leaking in January.  I was doing dishes by hand, the old-fash...
txt:
My old Whirlpool dishwasher started leaking in January.  I was doing dishes by hand, the old-fashioned way, for months, until I decided to buy a new one online instead of going into to the store in person to pick one out (the Pandemic....) a new one.  I fully appreciated this new dishwasher and love the top silverware rack, which allows all utensils to be spread out for thorough cleaning.  Also, it is so quiet that I can barely hear it running.

It's worth it to spend a little more on a great appliance like this one.

title: Quiet machine
txt: I have been using this Bosch model since moving into my new place December 2019, and more regularly in the last few months during pandemic shelter-in-place. Previously, I also had a Bosch dishwasher, which was the reason why I bought this one. It is one of the quietest dishwashers I've ever had and just love how efficient and well it cleans. One thing I do not like is that there is a pungent smell coming from the dishwasher if I keep dirty dishes in it with door closed, even if it's to wait to start a cycle at the end of a day. It is the nastiest odor even after I tried disinfecting and sanitizing it per instruction manual. A way I have found to steer clear of that odor is just to leave the door open and rack pulled out for the most part until I need to start a cycle. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: The dishwasher's three racks are great! I really like having...
txt: The dishwasher's three racks are great! I really like having a safe place to put knives and other larger tools. I like the ability to raise and lower the middle rack. The only drawback is that even on extra dry, the dishes do not actually get dry. Very irritating!

title: Extremely quiet, very large capacity, and it does a great...
txt: Extremely quiet, very large capacity, and it does a great job!

title: Quiet effective dishwasher
txt: The 300 series Bosch Dishwasher is just as good as Consumer Reports touted the appliance.  It is so quiet that we can not hear it operate unless we are standing in the kitchen. The dishes are very clean following a normal cycle. A great improvement over the Maytag we replaced!  Thanks. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Dish washer is Quiet. It does an excellent job cleaning...
txt: Dish washer is Quiet. It does an excellent job cleaning heavy particles.

title: Quietest dishwasher I’ve ever owned. Love it!...
txt: Quietest dishwasher I’ve ever owned. Love it!

title: Great quality
txt: I'm very impressed with this dishwasher.  I have to admit it change my mind about dishwashers.  Great product. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Bosch dishwasher
txt: It is a great machine. Extremely quiet, easy to operate, cleans the dishes well. And is a wonderful addition to my kitchen [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Just enough features and solid QUIET performance
txt: We find our new Bosch to be solid - no flimsy parts. Our old Kemore Elite still worked but control panel was gradually losing functions, time to replace. We looked at reviews, talked to neighbors, then dropped by a kitchen store to take a real time look at couple of brands. Immediately understood why Bosch was attractive. Bought from Best Buy during Memorial Day sales event as their low sales price was the same as big boxes plus they threw in free installation!  And their disinstall our Kenmore plus haul it off was something like $29 so great value. Nothing to disconnect in advance!  The install guys were pros and competent and respectful. They did a test rinse cycle and our jaws dropped. We had to strain to hear it, a huge improvement over our trusty old one. Since then, we've found zero issues. We like the extra top tray but find silverware basket more convenient. I use the tray for pizza cutters, spatulas, big spoons, shallow items. Love the capacity, too. No second guessing this buy. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Quiet and Cleans SO Well!
txt:
We replaced our old dishwasher with this Bosch, and the first time we used it, both my husband and I had to put our heads close to the machine to make sure it was on -- it was SO quiet.   Wonderful!

We also often use the 60 minute wash setting and have been incredibly pleased with how well our dishes come out.

Thank you, Bosch, for a great appliance! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: A New Lease on Life
txt: I love my Bosch Dishwasher. My old dishwasher died 30 years ago and I though I could get buy with handwashing. Little did I know that a dishwasher can use less water and get dishes, glassware, pots and pans so much cleaner than hand wash. My Bosch is so easy to use, gets everything so clean, and makes my day so much easier. Thank you Bosch. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Very quiet - happy customer!
txt: Besides being very quiet, I like the time display to tell you how much time is left, and that it doesn't have a heating coil on bottom - that if something plastic falls down - it doesn't burn it.  Bought this for our cabin - when it's time to buy a new one for our house, I will buy this model again.  Thank you Bosch - nice job. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Cleans Well
txt: Our Bosch dishwasher works very quite. Which is great for a sleeping toddler. Do far the dishwasher has cleaned our dishes well. We can even place some toddler plastic cups and plates on the bottom rack. The reason i gave it 4 stars is the interior is still wet even after the drying time is competed. The dishes and plastic are dry, but i feel like i have to leave the door open to dry the interior. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Nice Dishwasher
txt: The machine is quiet and does a great job.  The third rack is nice and the fact that you can adjust the height is nice too. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Clean dishes couldnt be happier
txt: plenty of room, quiet, cleans dishes great! would highly recommend [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Clean, quiet, practical and efficient
txt: Honestly, I'm amazed how far relatively inexpensive dishwashers have come in the fourteen years since I got my last one. The top rack for silverware and knives is profoundly useful, somehow they seem to have more space inside them, they clean exceptionally well and they're massively more quiet. Frankly, it's been a delight to upgrade and it's made my life considerably better. I can now watch TV in my open plan house with the dishwasher going without really noticing it's on and everything comes out sparkling. Plus the filter for cleaning is a massive improvement too. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Condensation Education Needed
txt: I love the roomy space inside this dishwasher!  However, I wasn't aware of the condensation drying process before I purchased it and, until I googled it, I didn't understand why the dishes weren't all drying completely and why there were water droplets remaining in the washer after each wash.  I better understand it after doing my own research, but I'm not clear as to why this is an advantage over having a heating element.  I miss the "air dry" option on my old Whirlpool dishwasher unless this is truly saving energy.

title: New Bosch 300
txt: 10 days in and we love it  - super quiet and everything comes out clean and dry . Whoo - Hoo [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Happy buyer
txt: This is my first new dishwasher in more than 15 years! So I did a lot of reading and asking questions prior to final decision. I'm very happy with my choice. This is a very quiet dishwasher I believe which I really like about it. There are several settings to choose from and there is a lot of room. My dishes come out clean and dry, what's not to like! The style and look of the product is great as well. It matches up nicely with the rest of the stainless steel appliances in the kitchen. The pricing was also very reasonable. Overall I'd recommend this product! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Happy with our 2nd Bosch!
txt: Recently we had to replace our Bosch dishwasher that we had for many years. We are equally pleased with our second Bosch. It was because we liked our first Bosch so we'll...the decision to get another one was not a difficult decision at all. Thank you for a fine product and we look forward to many years with our new one. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: It works well...
txt: It works well

title: bosch 300 faulty heating element dead on arrival. do not buy
txt: Ordered brand new bosch 300 based on reviews online. Professionally installed to the manual recommendations. Hot water valve, all hooks ups etc were fine.. Water wouldn't get hot in the dishwasher. Soap wouldn't dissolve. Dishes stayed dirty and wet. Most likely a faulty heating element or thermostat. Bosch customer service was useless. Couldn't come out for weeks and threatened to charge for the visit if they didn't think it was their fault. Luckily I was within return period. Went with kitchenaid instead. Buyer beware. You've been warned.

title: This dishwasher was easy to install for us.  I...
txt: This dishwasher was easy to install for us.  I had to install a power outlet under the sink (using the old dishwasher's hardwire).  Other than that, it was a breeze.  Dishes come out very clean, and we can barely tell when it's running.  Plastics come out with some water droplets on them still, but we just dry those with a paper towel or clean rag as we're unloading.  This dishwasher fits so much more stuff than our previous 20 year old whirlpool!

title: Bosch Rules!
txt: I have been using this dishwasher for about 4 months and love it! It is super silent and cleans everything. It is truly the best dishwasher I ever owned.

title: It is actually starting make our dishes look cleaner than...
txt: It is actually starting make our dishes look cleaner than they did with our old washer. It's insane!

title: Bosch DW
txt: Very quiet. Gets Everything clean . The best dishwasher I've ever had!

title: Awesome!!
txt: Awesome!! So quiet and the drying and sanitizing features work great !

title: Bosch My Quiet Dishwasher
txt: I reviewed a lot of dishwashers before purchasing and am glad I chose the 300 series. It definitely fits my needs and is extremely quiet. Good choice!

title: Great product!
txt: Love my new dishwasher!  I have been using it for about 6 weeks now and I have no complaints.  It is so quiet, never had a dirty dish left after the cycle and looks amazing in the kitchen. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Quiet, effective and overall pleased
txt: For the price point, I think this is a very good dishwasher.  We haven't had any issues with the dishes or utensils coming out dirty.  With Jet Dry the glassware comes out spot free.  Controls are easy to understand and use.  It's quiet enough for the effectiveness of the machine.  I would buy this unit again. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Dishwasher
txt: I love it, it is quiet and gets the dishes really clean.  It doesn't dry completely but I prop it open and it dries. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Rating provided by a verified purchaser...

title: Easy installation and good fit. Loved the third rack more...
txt: Easy installation and good fit. Loved the third rack more than I anticipated. Other reviewers were correct in noting that unit is wet and has some smell even after using the Extra Dry button. Like the stainless interior and adjustable rack and tines. Overall great dishwasher.

title: Quietly Pleasing
txt: First of all. it does an excellent job cleaning. There are a few items that shouldn't go in, like lightweight plastic containers because they flip over, but anything else is fine. Second, its quiet. You hear the occasional gurgle, but once you walk away, you hear nothing. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: More Than Pleased
txt: Extremely quiet. Leaves dishes and flatware literally sparkling. Have had a month. The Bosch replaced a Kitchenaid. Bosch is hands down better out of the shut. We use lots of bowls, lots. Had to learn how to load but last washing had 15 bowls, 5 plates and still had room for more plates. Also had to learn how to fill rinse aid but again no issues after process was figured out. As of now could not be more pleased with dishwasher. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Rating provided by a verified purchaser...
txt: Rating provided by a verified purchaser

title: LOVE cleans better than any dishwasher I have ever had. Totally dry with sanatize and extra dry....
txt: LOVE cleans better than any dishwasher I have ever had. Totally dry with sanatize and extra dry.

title: Best ever owned
txt: Love the buttons on the front instead of on top. Third rack on top is perfect for little items like ramekins or utensils. This dishwasher gives many configuration options. The sound is so quiet you hardly know it is on. Absolutely love this dishwasher. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: We wanted a dishwasher that was very quiet and this...
txt: We wanted a dishwasher that was very quiet and this one delivers!  Love the top drawer.  We use it for all of our flatware, so we just removed the container from the bottom rack to save space for other dishes.

title: Cheryl
txt: It's a good dishwasher. I have had it for a few weeks. I like the three racks. It does tend to leave spots on the glassware and the inside still smells. Very quiet dishwasher.

title: Arrived on time and was installed quickly.  I love...
txt: Arrived on time and was installed quickly.  I love the look of it and the controls on the front.  The inside was a bit smaller than I am use to but that is okay.  The third rack is very useful for silverware, etc. and love the fact that the middle rack can move up and down.  It is very quite and runs well.  The only issue I have is that it does not dry all my dishes completely but then I don't think I have ever had one that did.  Overall, this is a great dishwasher.

title: It looks good, it’s very quiet and it has lots...
txt: It looks good, it’s very quiet and it has lots of options. The racks are not well designed at all. They’ve managed to over complicate the rack design and it’s a constant challenge to load normal dishes. The fancy 3rd rack is a joke. Nothing comes clean up there and there are always a ton of water spots. The middle rack is adjustable BUT again, bad design. You have to press the release tabs AND hold them down while moving the rack. They stay stationary while the rack moves so it’s VERY difficult. I’ve had adjustable racks in the past and every other company has designed them well. The dry cycle doesn’t dry well at all either. There is an “extra dry” option but again when you open the door, everything is still wet.

title: Great Unit, we are very pleased....
txt: Great Unit, we are very pleased.

title: Delivery and set-up were done efficiently and professionally. The dishwasher...

I’d just suggest to buy the dishwasher and hire a plumber.

title: Cleans almost everything!  I use cheap dish detergent and...
txt: Cleans almost everything!  I use cheap dish detergent and it clean off melted dried on cheese!  AMAZING!

title: I purchased this item for my rental unit since my...

It also has auto shut-off function in case of leakage.  Bosch remains my favorite brand when it comes to home appliance.

title: Really great! Highly recommended. My only complaint is the chemical...
txt: Really great! Highly recommended. My only complaint is the chemical or mechanical smell that is still super strong after running 2 months into owning it.

title: I don't know how to raise the top 2nd rack....
txt: I don't know how to raise the top 2nd rack. The instructions show a button..but no button. I did not understand the Bosch Dry is different , now I do and I love it.

txt: Silent and thorough - great cleaning power. Very happy so far!

title: cleans well
txt: When my GE Profile DW died I was advised to get a Bosch, which I did. This machine cleans well but is not as versatile in loading as the GE. The tines are not adjustable which would really help on the upper rack. Glasses tend to tip over.  I like the high silverware rack.  The silverware bin that goes on the lower rack is impracticle and I had to remove it.  It takes up a huge section of the lower rack and does not come apart as my bin on the GE did. If this machine didn't clean so well I would be very unhappy. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Great machine
txt: This dishwasher is so quiet and dishes come out sparkling. Love it [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: So Very Happy
txt:
We went round and round with two other brands, prior to our Bosch. 
Our Bosch is amazing, simple to operate, incredibly effective and well designed. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Super quiet
txt: Cleans dishes very well & is extremely quiet. Doesn't dry dishes even on extra dry. Water is alway on back panel & top shelf's when cycles are completed. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Pretty easy to install ourselves. If you need to hardwire...
txt: Pretty easy to install ourselves. If you need to hardwire the dishwasher to the power make sure you buy the junction box as well (https://www.homedepot.com/p/Bosch-Dishwasher-Power-Cord-with-Junction-Box-Accessory-SMZPCJB1UC/310320108). We've been running it for a few weeks and everything has been coming out really clean! I even put a casserole dish in there with a good amount of food stuck on it and it came out clean. My husband said he noticed some dishes come out cloudy but I haven't encountered that problem myself. I love the third rack for small items and silverware! But we did notice that if silverware is really dirty it doesn't clean as well on the third rack and should be put in the silverware basket on the bottom rack. It runs very quietly and overall we are pleased with this purchase!

title: Awesome
txt: We love our new Bosch dishwasher. At first we weren't sure because it took us a while to find the right cycle for us but auto and extra dry seems perfect. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Cannot load the bottom basket with our dishes because it is so flimsy the basket flexes and drops...
txt: Cannot load the bottom basket with our dishes because it is so flimsy the basket flexes and drops off the track. Takes two loads, nearly 5 hours, to clean our dishes. Poor quality. Sorry I didn’t opt for the much cheaper alternative.

title: We have had this dish washer since April 2019 (14 months). We love this machine on the inside. So...
txt: We have had this dish washer since April 2019 (14 months). We love this machine on the inside. So much room and versatility to arrange the racks differently. We love the utensil drawer at the top, which allows for removing the utensil rack at the bottom (even more space). It is also incredibly quiet. Giving it 3 stars because we had a problem already with a cheap internal plastic piece coming off repeatedly and making the drawer difficult to slide. The other major complaint is that the main plastic faceplate (where the Bosch name is, where you grab to open the machine) has cracked. The suction is so great within the machine, that the plastic face plate cannot handle the intensity it takes to pull the door open.

title: Stinky Dishwasher!!
txt: I purchaed this dishwasher two months ago and while I was pleased with the way it cleaned my dishes, it has a major problem.  It stinks, and I mean that literally.  It smells like a swamp in my kitchen and now my dishes are smelling like fish.  I called Bosch customer service and they agreed to send out their factory service tech.  He examined the machine and labeled it sound.  He said that the door needs to be propped open (It doesn't say that in the owners manual.) Well I can't because then my kitchen would smell like a swamp. He suggested I use a dishwasher cleaner, which I did.  It smelled even worse after running that cleaning cycle. Now all my dishes smell.  It is awful.  They won't back up their product nor offer any working solutions.   I've seen multiple posts on several websites regarding this issue which seems to be a design flaw, but have not found similar unresolvable smell problems related to other brands. So please beware!!!

title: Excellent machine.
txt: Definately an excellent maching for the price. Machine is very quite and efficient. Love the top tray. Would fefinately recommend this dishwasher to anyone looking for a new or replacement unit. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: My only complaint is the instructions was  not In...
txt: My only complaint is the instructions was  not In English

title: Super Quiet slow to dry
txt: I love the look and how extremely quiet this dishwasher is. I would never run the dishwasher we used to own until I went to bed because it was so loud it was hard to hear the tv or talk to people. Now I turn it on and forget that it is running. I love the look of it and there is so much room. Overall this has proven to be a FANTASTIC purchase. The only downside is that it doesn't dry the dishes very well. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Best Dishwasher Ever!
txt: My name is Linda and this is the first purchase for me for a Bosch Dishwasher.  I have never been so pleased with a dishwasher than with Bosch. The product runs so quietly I forget that I turned it on! My dishes are cleaned very well and the product is easy to maintain. Thank you very much! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Clean Dishes
txt:
I am greatful to have clean dishes again without washing them by hand. The Bosch 300 is very quite and cleans very well. I would recommend it to any and everyone. A great product and holes more dishes than the reviews recommended.
Thank you Bosch for a great product. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: clean dishes
txt: Dishes are very clean and we really like the upper rack silverware tray that makes it easy to load and unload. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: super quiet!
txt: The washer is so quiet that both my husband and I were shocked the first time using it. You can barely hear any noise when the AC or Fridge is running. It also does an awesome job of cleaning the dishes. Love it! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Dishwasher
txt:
Silverware rack is very nice at the top. Cleans all dishes very good and very quiet 
The only bad thing is the drying even on extra dry dosn't dry good at all [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Solid
txt: This is a great dishwasher - quiet and gets the job done. I am especially liking the sanitize feature during this pandemic! The third rack is fantastic and it has enabled me to remove the basket from the bottom to make more room for other items. Only feedback would be to make the racks on the bottom more adjustable. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Mostly good, one caveat
txt:
You hardly know
 it's running...that's how quiet it is. Cleans dishes well. The big But is that dishes don't dry particularly well. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Spacious and quiet, this dishwasher has been a great upgrade....
txt: Spacious and quiet, this dishwasher has been a great upgrade.  My only complaint is an odd smell in the main compartment from the factory.  It smells like something vaguely chemical, or plastic.  It seems to be diminishing over time, but it's still there after ~12 cycles.  Despite that one issue, I still rate the Bosch 300 a 5 out of 5.

title: Finally, a dishwasher that works!!
txt: I've had it for about a month now, and it's performed great! My last one, which was a Whirlpool that was about 5 years old died (good riddance). It never got the dishes clean, in fact I often found a few still dirty with crud, and the dishes were always wet after the cycle leaving me to dry everything by hand. The Bosch performs as a good dishwasher should. The dishes are squeaky (literally) clean and haven't had to rewash anything. Definitely worth every penny. Fingers crossed it lasts for the long haul! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: It's very quiet and easy to use.  It does take longer than you expect to run, but that's OK.  We'...
txt:
It's very quiet and easy to use.  It does take longer than you expect to run, but that's OK.  We're still working on best loading method to fill it as much as possible while getting everything clean.  

I do not recommend using Home Depot install and take away old machine.

title: Quiet, roomy and gets dishes clean!...
txt: Quiet, roomy and gets dishes clean!

title: The Bosch dishwasher not only lived up to its Ability...
txt: The Bosch dishwasher not only lived up to its Ability but it goes beyond that.

title: Fantastic dishwasher and worth every penny
txt:
We bought this dishwasher a couple months ago and it has been nothing but fantastic. Having a variety of different cycles is great and even the fastest one (60 minute cycle) gets dishes nice and clean. I've put some dishes in with food stuck onto it thinking it would not clean it of but I haven't run into anything it hasn't cleaned so far. The silverware third drawer helps clear out a lot of clutter and the adjustable top shelf helps out a lot for increasing the amount of space you have.

The only complaint which is a minor one is that to get dishes completely dry the extra dry button is usually needed. Otherwise I would definitely recommend this dishwasher to anyone [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

Wouldn't buy any other brand.  Highly recommend!

title: NICE...

title: Definitely a decent dishwasher and no complaints but nothing spectacular that would justify the p...
txt:
Definitely a decent dishwasher and no complaints but nothing spectacular that would justify the pricetag.

Even with using jetdry the only way the dishes aren't soaking wet after a load is by selecting the "Extra Dry" function. The cheaper dishwasher from my old apartment functioned better..granted it was stuck on the pots and pans setting it was at least consistent on super clean dishes and mostly dry at the end of it's really noisy cycle. The only thing this dishwasher has is that its quieter

title: It's definitely quiet, that's the best I can say for...
txt: It's definitely quiet, that's the best I can say for it.  It takes nearly 3 hours to run a regular cycle with 'extra drying time'.  Even after that, the dishes are completely soaking wet.  We then have to prop the door open for a couple hours so that everything can drip dry.  If I could return this dishwasher, I would.  I'm completely disappointed.

title: This Bosch dishwasher replaced another Bosch dishwasher I bought 15+...
txt:
This Bosch dishwasher replaced another Bosch dishwasher I bought 15+ years ago that got daily use and had recently gone out.

I bought this 300 series based mainly on reviews I found one doing research. At this point I’ve had my new 300 series for about two weeks.

One improvement this new dishwasher has over the old is that the buttons/controls are not on the facing of the dishwasher door. We have a rolling island in our kitchen and I think it may have hit those buttons and broken one or two of them. I had been without  Rinse and hold for several years.

My old Bosch dishwasher was quiet but this one is quieter. I also feel like this new dishwasher has more room than the old though it takes the same amount of space. The third rack on the top which I am new to might not be for everyone as it requires more meticulous placing of silverware than with the basket down below (Which is still an option in this new dishwasher). It Works for me though. I find the time spent placing the silverware in the third rack is made up somewhat during unloading when everything is already nicely sorted.

Home Depot delivery and installation went without a hitch.

Overall a Very good experience

title: Great dishwasher, great service...

txt: It is very quiet. I think the padding to make it quiet takes away from the capacity of the inside.

title: Broke down after three washes!  Called Bosch they had...
txt: Broke down after three washes!  Called Bosch they had a repairman come out the following week.  He said the control board was shot.  Waiting for the part as we speak (so far 10 days).  I wanted to buy another brand name that I was more familiar with but went with the Bosch because of Consumer Reports.  A $1000 mistake.

title: Most all functions and features work wonderfully. It is very...
txt: Most all functions and features work wonderfully. It is very quite. However, it does not dry the dishes.  They are always wet are cycle.  I use jet dry.  A Big Fly in the ointment for me.

title: Dishwasher
txt: I love my dishwasher! I like being   able to set the time for the cycles. Love the top rack for knives. Dishes are super clean and glasses shine. I feel you could do better with operating instructions. It took me a bit to figure it out. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Love this dishwasher but.
txt: We were in need of a dishwasher and decided to spend a bit and get this Bosch and boy are we delighted with the performance. However, the child lock controls are a joke and these disable everything but the On/Off switch while the machine running. Wonder who was the genius who came up with this idea. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Love this dishwasher but.
txt: We were in need of a dishwasher and decided to spend a bit and get this Bosch and boy are we delighted with the performance. However, the child lock controls are a joke and these disable everything but the On/Off switch while the machine running. Wonder who was the genius who came up with this idea. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Bosch dishwasher
txt: This is my Second Bosch and I love it. I bought this one for our new home. It is quiet and cleans well.

title: Quiet as a church mouse
txt: I've had by Bosch 300 Series for about 2 months now, and the first time I turned it on I had to shush everyone to figure out if it was actually on. A welcome change from my old Kenmore, which was like having a B-17 bomber in my kitchen. Dishes are easily cleaned and drying is fine if you use the drying agent. Very solid machine with easy functionality. Totally recommend.

title: DISH WASHER
txt: Everything is working great. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Pretty Perfect Cleaning
txt: Our new Bosch dishwasher is easy to use, with a separate top flat rack for silverware and other items that are small or long and somewhat flat. We can hardly tell it's running if we don't look at it, it's that quiet. Dishes come out 100% clean 99.9% of the time. We don't have to think so much about our dish-cleaning anymore. They just go right in and come out clean. No rinsing necessary as long as full chunks of food get scraped off. The energy-saving drying cycle seems to work well, too, although dishes are not always entirely dry. My husband installed it himself. He did need to run out and get one small part that he wished would have come with the machine (water line to dishwasher connector), but otherwise the installation worked out fine.

title: I LIKE HOW QUITE IT IS ALSO HOW WELL IT...
txt: I LIKE HOW QUITE IT IS ALSO HOW WELL IT CLEANS

title: No noise but still dirty dishes
txt: I was truly disappointed that the "Not necessary to rinse first" dishes still had caked on food on them.  It was so quiet I thought it wasn't running, and maybe it wasn't except the timer kept ticking down the minutes.  After I started rinsing the dishes first everything is coming out fine - we are just two people, and we don't run it every day, so for food to sit  on them for a few days really doesn't help. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Fairly quiet, but not as much as I had previously experienced with Bosch.  I do not like the cond...
txt: Fairly quiet, but not as much as I had previously experienced with Bosch.  I do not like the condensation drying feature.  Even with the "extra dry" AND sanitize options selected, my dishes are still a bit damp after a cycle.  Also found a few dishes were not as clean as I expected  - I think it was because an arm was blocked.  Too bad there is no warning mechanism in place to warn the user of that.  When not blocked, the dishes are usually acceptably clean.... but wet.

title: Love this dishwasher.
txt: It cleans so well and is very quiet.  We love the top rack and the way the middle rack is so adjustable.  It even cleaned our backed-on coffee pot. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Love the Bosch
txt: This is the quietest dishwasher we have ever owned. You have to really listen to hear if it it running. We have owned three other dishwashers in two houses, all different brands and the Bosch is in a class by itself. We have purposely tried to overload it with dirty dishes and it cleans them all every time. The third rack is a nice touch and we use it often. The only thing that could make it better would be fingerprint resistant stainless steel [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Pros: Washes well and is VERY quiet. 2nd rack being...
txt: Pros: Washes well and is VERY quiet. 2nd rack being adjustable is a bonus. 3rd rack comes in handy.Cons: Drys poorly. Have to use the "extra dry" setting every time and things still aren't dry all the way.  Also seems awkward to load but something I probably just need to get used to.

title: Great dishwasher. Highly recommend.
txt: We're really happy with our new dishwasher. If I were to be critical, I'd suggest making it just a little quieter and upgrade the buttons on the front to a bit more 'sturdy' buttons. Other than that it is truly a fantastic dishwasher! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Quietest ever!
txt: Super quiet and dishes are really clean when done. Love this dishwasher!

title: Shhh, so quiet, you can hear a mouse pass gas!
txt: I love my new Bosch dishwasher.  It is soooo very quiet.  You can't even tell it's running.  Many times, the first several weeks after install, I went back to check to make sure I had turned it on.  You can have an after dinner conversation without all that background noise.  Best of all are the squeeky clean dishes.  I finally have stopped looking for one that snuck by me.  They are all clean, every time.  Thank you for a wonderful, well made product.  Looking forward to many years of service. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Love my Bosch
txt: My unit is easy to load and holds pots, dishes, bowls, silverware, knives, whatever I need to be cleaned.  This unit is so quiet I can barely hear it running.  I am more than pleased with my Bosch Dishwasher.  I was very worried because my old dishwasher was a Kitchenaid that was 31 years old and had never had a problem.  Because Kitchenaid had sold out to Whirlpool I wanted another brand and chose a Bosch.  So far I am thrilled with it. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Impressive
txt:
We are pleased with the performance and quite

We are pleased with the performance and quietness 
Maybe a twinkling of the racks for more capacity

title: An extremely well built machine!
txt: Our first Bosch lasted us 7+ years and did not give us any trouble during those years. Our new Bosch improved on our last one with an extra rack, is unbelievably quiet and is exceeding our already high expectations. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Bosch 300 series dishwasher
txt: This is the third Bosch dishwasher I've owned ( different houses) and they just keep getting better!  My dishes have never been so shiny and NO RINSING before loading!  I love it! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Even better than the old one.
txt: I used to think my Bosch dishwasher was the best in the world. THen sold that house, had another brand in the new house, bought a Bosch to replace it, and it is the best dishwasher in the world.

title: We purchased a new dishwasher of a different manufacturer 4...
txt: We purchased a new dishwasher of a different manufacturer 4 years ago and it was horrible. As soon as we ran the first load of dishes we knew we had made a mistake. Fast forward to our purchasing the Bosch 300 series and our first load in this dishwasher had our dishes cleaner than we have seen in a very long time. The three rack system is extremely helpful and the clean and dry cycles leave dishes sparkling. Great product!

title: I LOVE this machine. I did smell the manufacturing smell...
txt: I LOVE this machine. I did smell the manufacturing smell mentioned in some reviews for the first few washes but left the door open and it soon disappeared. I took out the lower flatware container as the third row at the top was enough. The machine does a wonderful job!!

title: The washer is pretty flimsy and it doesn’t take much...
txt: The washer is pretty flimsy and it doesn’t take much to have the bottom rack slide out entirely when putting dishes in.

title: The quiet when our Bosch 300 Series stainless steel with stainless steel tub is operating exceeds...
txt: The quiet when our Bosch 300 Series stainless steel with stainless steel tub is operating exceeds our expectations.  The 3rd rack feature means our stainless steel utensils are spotless and dry when the cycle completes.  The 3rd rack frees up space in the lowest rack for larger items.  We've had our new dishwasher for a month and are really glad we bought it!

title: The 3rd tray is nice, the washer seems to hold...
txt: The 3rd tray is nice, the washer seems to hold less than other dishwashers and tall items, like bigger wine glasses and deep containers are hard to position. The set up instructions could have been better. The dish washer is quiet and does an excellent job of cleaning.

title: For a highly regarded brand, I am disappointed in the...
txt: For a highly regarded brand, I am disappointed in the quality of this appliance. It has a light cheap feel and after only a short time the wheels on the racks are already not rolling freely. The top rack falls off the slide rails easily.

Beware - don't install electric box on top of floor at back of cabinet - not enough room - had to move electric box to adjoining cabinet.

title: The best dishwasher EVER!
txt: This is so much better than the old one that we had. Cleans everything so much better. My wife is super happy I replaced our old one. It still worked but I knew it was on its last legs. The Bosch is so much better. Adjustable racks. The silverware holder at the top is great. Every piece is clean now.

title: Dishwasher
txt: Nice and quiet just like I hoped it would be.

title: Solid Machine
txt: After a lot of research I ended up choosing this model, just because of the balance it struck between value and performance. So far my wife loves it. It's super quiet and does a great job. It's not the absolute best at completely drying the dishes sometimes but I had already read about that in other reviews and my wife says it doesn't bother her all that much. Overall we're very satisfied with this dishwasher. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: BOSCH 300
txt: GREAT PRODUCT, HOWEVER THE DOCUMENTATION THAT COMES WITH THE UNIT IS LACKING AND CONFUSING.  WE HAD DIFFICULTY IN STARTING OUR FIRST WASH SO I WENT TO THE WEB AND PRINTED 43 PAGES OF DIRECTIONS. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: ALWAYS HAS WATER ON THE INSIDE OF DOOR
txt: I HATE THIS DISHWASHER.. RAN THE CYCLE AND OPENED AFTER IT WAS DONE AND INSTEAD OF IT BEING ALL DRY THEY IS ALWAYS DROPS ALL OVER THE DOOR..  HATE IT.. FEELS MOIST INSIDE TOO [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: truly excellent
txt: Having moved 14 times with the military and experienced the daily frustrations with cheaply made products, I appreciate decent appliances but this dishwasher is beyond my hopes or expectations.  The machine is well designed and quiet.   After a few days of  overcoming habit and forcing myself to use the cutlery top shelf, I now love how quickly I can unload the utensils and how much more I can get in the bottom basket.  Everything comes out clean, which was not the the case with the dishwasher we replaced, which was a well known brand and top model.    I definitely recommend this machine and am grateful I had friends who recommended it to me. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Level Up
txt: I've had several dishwashers in my lifetime and this is by far the best - and also most expensive. You get what you pay for in my experience. The Bosch is quiet and the interior sleek. Flatware washed in the top level comes out amazingly clean and the flex space in the middle rack makes it very easy to load cups, mugs and Tupperware. The bottom section doesn't seem to line up quite properly for full loading of large plates, but that's the only negative I have encountered. A solid machine that I expect to happily use for years to come. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Love how quiet & efficient this dishwasher is! Installation was...
txt: Love how quiet & efficient this dishwasher is! Installation was great!

title: Washes well but drying is not this units strength.
txt: We both got the 300 series dishwasher. There a lots of nice features and it cleans our dishes well but after the unit runs the dishes are never dry even on extra dry setting. We have to prop open the door with a dish towel and let it sit out for an hour and then most things are dry-ish. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: The Bosch 300 Series Dishwasher was installed nicely and looks...
txt: The Bosch 300 Series Dishwasher was installed nicely and looks great along with their well known quiet operation.  The bad is they don't dry and leave a lot of water when the cycle is completed.  Bosch relies on a different type of drying - kind of conductive with the outer stainless steel thermal becoming an important part f the dry cycle.  I changed the factory setting to improved drying which alters energy performance a bit but it still leaves water and some dishes not dried - even on Extra Dry.  The front stainless also stains very , very easily -

title: Excellent so far. Does a great job, really quiet. Adjustable...
