title: Great so far but......
txt: Solid dishwasher from Bosch. I have never owned a Bosch product but the reviews led me to pick this brand and model. All reviews were good from several different sources. My dishwashers have always been the cheaper models so I didn't realize how loud they were or maybe another way to view it, how quite this dishwasher runs. Racks are better made (my last dishwasher racks were held together with zip ties). So, I rate it great so far but I have only had it for a month and a half. I don't like giving high ratings on things that I haven't had long. That's the reason for a four star. In a year, I would hope to give it 5 stars. Durability is my number one concern of any product I buy. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Replacement dishwasher
txt: We like the dishwasher and are hoping it lasts longer than the last one, 4 years.  It cleans dishes well and switches are set back so that I'm not constantly bumping them on.  I have noticed that the door stays shut rather tight and this causes odors to stay inside the cavity of the dishwasher.  I would change that if I could.  Racking is different but i was able to adust to that and make things stack reasonably well.  Also the rince dry container leaks after you fill it and tilt the door upright.  It is hard to tell if the liquad is staying in there at all so I'm guessing I will go through a lot of it. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: First Dishwasher is a Winner
txt:
In our 48 years of marriage, we've never owned a dishwasher. We recently renovated our kitchen and added a dishwasher. I checked with my niece who is an interior designer who suggested Bosch and Wirecutter which recommended this model. Good advice from both.

We've had it 6 weeks now and are very satisfied with our purchase. The dishwasher is quiet and cleans very well. The interior design is very flexible with a variety of ways to configure it, giving a lot of options in loading it. It easily accepts half-sheet pans and a 6-qt soup pot.

There are just the two of and we generally can go 3 days between washes but it's very nice to have the half-load option if we need to run it sooner. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: We don't like the drying process and the fact we are forced to use a finishing product to have an...
txt:
We don't like the drying process and the fact we are forced to use a finishing product to have any sort of drying completed. Also, not all the food gets removed even though the bowl has been rinsed.  After readying reviews, we feel like we are the only people who don't like the Bosch.  We would never buy another one.
Pros - The extra shelf is great and the ability to adjust the second shelf is wonderful too.

title: Everything we could hope for in a dishwasher
txt: We replaced our 8 year old GE dishwasher that was no longer drying our dishes and had a horrible mildew smell. We chose a Bosch dishwasher due to the company's reputation and have not been disappointed. Our dishes always come out clean and dry. The controls are intuitive and there is minimal maintenance required (occasionally filling up the rinse aid and cleaning out the filter every 3-4 months). The dishwasher itself appears very sleek and clean and fits well in our kitchen decor. We love the 3rd dishwasher rack for utensils--the utensils are always thoroughly clean. We are very satisfied with our purchase and will strongly consider purchasing additional Bosch appliances in the future. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Great dishwasher..very quiet
txt: This is a great dishwasher. Three racks, so quiet you forget it's running. Does a great job even on the 60 minute cycle.  Now for the bad. They don't ship their units with the electrical connection to hook it up. Getting one was a nightmare. We were told by the installers that Bosch is the only manufacturer that does not ship the power cord. As a result, we had to delay the install for a week. Then they sent me the wrong part. Wait another week. All of that could have been avoided if Bosch just packed the proper power cord like everyone else.

title: I never knew what I was missing!
txt:
I read the reviews. I did my homework. I researched like crazy to get a new dishwasher that does more than just act as a dish holder/dryer. My old dishwasher never cleaned. No matter what I did, the dishes were spotty and even lightly attached food was not removed! 

But this...THIS Bosch! WOW! Not only does it clean like a boss, but it's SO quiet, I had to stand near it and put my head on the door to make sure it was running! Quiet! SO QUIET!

The interior has a nice, thin top rack for larger kitchen utensils, an adjustable middle rack that raises up high enough to still hold cups and allow for large plates on the bottom. 

The utensil basket is great. It lifts up if you don't want to put your utensils in the little boxes (but I prefer to). It also easily lifes out and clips onto the bottom rack. So convenient. 

The drying on this unit is great too! Whether I airdry by opening the door after it's done, or letting the heater do its job, the dishes are spotless. 

Even the door itself is solid, closes quietly, and feel solid and well-built. 

Lastly, the controls are super easy to use, easy to see, and I really like the on/off button (which my old dishwasher did not have). 

Overall, this is by far the best dishwasher I have ever owned. I will never buy another brand. Well done, BOSCH!! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

txt: At first I did not think having the top rack, the one for small specialty items that can only be seen when you pull it out, was important; but, boy, was I wrong!  Now it is my favorite feature!  It holds utensils and small cups/bowl, and sharp knives. Not only is this 3rd rack a great feature, but the overall design and flexibility of the racks is fantastic. Oh, yeah, the dishwasher does a great job getting the dishes clean. I love this machine! It's a nice dishwasher, but the racks within it do not lend themselves to loading.  A lot of space inside gets wasted, water flow gets obstructed, glasses get knocked over, since we're trying to fit dishes and such around all the wierdly angled pegs in the rack.  If I could swap the racks out for one with straight pins, I would.

It's a quiet unit, clearly powerful, and the fast 60 minute cycle is a nice feature.  I like how the food filters inside come out easily and go back in, just as easily.  The third tray on the top was a surprise.  One of these days we'll figure out how our silverware fits in it, but the plastic tray is good for sharp knives and cooking utensils. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Unsurprisingly Great
txt: The GE dishwasher that came with our new house died a few months ago. After extensive research we decided to purchase a Bosch dishwasher. What an incredible upgrade! Dishes are clearner with no water spots. We used to have to turn up our TV when the dishwasher was running... no more... the Bosch is so quiete we have to look at the LED display to confirm that it's running. The third upper rack has become indispensible... I do a lot of home baking so there are always instruments like spatulas, whiskers, etc that are sometimes difficult to fit... no longer. Even though the interior size is no larger than our old machine the layout is much better designed and has built-in flexibility such as fold down plate holder and abilty to adjust the height of the 2nd shelf. We can fit a lot more in the machine without compromising quality of the wash. We have not had the machine long enough to credibly comment on durability but we have had a Bosch washing machine for 12 years and it's still going strong... we're anticipating that the same will be true of our new dishwasher. I wish all my purchases turned out this well. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: I just installed our new dishwasher even though I had purchased installation and haul-away from H...
txt:
I just installed our new dishwasher even though I had purchased installation and haul-away from HD. The installers would not touch the installation because we have a 3" section of ¾" copper pipe between our kitchen disposal and the discharge hose. They installers insisted that they could not install anything with copper because HD holds them responsible for any problems associated with copper. So here are my comments on the installation. The Bosch installation manual could be better. It has step by step instructions, but very few tips on how to do some of the steps. I had a lot of trouble leveling the unit because of the soft plastic leveling feet that were very difficult to turn initially. I could turn them with a large slotted screwdriver, but found a small adjustable wrench more satisfying later on. They could have told us to use a 10 mm socket to adjust the height of the rear height adjuster. The real kicker was the detail at the end of the manual that required the drain hose to be at least 33" off the floor at some point! That's pretty tough when the cabinet height is 36" and there is a sink in the way. I used some scrap wood and made a plate to which I secured the plastic hose support that Bosch suggested. I maneuvered plate up as high I as could get it and fastened it to the way with several drywall screws. This was pretty tough because my arms are not long enough and my electric drill is quite heavy by today's standards. We have run a test load to make sure I hadn't messed anything up.
I can testify that this dishwasher is incredibly quiet. Its regular cycle is on the long side. I will revisit this review when we accumulate more time with it.

title: We purchased the BOSCH  300 Series dishwasher from Home...
txt: We purchased the BOSCH  300 Series dishwasher from Home Depot In Reno, Nevada. The sales representative went over all of the details of the installation and explained all details concerning the delivery. The original delivery date was not met because the dishwasher did not get to the store in time for delivery. It was worth the wait! The new delivery was on time and the delivery driver went over the installation. I installed the unit myself. Everything that I needed to do the installation was included. The only thing I had to do was drill a new hole in the kitchen cabinet, hook up the water,hook up the drain hose and plug it in. This is a great dishwasher. It is so quiet, you can hardly hear it running. Also, it does a wonderful job of cleaning. You can't go wrong if you need a new dishwasher, buy a Bosch.

title: The installation was a little tricky. The connection in the...
txt: The installation was a little tricky. The connection in the back where the hot water comes into the dishwasher was difficult. Not only is it hard to see and get to but it took a lot of work to get it to stop leaking. Granted, the leak was a slow drip, it is still a leak.

title: The Bosch is so quiet!  Love the stainless tub...
txt: The Bosch is so quiet!  Love the stainless tub and silverware tray. The only disappointment is we had to order it on line because local outlet didn’t have any white bosch with front controls, and the staff in that department couldn’t be bothered to wait on us.

title: Installation was not difficult but here are some tips: This product comes with a 120V plug tha...
txt:
Installation was not difficult but here are some tips: This product comes with a 120V plug that must be used, so I had to install a socket into the electrical box that had previously been hard-wired to the old dishwasher.  You will also need to purchase a brass elbow with a faucet connection on one end to connect water to the dishwasher as this isn't provided.  The other end to mate with whatever water hose you have.  It installed nicely.
   The front controls will default to the Auto mode and can't be changed if the drying agent compartment isn't filled with something (we use water as we don't want to use a drying agent).  Other than figuring that out, the controls are easy to use and seem to be very robust.  We've used it now for about 3 weeks and it does a fantastic job washing the dishes.  We have an open-concept home and we can't hear it running in the next room space - very nice!

title: Love it. Very quiet!!...
txt: Love it. Very quiet!!

title: By far better than the prior Frigidaire Gallery I had.  This one actually dries the dishes and cl...
txt: By far better than the prior Frigidaire Gallery I had.  This one actually dries the dishes and cleans them so much better.  I'm glad I chose the panel on the front too.  I could never tell if the Frigidaire was finished or not.  Highly recommend.  It was worth the extra money.

title: This dishwasher is great! Installation was simple. A 90 deg. elbow for the water line had to be...
txt: This dishwasher is great! Installation was simple. A 90 deg. elbow for the water line had to be purchased separately but the electrical was attached ready to plug into the wall. I didn't realize the unit was operating it was so quiet. It also has a lot more internal room (volume) than my 20 year old kitchen Aid dish washer that it replaced in the exact same under counter space location.

title: We are happy with the cycles available, cleaning ability, and...
txt: We are happy with the cycles available, cleaning ability, and low noise level. The 3rd rack is great. However, I wish I had checked the bottom rack layout before purchasing. It seems awkward and not very flexible. I will make sure to check that next time so we get one more practical for us.

title: Extremely quiet
txt: I love this dishwasher because it is so quiet. When I turn it on, I barely hear it running. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Quality and function
txt: Every aspect of this product speaks of quality, solid construction, and excellent function. This unit is exceptionally quiet. It offers every feature one could ask for. Its appearance is clean and modern. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Dependable, quiet, flexible dishwasher
txt: Very quiet.  Its pleasure to be able to eat in the kitchen with the dishwasher running.  Much more room than our previous dishwasher.  Ability to adjust the height of the middle rack allows more flexability, increasing capacity. The third top rack hold things that may otherwise fly around.  We don't use rinse aid, so the plastic left over containers get water spots.  Nothing else gets spotted, though, and everything gets very clean. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: so far so good
txt: So nice to open the dishwasher and find that all of the dishes are clean! The design fits things much more efficiently too.

title: When the dishwasher is done the dishes have a film...
txt: When the dishwasher is done the dishes have a film on them. They feel like the detergent wasn’t rinsed off.

title: Love it
txt: We absolutely love our new Bosch 300 series. We had to set the drying time to higher and turn off the alarm, but since that has been done, it is perfect.

title: quiet, thorough, versatile, and flawless! 3rd home that we've switched...
txt: quiet, thorough, versatile, and flawless! 3rd home that we've switched to the 300 Series and all great experiences! Shows 44 dB as not being quiet as some.... It can hardly be heard

title: Attractive front control unit. The third rack for silverware is well laid out. We have had a di...
txt:
Attractive front control unit. The third rack for silverware is well laid out. We have had a dishwasher with a third rack in the past and this was a "must have" option for us. Really like the additional removable utensil basket on the bottom rack for those pieces that do not fit on the top.

It is very quiet and you have to be standing next to it to hear it run.

I cannot rate reliability since we have had it for only a month.

Installation was a breeze.

Only thing that we are "learning to use" is that the tines on the middle and lower rack do not fit our dishes well. But I cannot count off for this, because if we buy new dishes they may fit the layout very well.

title: Cleans great doesn’t dry them at all
txt: So I've run this thing about 5 times. It cleans and sanitizes great but it won't dry a single thing in there even on EXTRA DRY. I mean why have that if it doesn't work AT ALL.  There is literally no difference between regular cycle and hitting the extra dry button.  The main reason I spent an extra $300 was to have dry dishes. I mean there is A LOT of water left on the floor dishes every time.   All washers clean and sanitize even the cheap ones. BTW this thing takes 2hr 15 min on normal cycle. That's a long time Bosch folks. Feel free to call and discuss. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: We have had the new dishwasher for a few weeks...
txt: We have had the new dishwasher for a few weeks now.  It is great so far.  We love the 3rd tray.  It is quiet and cleans well.  Obviously one cannot rate durability with only a few weeks of experience, but assuming that it meets expectations there it is definitely a 5 star.

title: Its been great
txt: Works great.  Everything is very clean.  Very quiet during operation. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Very good washer.
txt: Cleaning part is very good. Drying part not as good as cleaning. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: I bought this dishwasher April 2019. Everything worked great and it was super quiet until it stop...
txt: I bought this dishwasher April 2019. Everything worked great and it was super quiet until it stopped working in December 2019. We need to replace two control panels and a seal. Our last dishwasher lasted over 25 years. This is LOW QUALITY GARBAGE. I expected more

title: I re-entered the 21st Centiry with my family of 7...
txt: I re-entered the 21st Centiry with my family of 7 with this dishwasher. It makes kitchen clean up so much easier. It’s quiet and it works great. There is plenty of room for a big family and dishes are clean without rinsing first. I’m very pleased with this purchase and highly recommend.

title: Easy to install and runs great!!...

title: Glad I Purchased
txt: I am happy with my new dishwasher. It does a great job of washing my dishes. It is easy to load and unload and is very quiet. I especially like the rinse cycle: it is short but effective in holding small amounts of dishes for later washing. Overall, this is a great product.

title: Glad I Purchased
txt: I am happy with my new dishwasher. It does a great job of washing my dishes. It is easy to load and unload and is very quiet. I especially like the rinse cycle: it is short but effective in holding small amounts of dishes for later washing. Overall, this is a great product.

title: Really cleans well!
txt:
Great buy for this price point.  Efficient quiet dishwasher.  

Gets the job done and looks good too! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Quiet as our last Bosch Dishwasher
txt: This is our second Bosch Dishwasher and it is as quiet as the last one. These dishwashers are not just quiet but noticably quieter than most dishwashers. The standard washing cycle does an excellent job also. On the downside, it takes much longer to do the same wash job and unless we add extra time for additional drying, the dishes come out damper than in the old dishwasher. In looking into this I understand this is caused by new standards which, while using less water and enegry, also take longer and dont dry as well. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Outstanding!
txt:
We could not be more pleased with our new Bosch dishwasher! It has performed every function with ease and quiet competence.
We forget it is running it is so quiet! We especially love the ease of loading and the incredible convenience of the third rack!
This was our first Bosch appliance;We have had this for both the Thanksgiving holiday and Christmas with lots of family and many loads; it has again performed with excellence!

Thank you Bosch for your excellence in design and performance! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Wonderful dishwasher
txt: This unit replaced a 10 year old GE.   Immediately noticed how much quieter the Bosch is.  Dishes come out clean and dry.   Like that it has an on/off button and lights up so you can tell when it's running. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Great dishwasher!
txt: Love how easy this dishwasher is to load, and how flexible the loading arrangements can be. So quiet when it is operating, at first we weren't sure it was running! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Very happy with purchase
txt: We were replacing a 20 year old Bosch dishwasher and the new equivalent to what we had is quieter and larger inside. It takes a little while to figure out how to load most efficiently and even though the silverware rack at the top takes longer when loading, it is super easy when putting away clean dishes. Just wish  it would hold the same cleaning settings last used instead of having to change from auto setting every time. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Whisper quiet workhorse
txt: This dishwasher is not only whisper quiet but a real workhorse when it comes to cleaning.  Highly recommended. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: HORRIBLE smell
txt: Ran it and it filled my house with a tar smell.  It made me sick.  After that I googled it and apparently this is a known issue with Bosch's as they use bitumen (asphalt).  Stay away.  We threw away our dishware items and are hand washing our dishes while trying to figure out the return.

title: Best dishwasher ever!
txt: I bought this to replace a top of the line kitchen aide dishwasher. The kichen aide was NEVER this good. Its quiet, my dishes are always clean, and in much shorter time. I will never buy anything else! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Bosch 300
txt: It works really great. It's really nice to have. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Bosch 300 Dishwasher
txt: I saw many reviews for this product and they are what convinced me to purchase it.  I am disappointed with the cleaning results that I have had.  The only cycle that really gets the dishes clean without food still left on many of the dishes is the heavy (longest ) one.   I use the dishwasher every day, sometimes 2x a day, and clean the filter weekly.  I scrape the dishes before I put them in but don't feel that I should have to rinse them off before washing them in this dishwasher.  My previous dishwasher was a Kenmore which was about 15 years old and did a better job cleaning and drying and I almost never used the extra dry cycle.  If you use powdered soap in the Bosch, some of it will cake up hard and not all be used up.  You have to hit it hard to get it out of the soap tray afterwards. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

txt: Cleans really well. The third top rack is great for utensils. Very quiet so it’s good that they provide a light to tell you it’s running. Only disappointment is that the load is never really dry, even on the “extra dry” setting.

title: terrible lower rack and maximum weight
txt:
This is my first Bosch and last. Manual shows recommendations on how to load 12 plate place settings. Loaded with only 8 and exactly how shown. lower rack collapsed into tub. Bosch rep stated that my dishes are too heavy ( Not sure who buys a dishwasher with a maximum weight capacity in mind nor do appliance stores sell them with weight capacity). Put in fewer dishes still collapses &caused dent on the door inside. Bosch stated that I exceeded the maximum weight ( which is not indicated in manual nor could Bosch tell me the maximum weight and that my stoneware is too heavy(manual states nothing about dinnerware stoneware may be too heavy).
Bosch sent a new lower rack same happened. I now have a dishwasher that can only handle 3 plates at a time on lower rack.
The only 1 good thing about it ... it's so quiet I have no idea that the lower rack collapses during a cycle. I only give it 1 star is because I have to or I cannot submit the review [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

txt:
Pros:  quiet, good selection of options, very effective cleaning.

Not Perfect:  I can't find a good way to tilt cups so water is not pooling on the inverted bottom of cups.

Tip:  if there's room inside the space for the dishwasher, consider adding sheetrock to cabinet sides for extra sound deadening.  Seemed to work, but unit is very quiet regardless. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Dishwashet
txt: Overall I like my dishwasher. The only things I don't care for are the dishes don't completely dry. Even when i set it on extra dry. Also I don't like that if im running a wash cycle and open the door to put something else in, you have to remember to push the start button again. It does not automatically restart the cycle. I do like that the dishes get very clean and my silverware has never gotten cleaner. Overall I would recommend thos product. Thanks [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: So far, so good. The installation was much easier than...
txt: So far, so good. The installation was much easier than other brand dishwashers that I had. The unique way of adjusting the back foot from the front makes it easy to level the unit once it's under the cabinet. You don't have to keep pulling the dishwasher out and adjusting and putting it back in.

txt: I can get all my dishes plus odd large items like grill parts from my Ninja grill into it.  It cleans beautifully. Believe me, my old D/W (I inherited with the house) literally sounded like someone was grinding bones while I was trying to watch TV.  Holding a lot, cleaning beautifully, and being super quiet is all that. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Best Dishwasher!
txt: We love our new Bosch dishwasher!  I didn't think we would ever use the third rack, but it's probably the best feature that I didn't know I was looking for.  The dishwasher is so quiet, we don't even realize it's running.  The indicator lights are great, especially the light to replace rinse agent which was always a mystery before our Bosch.  It cleans wonderfully, even baked on foods.  I can't stress enough how fantastic this dishwasher is.

It is extremely quiet- hard to tell when it is running.  Has three racks with the second rack adjustable depending on what you want to load.  We have always heard that Bosch was best and we believe it now that we own one. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

Even if I use the "extra dry" feature, it still leaves a lot of water behind on the dishes to where I have to towel dry all of my cups and plates. My older model did an amazing job drying the dishes. But, it is not enough for me to go through all the hassle of returning it to the store. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: They're Clean!
txt:
Last month we replaced our old dishwasher with a new Bosch series 300. I did not know a dishwasher could get things so clean. Not once have I had to set a dish aside and rewash it. 
It is also QUIET. I never hear a thing.
I particularly like the top silverware rack. It helps keep things organized and it makes putting away the silverware very easy.

title: This Bosch model is *very quiet* and seems to clean well.   Plastic tops, if placed flat in the s...
txt: This Bosch model is *very quiet* and seems to clean well.   Plastic tops, if placed flat in the shallow top 3rd rack, do not get completely dry, and will still have some standing water in them at the end of the cycle, even with the higher dry time option selected.  Flat utensils placed in the top 3rd rack do get dry.   The red cycle indicator lamp which shines on the floor at the right corner of the dishwasher is a nice touch.  It comes with a cord, drain hose and water inlet hose.   The optional electrical connection junction box (purchased separately) is a good quality box which makes for an easy connection with screw terminals, rather than wire nuts, which are normally used with a standard junction box.

It has a handle on the bottom drawer to pull it out which is nice and a holder for the silverware that ensures each piece gets clean.  It also has a third rack at the top for other pieces that lay flat.  And the biggest perk is that it is sooo quiet.  A great choice! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Nothing but the best; Bosch!

title: Bosch 300 series dishwasher review
txt: We are very pleased with the performance and quietness of our new Bosch 300 series dishwasher in stainless steel. We love the multiple features including several choices for length of running the dishwasher cycle. Amazingly quiet. So quiet, we often forget it is running. This unit replaced our 18 year old Bosch which was much noisier and did not offer multiple wash cycles. The additional upper third tray is handy for washing flat items. Dishes come out squeaky clean. Our overall impression is we are impressed with the performance and sound level of this Bosch 300 series dishwasher. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Great
txt: Gets the job done! Even when things are not complete cleaned off before going in. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Best Dishwasher I have Ever had!
txt:
This dishwasher was purchased for me as a surprise from my children, because my previous dishwasher had died, and was not that old. 
Needless to say I was very surprised and grateful, but now that I have used it daily, there is not a day that goes by that I don't say, " I really love this dishwasher!" It fits so many dishes and is set up so well, that there are never any dishes or pans that do not come sparkly clean! And the silverware drawer is genious!! I love it!!!
If you are looking for a new dishwasher, this is the one to buy!!! I love it and look forward to using it for a long, long time!
Thank you Bosch for making a diswasher I can trust! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Quiet Dishwasher
txt: This is a very quiet dishwasher that cleans well with no residual water on dishes as long as they are tilted. It's attractive and love the stainlesssteel interior.

title: Always go with the Bosch
txt: Every building I remodel or build has a Bosch dishwasher for the quiet, best cleaning, and last a long time.  I bought my first Bosch in 1989 and was wowed by how quiet it was from the replacement, in my mind the cost differential made it worth the purchase and the rest is history. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Neat, clean, efficient
txt: This machine was professionally installed for me.  It looks neat and clean and is easy to keep clean.  The silverware tray, a flat tray at the top, is an excellent feature, permitting numerous pieces to be inserted sideways and they are much easier to remove and sort than from the traditional baskets (also no accidental cuts from knives!). Two levels are for the usual things one washes, with racks that fold down or up as needed.  It is very quiet, the only noise that is faintly heard is the sloshing of water and this can be decreased with properly placing dishes, pans, etc.  The use of the extra drying is recommended as is the soap type suggested by Bosch; both make the final product clean and dry.  Very pleased with the machine. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Decent dishwasher
txt: Does a fantastic job washing.  It is annoying that it doesn't have a dry cycle though.  Dishes are usually still wet.  The dishwasher is so quite we sometimes forget its running! (awesome).  The adjustable rack is awesome as well. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

It does not have wine glass holder like my older dishwasher, so  I can’t seem to fit my wine glasses in a secure manner.  But we are still working on it since it might be the way I am loading them in.  Anyway, good dishwasher at a good price.

title: Terrific Performance
txt: This is not my first Bosch dishwasher. And, I never have been disappointed with them. I had to leave my first behind when I sold my house. My next house already had a non-Bosch dishwasher in the kitchen, so I made do with it--complaining with each use until it finally had so much wrong with it that I headed to the closest appliance store and bought my new Bosch. It is every bit as wonderful as I expected. It is quiet, of course. In addition, it cleans perfectly, and even plastics are dry when I unload. The space inside leaves plenty of options for filling it up per the needs of each load. And I love the convenience of the silverware rack. Makes unloading a breeze--no sorting if I loaded accordingly. Never again will I settle for anything other than a Bosch dishwasher' [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Great Dishwasher
txt: Did a kitchen refresh this summer.  Went with a differnt manufactur for other applaicnes but stayed with Bosch for the dishwasher.  Bought out first Bosch 15 years ago and really liked it.  And while it still worked, opted for a new one that matched the rest of the appliances.  Really quiet!  Washes everything well with no issue.  Great features like 1/2 load, time delay (but you really don't need this becuase it is soooo quiet).  Definately recommend this dishwasher. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: As expected
txt: From all the reviews we'd read Bosch was at the top of the list. The only question was which model. We bought this particular model because we didn't want a handle and wanted to see the time remaining in the cycle.  The unit is ultra quiet. So much so it's hard to tell it's actually running.  It's like heaven compared to our previous one.  Our has three racks. We like and use the top silverware one all the time. I have only two items that could be improved. The second rack normally for glasses doesn't seem to fit ours very well so we can't pack as much as before. The other is the silverware rack on lowest rack.  We don't use it hardly at all but when removed it's not really good for anything else.  No foldable rack or groves for other dishes.  Regardless, I wouldn't trade those fixes for the quiet and the spotless dishes. It does an incredible job cleaning and we only scrape off the food. It's does the rest.  One more thing I would like to have - a hard food disposal.  Don't like having to clean the filter once a month. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Whisper quiet
txt: It's been a month and counldn't be happier with this dishwasher.  Good price, easy to use, works great and is super quiet.  So quiet the first couple times we used it, we'd stop talking and listen in total silence and still could barely hear it.  5 Stars. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Great Dishwasher!
txt: This is our third Bosch DW (in 3 different houses over about ten years) and the second with the third rack feature.  We still can't believe that it dries the glassware better than the ones with heating elements that we replaced. The racks also allow us to put more plates and bowls in each load. And, of course, the third rack for flatware and utensils is a big part of that. Oh, and they are definitely quiet, which is very important for our open concept home. These machines really do a great job! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: DO NOT BUY THIS DISHWASHER UNTIL BOSCH RECTIFIES THE DEFECT BOTTOM RACK. I bought this dishwasher...
txt: DO NOT BUY THIS DISHWASHER UNTIL BOSCH RECTIFIES THE DEFECT BOTTOM RACK. I bought this dishwasher in September 2019 and have only been able to wash dishes on top rack and only plastic on bottom rack. The bottom rack collapses with any weight on it. Bosch has order a new bottom rack but I have still not received it because the racks have not passed quality control according to Bosch. They are now telling me December for the new rack. I was informed by Bosch there is a maximum weight capacity on the bottom rack but it is not printed in the manual nor could they tell what the weigh capacity is....never heard of such a thing neither has anyone else.It gets great reviews but need to research lower rack. This seems to be a common issue that has not been corrected.

It's easy to load, the racks are sturdy and not cheap and thin like most every other model we looked at. The only issue I can note, is that the LED color for the monitoring of the dishwasher is bright red. Yes, it's easy to read but the red is somewhat jarring. Small issue, but worth knowing about. title: Great dishwasher!

I have heard only good reviews, etc...about them.  Now that I own one, I know why.  They are well built and do the job.  Nothing flimsy about how the racks are built and they clean well.  They also look very nice in my kitchen and it was simple to install. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Bosch 300 Series Dishwasher
txt: Since purchasing our new dishwasher we have that it does a very good job in cleaning the dishes we put in it. The way the dishwasher is layed out permits us to put in many more dishes, pots & pans, etc than we were able to put in our previous dishwasher. It also gives us many more choices in how we wash the dishes. Bosch has a good reputation which is one of the reasons we purchased it. Also the 3rd rack up top is very convient to put utensils and other items that protect them from other items. Overall we arevery pleased with this dishwasher. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Extremely quiet and does a great job on dishes
txt: I really like this new dishwasher. It is extremely quiet and does a great job washing dishes.  I love the rack for bigger utensils (spoons, spatullas etc).  Holds a lot of dishes. I am very happy with it. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

txt: Happy to say that my Bosch dishwasher is living up to my expectations.  It’s quiet, easy to figure out the cycles - and it came with a leak detector (prior dishwasher had issues).  Also love the top rack for spatulas! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Good, but not great.
txt: If you want quiet, buy a Bosch!  The upper flatware rack is a waste - the items don't get cleaned and you can't fit wine glasses or other larger items on the rack below it.  Thank goodness they included the standard flatware basket on the lower level (at first I wondered why it was there, but now I know).  I removed the top rack and am much happier with both its cleaning performace and loadability.  It dries well on the Auto setting, but not so much on the Normal setting.  Overall it does the job, but nothing impressive.  If I could do it again, I would buy the next series up.  Because it is quiet, I will always buy a Bosch. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: On HD website - advertised as 39 db - the...
txt: On HD website - advertised as 39 db - the machine says 44 quite clearly. The control panel is very tricky and very difficult to reset and sometimes to turn on- I anticipate trouble but it's early days. Cleans very very well

title: Buy a louder machine. The louder the spray, the quicker and better it cleans, These machines have...
txt: Buy a louder machine. The louder the spray, the quicker and better it cleans, These machines have no heating element, so the dishes never get dry. The machine was delivered new with water inside because the machine cannot dry even overnight even set to extra dry as there is no heat element in any Bosch model. It takes minimum 2 and one-half hours to 3 hours per cycle.  Cleans so-so. You must wash off food first and clean out food strainer at bottom daily.  This machine is so quiet you can’t tell it is on, but I liked my old Kenmore Quiet Guard better as it cleaned well and had heating element to dry well and was hundreds cheaper and completed cycle within one hour. You could hear the Kenmore on but it wasn’t very loud. No need to pay for this much quiet. You have to sacrifice everything else.

title: I would not buy this Bosch again.   I did not see on line that it does not 'dry' like most models...
txt: I would not buy this Bosch again.   I did not see on line that it does not 'dry' like most models.  After the display says it is finished,  if opened everything (sides, door etc) is dripping wet.   Cust. service said that was normal.   Dishes, etc. get dripped upon.  I believe Bosch dropped this type just after I purchased it!  Also the little wheels on the bottom rack keep falling off.   Pretty poor product for what is supposed to be a good name!

title: This is a replacement for the previous entry level bosch that died after 6 years of heavy use. ...
txt:
This is a replacement for the previous entry level bosch that died after 6 years of heavy use. 
Pros: Very quiet, the third shelf is nice. The cycle done beeps are not loud, about the same as a digital watch, the manual tells how to turn it off (haven't done that). Have not heard the beeps at night from the BR and we have an open floor plan but I can hear the fridge icemaker. Dishes get clean.
Cons: Wish there was a countdown clock on the front and a dirty/clean indicator. The red floor LED is not good enough. Installation was a major pain due to the new type of connections (everything connects in back, not underneath), be prepared, if your DW is not next to the sink, it will be an extra challenge to properly install as you MUST have access to the adjacent cabinet to pull the slack in the hoses and wires back. If you don't install this yourself, watch the install guy like a hawk and don't let them take shortcuts.

title: Super-quiet machine which is a really nice feature. I like the extra (3rd) rack for laying sharp ...
txt: Super-quiet machine which is a really nice feature. I like the extra (3rd) rack for laying sharp knives on and sundry other flat-tish utensils. It cleans very well as one would expect. However, I have been disappointed in it's drying ability. I always use the extra drying feature and it still leaves items wetter than my old machine. I believe it has something to do with new energy-saving guidelines. Also, initially, the smell of burning or burnt gas was awful. After some online searching I followed a suggestion to run dishwasher on high with 'extra dry' a few times without dishes. It made a difference but there's still some residual unpleasant odor after a cycle. I had to have an electrical outlet installed as this is now a standard requirement for all dishwashers. So that added to the installation cost. I arranged my own installation as Home Depot turned out to be ineffective in that department.  Can't comment on energy efficiency as I don't have the necessary equipment to gauge accuracy. I can only hope it is better than my old one.

title: It's not as quiet as the KitchenAid I replaced. It does not have a delicate cycle for china or cr...
txt: It's not as quiet as the KitchenAid I replaced. It does not have a delicate cycle for china or crystal. The layout on the bottom does not make it easy for pots or pans. I don't think I will ever again buy an appliance online. You really need to visit with a salesperson to know what you are getting. Since Bosch is a high-end appliance I just assumed it would have the features it is lacking.

Exterior look is cheaper than expected. Projects light on floor to indicate 'ON'. Interior is nice. If it keeps cleaning dishes for 15 years, I'll be happy. (So far used just 3 times).

title: I have purchased Bosch for my last two homes and have always been very satisfied. With this mode...
txt: I have purchased Bosch for my last two homes and have always been very satisfied. With this model I am having to run each load 2 to 3 times OR stand by the dishwasher and wait for it to shut off so I can open the door and let the dishes air dry. If I do not, I have to run it again because my dishes come out slimy and looking like I never washed them. Not sure what the problem is, however, I am not happy to have to deal with Bosch Warranty 1 1/2 months into the purchase. That is how it goes even when you have Home Depot handle the install.

title: Had a top line Bosh for about 10 years till somebody tripped over the open door. It was terrific....
txt: Had a top line Bosh for about 10 years till somebody tripped over the open door. It was terrific. Can't go wrong with the new top line, correct?? WRONG First the new top rack is USELESS. Silver doesn't fit any slot in it and is a jumbled mess. And unless you take out the top rack, any stemware will not fit... We removed it. Which leads to the second rack which Bosch engineers have managed to distort the wire rack so that it is almost impossibe to to get glasses to stack in any way shape or form.. And the 'adjustable' second rack mounting seems so flimsy it is sure not to last long. Bottom rack USELESS for dishes. ... Now here's the kicker.... After about 10 cycles E15 message and service call.. seems it LEAKS water into drain pan and auto shuts off .... Service guy.. he's OK.. cleans up water and runs it and finds no leak. 10 cycles later ... yup, E15 message ... Same result ... Now this is within 2 months. We now have red dye to run next ti me it happens to maybe show leak .... Service guy might be working on it out at the street trying to get my sledge hammer out of the xx#7! machine ..... If you want Bosch get the CHEAP one so you can replace it right away. It has better racks anyway

title: It is a beautiful machine yet super functional. We run a homeschooling household of 6, so talkin...
txt: It is a beautiful machine yet super functional. We run a homeschooling household of 6, so talking about dishes. The machine can literally hold I want to say twelve of our bowls and twelve little plates just in the second rack. Just a ton of room. I'm still learning on how to fit cups in this machine. Seems like all of our regular cups are too big for the space that the dishwasher has provided along the sides of the second rack. Maybe when the kids are older we can all switch to dainty mugs? We absolutely love the third rack. It's just what I expected. Some days we just remove the utensil basket all together to wash pots/pans, since all the silverware are in the third rack. And yes, it's as quiet as it claims! We love it!

Dishwasher is really quiet, which is not too much of a concern for me, but it still is powerful and works really well.  Cleans everything that I put into it.  I like the top 3rd shelf to put miscellaneous kitchen tools and all the shelves are spacious [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

I wish the dishwasher dried my dishes.  It uses very hot water.  Dishes don't dry.  Must be dried by hand.  

Dishwasher didn't come with manual from factory.  

Easy to install, I did it myself.  

Nice inside, smooth stainless steel.  Lots of room [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

Our last dishwasher failed to completely clean many dishes and most silverware. The Bosch dishwasher is extraordinarily quiet and cleans every item to our complete satisfaction. We love it. title: Dishwasher

title: Good Value
txt: I've had a lot of dishwashers at various places I've lived and this has been one of the better ones if not the best. If I've taken the time to load  it correctly the dishes get perfectly clean, no matter how caked on food is to them. This of course is within common sense reason. I've only had one issue, my kitchen scissors have a cover on the nut that connects the two pieces and it came off and somehow got passed the impeller clogging the hose halfway down the drain line. Not a big deal but I had to disconnect everything and get the needle nose pliers to get the plastic out of the tube.

title: happiness

only issue is some cycles are a little longer than hoped.
the cleaning results are great and the machine so quiet it's hard to know it's running until i notice the small red light [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Great dishwasher!
txt: Fantastic dishwasher.  After a not so easy install,(drain water kept shooting out vent- finally bypassed and just looped drain hose) couldnt be happier with this dishwasher.   Cleaning ability is amazing.  I usually pre clean but decided on a few loads not to in order to see if it would clean and it has every time.  Truly impressed.  Very quiet.  Just wish could attach own drain line (theirs is long and a little flimsy) and not have to install a Bosch junction box.  Other than that,  love it. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

Only good point that it plugs in and has screw on water supply so it would be easy to repair if it breaks.

title: Pros and Cons
txt:
Pros:  Quiet to extreme--is it washing???, cleans well, top shelf moves easily for larger dishes to be placed in bottom rack. 
Cons:  Rack prongs too close together to load dishes properly. Does not dry plastic even after sitting overnight after wash even after using Extra Dry button.  If you add a dish after starting load, you must push start again. It does not automatically continue with the cycle when you close door. It will time out and leave you with dirty dishes. Glasses on either end of rack do not get washed inside properly since the top wash arm is not long enough to reach inside those. I avoid those 2 spaces when loading glasses. Silverware rack sits too far toward back to enable easily adding 1 piece of silverware to the rack. Bottom rack must be slid out a foot to add that piece of silverware. Door of dishwasher is heavy and requires force to open, lay flat, then allows ability for rack to slide forward. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Love this dishwasher
txt:
This is my 4th Bosch dishwasher and I wouldn't have any other brand. Even when offered another brand that Is 'designer' pretty, I would still buy a Bosch. i love the stainless interior & I love the fact that it doesn't use a heating element for drying (even if that causes some wet pieces at the end of the cycle). This is the first dishwasher I've had with a 3rd rack, and I've found that to be very useful for those long, flatter objects that would ordinarily have to find spots between larger items on the lower racks. 
If I ever have to purchase another dishwasher, it will again be a Bosch. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

txt: I am happy with how well this dishwasher cleans my dishes and that it has the option to 'dry' them. My only issue is that when the dirty dishes sit for a few days while I accumulate a full load, it smells. I am unable to easily prop the door open a crack to let air circulate. So I rinse the dishes well but it can still get smelly. Don't know why I never had this problem with other dishwashers. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Very quiet but slow
txt: I'm told that this may be a problem with most (all?) modern dishwashwers in order to meet low water useage and energy efficiendy standards but in order to get rather dirty dishes cleaned, we need to use the Heavy setting, which takes almost 2 1/2 hours. Even the Normal wash is over 2 hours. This can be a problem when we have a dinner party and may need to do more that one load. Usually we run it overnight so it isn't a problem and its lack of noise is welcomed.

title: Dishwasher replacement
txt: I had to purchase a new dishwasher due to my only 4-year-old Whirlpool breaking down. After doing a little research I found that the Bosch had the best reviews for cleaning and reliability. The installation of the dishwasher was so much easier than my last one and the instructions were very easy to follow. After now using the dishwasher for a few weeks I can say that this unit is exactly what I was looking for. It cleans great, It dries everything very well and is a pretty quiet running unit. My only critique would be the rack slides do not seem to be as heavy duty as I would like and time will tell if they hold up to a family of 4 use. So far everything on this unit is working as I had hoped. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

My Bosch does a superb job, extremely quiet, directions and information pamphlet very clear. We passed over the Bosch previously thinking it might be too expensive. This time checked the ratings, descriptions, model differences and costs. My Bosch cost a third of previous machine and performance excels my expectations.

title: I'm In Love

It runs so quietly, it gets my dishes cleaner than I knew a dishwasher could and it is easy to load and unload.  The top tray for ungainly kitchen tools is a dream come true. There IS an odor to the washing machine when it arrives, as others stated, but I didn't find it bad and its faded with time.

title: New Bosch Dishwasher

The only thing is that some of the plastic items do not dry.  We solved this by choosing the sanitize and extra dry settings when running a load of dishes.  I love my Bosch and would not buy any other brand of dischwasher.

txt: Our kitchn is on the large side and we actually have 2 dishwashers. We bought 2 of this model and are very happy with it. title: Best Bosh
txt: I love my new dishwasher! Yes it is quiet, but great thing about it is that my dishes are absolutely sparking clean, Bosh puts out a great Product.

title: 300 series Diswasher
txt:
Great dishwasher. I miss the old less effecient models since they had faster cycles. now they use less water, run longer, and take longer to dry since they dont heat like the old ones either. This is the just the next generation of energy efficiant dishwashers. 

I like the third top tray and the way they have layed out the rest of the prongs for the dishes. It took a sec to figure out a new way of organizing the dishes, but now I really like it.

Installation was pretty easy once I figured out what fittings I needed to adapt to. The Power cord was included and I needed to do was take the electrical wire that was hardwired to my old one and terminate it into an electrical outlet in a box. Very basic electrical.

 All in all I really like it. Quiet, and washes dishes! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Seems good, couple months in.
txt: Dishwasher is quiet and cleans things fairly well. The bottom rack is not the best but the others work well enough. The install was easy but it is pretty annoying that the $5 part that you’ll most likely need to connect the water line doesn’t come with the dishwasher. Also this dishwasher isn’t hardwired so to speak, it comes with a power cable that plugs into a regular outlet. There is a hardwire kit available but of course it is not included and is about $50. Read the installation manual before this thing shows up and you’ll save yourself some frustration.

title: Quiet
txt: This new dishwasher is even quieter than my last Bosch. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: So quiet!
txt: We were looking for a dishwasher that was not only a great value, great reviews but one that was quiet as it is near the living room.  It totally lives up to our expectations!  I love turning it on & ask guests if they hear my dishwasher.  I think I have sold st least two! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Bosch dishwasher
txt: Overall I really like the 300 series dishwasher. The outside looks beautiful and the stainless steel is easy to clean. We purchased it because it fits into a space slightly smaller than a standard dishwasher. There are 3 shelves for cleaning. We just washed a baseball cap on the top shelf without a cap mold and it came out perfect. The lower shelf holds a lot of plates. I find it difficult to load my bowls on the lower shelf is my only complaint. It is a very quiet dishwasher. I would recommend it. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Excellent upgrade
txt: We've had this washer for several weeks now.  It looks good inside and out, and the controls are intuitive and simple.  The design robustness and build quality are evident all over.  The thick insulation layer keeps the volume level super low and also keeps the countertop from heating up.  It's so quiet you can barely tell it's running if you don't look at the panel.  Does a good job cleaning and drying, and the third rack and adjustable height second rack are very useful features for flexibility.  We've just used the regular modes so far, not the smart/sensing modes yet, but it's a great upgrade from our previous dishwasher. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Quietest dishwasher on the market
txt: This dishwasher is so quiet you wouldn't know it was on if not for the lighted buttons on th e front

title: In absolute AWE of my new Bosch!
txt: When it came time to replace the antiquated GE dishwasher that came with the house we bought in April, we searched Computer Reports and other resources on the web.  I wanted QUIET.  I wanted EXCELLENT CLEANING.  I wanted a SHORTER than normal run time.  We checked out the online features and prices and kept coming back to Bosch.  Can we really afford a Bosch?  Yup!  We bought one of the lower priced models because we don't need all the bells and whistles.  For the two of us we just need top quality in a fairly basic machine.  Now I'm loving the QUIET when it runs.  I'm reveling in the 60 minute SHORT cycle, which cleans our dishes THOROUGHLY.  We are very happy with our Bosch Series 300 Dishwasher and highly recommend it to others!

title: Nice, quiet DW
txt: Excllent DW:  v. quiet, cleans well.  Only would redesign the bottom rack to be able to stack more dishes with the pots.  Also, the accessories should be included with the price, not as add-ons. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Good buy
txt: The only reason I did not give it 5 stars is because it doesn't always dry everything as well as I think it should. Other than that I'm very happy with it. It is extremely quiet-almost silent. Fortunately there is a light that shines on the floor so you can tell when it is running. It cleans really well. Plenty of room for everything. I really like the 3rd rack for things that you can't figure out where else to put  such as spatulas. I like the fact that it has some fold down prongs adding flexibility to placement of items. Plenty of wash cycle options. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Bosch is the Best
txt: This is an excellent dishwasher.  It is quiet and effective, provides excellent feedback on the cycle, is designed well for loading, adding detergent and for the installation itself.  I am an engineer and I really appreciate the engineering that went into this. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Quite with great wash
txt: Overall it's a great dishwasher with lots of little touches that give you flexibility to fit just about anything in there.  My 4* vs 5 rating has to do with the drying. Glass and ceramic come out dry, but plasticware and nonstick pots come out pretty damp.  Still a solid, quite dishwasher. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Bosch Dishwasher Review
txt: Runs great, very quiet- don't even know its on! Cleans and drys efficiently. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: I couldn't love it more
txt: This is the first dishwasher iv ever had that you could actually put dirty dishes in, and they come out clean! It's quiet too. You hardly know it's running. The silverware drawer is also super helpful. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Awesome Dishwasher!
txt: We had researched a few dishwashers, and never having had one, didn't know really what we were looking for. But so many reviews of the Bosch 300 series were positive, so we chose it. Even our contractor was excited about this appliance once it arrived. He said it was convenient to install and easy to replace, if ever needed. Does a fantastic job of cleaning dishes and drying them, we use mainly the auto cycle so far. Quiet too, which is great in a smaller home. Easy to load. We love the very top silverware rack, so much nicer to load and remove, than everything flopping around together. Couldn't be happier with this dishwasher! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: BOSCH 300 Series Dishwasher
txt: Most efficient dishwasher ever and you can hardly hear when it's running. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Quiet, but doesn't clean dishes
txt:
What am I doing wrong? Even if I set this dishwasher to HEAVY load, I still have to wash the dishes AFTER the cycle has run. The manual advises to use powdered detergent, so I gave away the full container of liquid that I had, and bought powdered. 

 I thought I was buying a really good dishwasher!

title: Bosch 300 Dishwasher installed easily and has been working great....
txt: Bosch 300 Dishwasher installed easily and has been working great.  It's very quiet and the controls work good.  The 3rd rack is handy for knives and other items.

title: Very Quite
txt: This is the first dishwasher for us and We are pretty satisfied with the overall performance. It is very quiet and you won't notice it while you are at the kitchen. The drying process is also good. I saw some reviews complaining about dish not dry. So far, our dishes are pretty dry after using rinse aid. It may also because we are using glass dishes most of the time. Overall, a very pleasant purchase. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: The Best! Bosch
txt: After struggling with several dishwashers, our new Bosch meets and exceeds all expectations. Simple and easy to operate, the functionality and ease is amazing. Kudos to the team at Bosch. We are forever, loyalists to your brand.

title: quiet, large capacity, clean dishes
txt: Nice dishwasher: quiet, large capacity. Thoughtful and useful design: top utensil rack makes for room for more dishes+pots; middle rack is easily adjusted for height; filter easily accessed for cleaning; digital readout informs time left in cycle/clean dishes. I'm glad I decided to pay a bit more for a much better dishwasher. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Only one quibble in my 5 star rating
txt: Once we learned how best to load our Bosch (necessary with every change of appliance, of course) we complement ourselves on our good sense in buying this dishwasher.  Runs very quietly.  Love the digital display of time until done. Excellent cleaning.  Quibble: the silverware basket slots (of various sizes) often catch on our daily silverware when emptying after use. Our silverware is not, I believe, unusually large in handle-size or style than most others, yet I've taken to securing the entire bsket with my left hand and removing the silverware with my right in order to keep from  lifting the basket and upsetting it, dumping all onto the counter. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Bosch Dishwasher

title: Best Dish Washer Ever
txt: This dish washer is so quiet we can stand next to it and barely notice it's even running. Washes fantastic, dries fantastic, loads easily and the s.s. finish makes me smile. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Not so great
txt: Have had many, many dishwashers in my 81 years and this one rates the lowest.  It does clean the dishes and has a few new good features (rack is movable up and down) but it’s not easy to load like the old ones and the detergent dispenser is just plain awful.  I have tried mightily to love my new (month old) dishwasher but it’s just not happening. I expected more from BOSCH. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

Wine glasses are held steady in a drop down stem holder. Adjustable top shelf accommodates either larger pots on the bottom or longer glassware on the top.  It does take two hours to complete a cycle on the settings we chose. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Quiet as advertised. Does NOT dry well. Whether you open...
txt: Quiet as advertised. Does NOT dry well. Whether you open it soon after the cycle is done, or you leave it over night, there are always dishes that are still wet. I have to pull the dishes out and put them on my drying rack to finish the job. Ther third row that is pretty useless. Get something else.

title: The dishwasher has had a bad odor from the beginning....
txt: The dishwasher has had a bad odor from the beginning.  We have tried the recommended steps to deal with the smell but it remains quite strong.

title: New Bosch
txt: So far my experience has met my expectations.  My machine is very quiet and does a wonderful job cleaning.  I especially love the top rack for silverware and small delicate pieces.

title: Ok, Looked at this model Bosch SHEM63W52N color white for some time. Waited only to see if pricin...
txt:
Ok, Looked at this model Bosch SHEM63W52N color white for some time. Waited only to see if pricing would come down and it did not. $719.00
I purchased at Home Depot and had it delivered and old unit taken away. I did purchase a three year additional product plan for a reasonable cost. $105 .All in all after the discounts was reasonable I guess.
Delivery was on they day they mentioned but was very late past 6pm. The contracted delivery personal was fine but loaded down with too many stops. Not there fault I know the transportation business very well and they just load these guys up and don't care.
Installed with a friend and checked for leaks. None. Simple instructions and fit like a glove. This this is so and ran like a top. It does seem to have an issue with moisture after dishes are done. Will need to address this going forward. This is the first time purchasing a dishwasher at this price point and was quite shocked to see. However, unit is quite impressive and looks great. No issues to date about two weeks.

title: Bosch Dishwasher
txt: We love this dishwasher, it’s so quiet and cleans the dishes well! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: What a lovely dishwasher!
txt: We have only had our Bosch a short time, but it has changed our dish routine for the better. Perfect clean, very little noise, great dry when the “extra dry” button is used. Love that the time is displayed so we know how much longer it has to go. Easy filter cleaning. No musty smells so far. The top rack is a big win for us! We couldn’t be happier! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: New Dishwasher
txt: Recently we remodeled our kitchen. We decided to replace all of our appliances. After considerable shopping we decided to purchase the Bosch products. We liked the features and styling of all the items. Having had a Bosch dishwasher for years we were confident that the engineering of the refrigerator and gas range would be of similar quality. Satisfied with all. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: It certainly does what it is supposed to do !
txt:
I love this dishwasher. It REALLY does spotlessly clean dishes with food left on them. I only scrape off the food particles.
It is quiet. It is easy to set the cycles. My only cmlaint is regarding the upper rack. Two things bother me about the rack. It does nnot dry the items washed on that rack. And it has very little vertical room. One of the reviews I read before purchse stated that bowls could be placed there. Not true -- only flat things such as lids and plastic serving or stirring utensils fit. But I do like its other qualities and features.

title: Works very well and was the easiest to install of any of the dishwashers I have had!  Very nice u...
txt: Works very well and was the easiest to install of any of the dishwashers I have had!  Very nice unit!

title: Dishwasher heaven
txt: I have never had a Bosch product before but had heard they were wonderful.  I also thought they were very expensive.  I love my new dishwasher.  It does an excellent job on glassware, silverware as well as dishes.  I love the third rack for my silverware.  I give it 5 stars in all areas. I also am happy to say that the price was right also. So I give it 5 stars in the value department.  Did I say it is very quiet?  It is wonderully quiet!! I should have bought Bosch years ago! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: We have been using the 300 for a couple of...
txt: We have been using the 300 for a couple of weeks, holds lots of dishes, cleans them great on Auto and Normal settings so far.  The cycle seems a little long, but it's so quiet we hardly notice it's running.  Still getting used to the no heat element drying, plastics just need to be wiped before putting away.

title: Why didn’t we buy a Bosch a long time ago!
txt:
Can you love a dishwasher? Yes, when it is a Bosch dishwasher. The design of the racks allows for holding of so many dishes, bowls and glasses plus the utensil holder holds so many more forks, spoons and knives than previous brands we have owned. It cleans everything, even if food has dried on a dish or spoon. Another great feature - how quiet it is. We don’t hear it when it’s running. At first we weren’t sure it was running except for the fact that we could see the timer counting down. We love how it looks,  very sleek.
All in all there is nothing we find fault with our Bosch dishwasher. We love it! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Great dishwasher!
txt: The Bosch dishwasher we purchased has a much larger inside capacity and we really like the third rack. It is extremely quiet and we rarely hear it. The only drawback is the 2 hour and 9 minute cycle - seems a bit long. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: After many days of research I  purchased this Bosh...
txt: After many days of research I  purchased this Bosh dishwasher in Sept. 2019.  Directions tell you to scrape off your dishes but not rinse them.  I do not ever put dishes in the dishwasher that I have not rinsed off.  Yuk! Anyway I have used this dishwasher twice.  It seems to clean dishes ok and it is very quiet.  However no matter what cycle I choose to use it does not dry the dishes even using the Extra Dry function.  In my opinion this is not acceptable.  Having  the inside of an appliance always wet can cause problems with mildew and having to dry your dishes by hand is not what I expected.  Also the red light on the botton which indicates the appliance  is on does not go off after the dishes are done. Therefore I would not recommend this product. If possible I would return this dishwasher;.and yes this is a real review.

title: Pretty poor for a so called high end appliance
txt: I expected a better performer from a company that marks itself as a maker of high end products.  The upper silver ware  rack does a poor job of keeping the individual pieces stable during drawer movement and during the cycle. The unit is noisy during drain cycles also.   The biggest issue is the fact that the unit does not even come close to drying the dishes regardless whether I have it on the extra dry cycle or not. My previous dishwasher was an LG and it was fantastic in loading, washing, drying and overall quietness.  The Bosch misses those marks with the exception that it does a reasonable job on cleaning dishes that have been rinsed well prior to loading.

title: Had a Bosch 300 dishwasher for ten years and it was fantastic. When it broke, repair man said a n...
txt:
Had a Bosch 300 dishwasher for ten years and it was fantastic. When it broke, repair man said a new one was about the same as the repair cost on the old one would be.

So I ordered this dishwasher on-line based on reviews only. I really regret it. This dishwasher is made from cheap plastic. The door is so flimsy, it bends in your hands and the buttons feel like they will break every time I push one to start a load. Racks are thin and wobbly too. If I wanted this level of junky manufacturing, I could have gone with a cheaper brand and saved a ton of money.

title: We had "water in the tub" and "water in the drain tube" when we received the dishwasher. We calle...
txt: We had "water in the tub" and "water in the drain tube" when we received the dishwasher. We called Home Depot, they said 'we should not' have those situations. We called Bosch's hotline, they said "we should not' have those situations. The following Monday I opened a case with the support page on the Bosch website. They wrote back and said "we test all dishwashers and there WILL be residual water in them"... go figure. But makes one wonder, eh?

title: Efficient, Quiet, A DREAM!
txt: We bought this washer a little over a month ago and I am so pleased! I did a lot of research and ended up settling on this one because this had the highest customer review rating in it's price range.  With the rack layout, I could go 3 days without running a cycle because I can fit so much in there. I used to hand wash large items due to space issues, but not with this washer! I haven't had one dish yet with food still stuck on - even after the 60 min cycle. All my dishes are bone dry (i do use Jet Dry) and it is SO QUIET!!! The only time I remember it's on, is when the water drains. Overall, I love this washer, it was worth every penny and then some! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: I ready many reviews on many dishwashers. You can go mad reading them all, because you'll find ba...
txt:
I ready many reviews on many dishwashers. You can go mad reading them all, because you'll find bad reviews on every single one. What we have found with this dishwasher (after 2 weeks) is that the reviews have been accurate.
1) It is EXTREMELY quiet
2) The normal cycle is EXTREMELY long (2 hrs 45 min)
3) The dishes and tub are still quite wet when the cycle is complete (even after leaving the door closed for hours)
4) The dishes are clean

Installation review:
1) We were replacing an existing dishwasher, so plumbing and electric hook-ups existed
2) Install team couldn't connect plumbing (need permit) and won't connect electrical (because it's hard wired); therefore, I did not opt to pay $150 for them to do nothing more than the free delivery. Home Depot informed me of this ahead of time, so there is no issue with Home Depot on this.
3) The dishwasher comes with a cord to plug into an outlet, but if you have a hardwired connection (like we do) you MUST purchase a BOSCH junction box accessory cord for $20. Not an issue, except it has a TWO WEEK lead time (dishwasher arrived in 3 days)
4) Connections for utilities are at the back of the dishwasher, which is nice
5) Installation was pretty simple.

It's an expensive dishwasher, let's hope it lasts!

title: I'm basing this review on my experiences with my previous dishwasher, a nine year old Bosch 500 s...
txt:
I'm basing this review on my experiences with my previous dishwasher, a nine year old Bosch 500 series that required very expensive repairs (first and only problem by the way). This model really is worth five stars, more on that later. The good: excellent cleaning performance, very quiet, good drying on glass, china and metal if you can catch the "end-of-cycle" and partially open the door. Third upper drawer very handy for small items and knives and allow you to remove the flatware basket to increase space for large items. The not so good: No end of cycle sound which I really miss, Opening the dishwasher when it finishes allows moisture to evaporate from the very hot items and dry very well, even from most plastic ware. If you miss the end of cycle, some plastic item will need light towel drying, the rest will be fine. The dividers in the baskets have less movable tines than my older model but I have adapted. Drain pump seems to make more noise, not the pump, but the sound of the water splashing in the pipe (pump seems more powerful), but this is a minor issue. 

The main reason for loosing a star was installation, I replaced a Bosch with a Bosch. Should be easy right! Wrong! Power connection is a dedicated cord to an outlet, old unit was "hard wired." No space behind unit for an outlet box, unit is too deep. Installation instructions require an outlet box installed in an adjoining cabinet to the right side, cord is at the bottom right rear and while more than adequate in length in that direction, it would be a challenge in the other direction. Other than electrical, installation is fairly simple, but no 90 degree elbow is provided for the water line but it's required and listed as such in the installation instructions. Not expensive, but it's another trip for a simple part that would be easy to provide..
