title: Merrily
txt: Love my new dish washer it’s great have used Bosch for years they last for years [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Top notch!
txt: This is my second Bosch dishwasher and this new one is even better than the old one I had before. The dishes always come out spotless and love having a third level! It is super quiet and I have found that the speed cycle of 60 minutes is perfect for my needs. Also, I like the design change in the cutlery container. The slots are of several sizes and can fit my silverware better than the previous model. This is a fantastic dishwasher! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Super Quiet
txt: This dishwasher is as quiet as everyone describes.  It does a great job of cleaning the dishes, and thankfully the filter is easy to remove and clean off, because I need to do it about once a month.  It builds up some gunk in there.  It does have a certain almost chemical smell after a load runs.  I'd make sure to leave the door open or at least cracked when not in use. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Quiet
txt: We love our new dishwasher.  The 3rd track is very handy. The adjustable rack allows for tall stuff. But the best part is how quiet it is. Unless its draining  you can't tell it's even running. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Is is running?
txt: This dishwasher is so quiet I can't believe it!  When I hear the water gurgling down the drain, I have to get up and check to see if something is wrong.  One feature I especially like is the top drawer for the silverware and cutlery.  I haven't used the silverware basket yet.  I try to convince people to just load the dishes in the dishwasher after just scraping them.  They don't believe me that they'll get clear without rinsing.  It hasn't failed me yet! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Great dishwasher
txt: This unit replaced a 3year old Maytag. The Maytag had 3 repairs and the 4th exceeded the value and the warranty company wrote us a check for the full value of the unit. The Bosch is far better. It’s extremely quiet, does a superior job cleaning and is much more versatile in the loading of dishes. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Great machine
txt: We've been using this dishwasher for month which doesn't sound like much but most days I have run 2-3 loads each day as we recently moved so had lots of dishes and glassware to wash. We tried a different setting for each load. Dishes were clean every load. Very happy with this machine. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Super quiet and cleans well!
txt:
This dishwasher is so quiet that when I installed it I thought I had done something wrong because I couldn't tell it was running. I had to go around the house and turn off ceiling fans before I heard it running... wow!

Dishes come out sparkling every time and the mesh drain trap is very easy to remove and clean out. 

Has a simple to use interface and looks great. Would definitely recommend to anyone looking for an excellent dishwasher. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: quiet & capable
txt: Wow - significantly quieter!  We were slightly hesitant to take the leap based on varied reviews of the drying or lack of drying.  So glad we did.  Our dishes are noticably cleaner than AND dryer than the model it replaced (which was only 2yrs old).  Love the 3rd rack to free up more space.  The stacking of dishes and layout of the tines is pretty different so seems weird at first.  Still trying to figure out it's intent and do the best job getting dishes in, but no big deal.  When cycle is over, the disply stays lit - with 00's I think - so if you open it, then close it the display resets as if you want to start a new cycle so need to press the on/off button to make that stop.  It's just a little weird.  Overall great appliance purchase and I would recommend to others [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Amazingly clean
txt: We upgraded from a 12-year dishwasher to the Bosch and were stunned by how clean the dishes, especially glassware, came out of the machine. Follow the directions on detergent and rise aide and you will be amazed. It's also reasonably quiet and easy to use. Did I mention how dang clean it gets the glasses? [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Great Dish Washer
txt: Very quiet and effective as advertised. Love this so far. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Installed. Read manual. Tried two different cycles. Detergent didn't release. Didn't clean any...
txt: Installed. Read manual. Tried two different cycles. Detergent didn't release. Didn't clean anything at all. Wet damp mess. No dry cycle despite choosing extra dry. Brand new professionally installed machines over $700 should work immediately without fuss.

title: Very quiet, only hear the water emptying out.The size handles all of my needs. My glasses/glasswa...
txt: Very quiet, only hear the water emptying out.The size handles all of my needs. My glasses/glassware are getting clearer, not as cloudy as before. I purchased the Bosch about a month ago. I do use the Extra Dry feature to make sure everything dries. Learned to make sure big spoons are turn down when using the 3rd rack, so water doesn't pool. I read the reviews and agree that it's worth the extra cost. I had a stainless steel tub dishwasher in my other house and moved into a new home without a stainless, missed it for the past 7 years. So happy to have made this purchased.

title: 5 Star Review
txt: Rating provided by a verified purchaser

title: Low noise superb productExcellent & superior home appliance...
txt: Low noise superb productExcellent & superior home appliance

title: Very quiet. Cleans well on the auto cycle.  The...
txt: Very quiet. Cleans well on the auto cycle.  The door is a bit difficult to open and close.Normal installation assumes you will plug in the dishwasher to a power receptacle. If your old dishwasher was wired directly, you'll need to install a power receptacle at the back of an adjacent cabinet or buy a junction box and power cord from Bosch.

title: Very pleased with my new dishwasher!! So quiet and really...
txt: Very pleased with my new dishwasher!! So quiet and really cleans thoroughly. Also, I wait 15 minutes before opening it up to unload and everything is completely dry and spot-free.I want to mention that there is no odd smell that as a few people have referenced in their reviews.

title: The dishwasher works excellent. Quiet and well designed for accommodating most any dish size. The...
txt: The dishwasher works excellent. Quiet and well designed for accommodating most any dish size. The silverware tray is so much better of a design than our old unit. Only ding is the design of the under-cabinet attachment, it is only 2 small screws and not very sturdy brackets and that is all that holds the unit it place.

title: Easy to install myself. Bosch provided installation options with dishwasher for either plug in or...
txt: Easy to install myself. Bosch provided installation options with dishwasher for either plug in or hardwiring the dishwasher. Cleaning is excellent, noise is excellent and speed is good. Only negatives are the drying - must use the extended drying time - and even then large items tend to "pond" water - especially on the top rack. Unit could also use a better identification that that the dishes are clean other than a small dot on the LCD screen.

title: Awesome Piece of Engineering
txt: This dishwasher is just awesome. Next to no noise compared with the others we have bought and tried. Bosch has once more outdone our expectations. The layout is simply marvelous!

title: Absolutely top-notch quality, design
txt: Like many folks, I've owned a few brands of dishwashers over the years.  This is my first Bosch.  And now, I'm wondering why I didn't go with Bosch a long time ago.  The impeccable quality, funtional build and anticipated durability became very evident from the first wash.  Spotless dishes, 3 racks and dry dishes - ready to load in the cupboard.  Take the guesswork out of it (and follow major ratings sources) and buy a Bosch. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Can’t hear it run.
txt: Dry clean dishes and can’t beat it run. What else is there?  Highest rating. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Cleans Beautifully !
txt: Nothing  cleans dishes  like a Bosch.  It's  quiet too!  I'm  really  enjoying  my new Bosch dishwasher .

title: Quiet and thoroughly cleaning dishwasher
txt: Very well cleaning dishwasher with easy handling. Like the upper level for unusual flt shapes of cooking equipment and the adjustable second level. If anything, you might look into the cycle extreme lenth for sanitize and exra dry. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Loud
txt: This disherwasher was supposed to be quite; it’s not.  I measured the the average decibel at 70 over a wash cycle!  I can hear it from nearly every room in the house. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Great Dishwasher
txt: A nice looking dishwasher (although my daughter thinks it looks really "old-school) that is super quiet. Can't even tell it's running unless I'm right on top of it. Does a nice job of cleaning and drying. So far, so good. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: The dishwasher is everything we hoped it would be. The machine is very quiet and easy to operate....
txt:
The dishwasher is everything we hoped it would be. The machine is very quiet and easy to operate. Would recommend  to others!  It has been
installed for almost a week.

title: Extremely quiet. Nice look. Cleans great.
txt: Extremely quiet. Nice look. Cleans great.

title: So far great! Very quiet. Like the red light that reflects off the floor to let you know it's run...
txt: So far great! Very quiet. Like the red light that reflects off the floor to let you know it's running. Regarding the complaints about dishes not drying. You need to leave the dishes in overnight or at least a few hours. They are dry in the morning. I love the half load setting for days I dont cook so dont have enough dirty dishes for a full load.

title: Great Machine, Much Better than the old one
txt: Our old dishwasher did a pretty good job of getting the dishes clean (or so we thought). But we had to replace it because it was making a loud grinding noise. We did our research and found that CR had about 9 Bosch units in their top 10. We went to our local appliance people, who were very helpful, and chose this model because it had a visible display. The installation was quick and easy. When the installation tech turned it on we were amazed at how quiet it is. If it weren't for the display, you wouldn't know it was on. My wife absolutely LOVES the 3rd rack and comments on it every time she uses it. But the best part was how much cleaner the dishes are, especially the red wine glasses. My wife used hand wash them sometimes because of the stain on the glass if left overnight. Now they come out crystal clear, using the same soap and rinse agent. This is one of our better investments. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Tis is the quietest dishwasher we have ever owned. It...
txt: Tis is the quietest dishwasher we have ever owned. It does an excellent job of cleaning our dishes.

title: This dishwasher is a lovely machine, does an excellent job...
txt: This dishwasher is a lovely machine, does an excellent job washing dishes! Not quite as quiet as I’d hoped.

title: This unit was easy to install, and is very quiet...
txt: This unit was easy to install, and is very quiet and easy to use.

title: Installation was clean, fast, and efficient by the contracted Homr...
txt: Installation was clean, fast, and efficient by the contracted Homr Depot Team. The machine is a dream! Quiet and cleans to beat the band.

title: My dishwasher is so quiet I actually thought there was...
txt: My dishwasher is so quiet I actually thought there was something wrong with it the 1st time I used it.

title: This is the quietest dishwasher we've ever heard (and it's not even Bosch's quietest). Our previ...
txt:
This is the quietest dishwasher we've ever heard (and it's not even Bosch's quietest). 
Our previous Bosch lasted 15 years, so it is definitely our brand of choice. This one has the connections on the back of the unit, which makes a lot of sense to us. We're glad we could find a model with the buttons and display visible when the door is closed - this design gives it a slightly retro-look, which we like. The third shelf, which is configured for silverware and utensils, took a little getting used to, but it is fantastic, far better than the basket on our previous model. All-in-all, Bosch dishwashers just keep getting better and better.

title: A good dishwasher.  I wish some of the glass...
txt: A good dishwasher.  I wish some of the glass holders were more adaptable, but overall I’m happy with my purchase.  Also wish the cycles were more changeable, but the quality is good, it is VERY quiet and washes the dishes well.

title: We love this dishwasher. It was moderately easy to install....
txt: We love this dishwasher. It was moderately easy to install. If you have an electrical terminating box nearby, it is easy - hookup to the electrical box and then just plug in to the dishwasher. I had to purchase an extension for the waste hose because it didn't reach to my sink drain pipe.

title: Broke after 25 Months.
txt: I purchased this dishwasher only to have it completely stop working just over a year afterwards. No light, no power, no remedy other than an expensive service call. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Excellent Diswasher
txt: The diswasher that came with our house broke in its second year of use. We replaced it with the same model mainly because of price and it matched our other appliances. Well after two years, the replacement broke as well. I was determined to buy a reliable dishwasher. I did a lot of research and settled on the Bosch SHEM63@55N because it was the perfect combination of reliablility, performance, and price. It was more expensive than our previous brand, but the extra money has been well worth it. It does a great job of washing and drying the dishes as well as being extremely quite, especially compared to our last dishwasher that sounded like a jet flying throug the kitchen. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Super quiet!
txt:
This dishwasher holds a day's worth of dirty dishes and cleans them very well without prerinsing. The only sound I hear from it is the water filling it and the water draining from it. Amazing!
The third rack on top assures that forks, spoons, etc. are thuroughly cleaned. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Bosch 300 Series Dishwasher Review
txt: Great product.   We are very happy with this dishwasher really cleans my dishware especially cleans the bottom of the coffee cups so there is no film. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Additional accessories required for purchase were not listed on the product page; showed up durin...
txt:
Additional accessories required for purchase were not listed on the product page; showed up during the check-out process. Descriptions were confusing or mis-matched: the cord kit shown as required and extra ended up being included, so I ended up with two; had difficulties returning one. The water fitting elbow I thought I ordered was not delivered (maybe the second cord kit), and I had to go to the local Home Depot store to purchase one.
Delivery and customer service personnel were very helpful in correcting the botched up details of the order process.
Apparently all Bosch dishwashers are designed and built with no heated dryer for the end of the cycle. This was NOT mentioned in any on-line descriptions. There were all manners of claims about features that improved drying, including the possibility of increased power consumption, but no clear mention of the lack of an actual dryer. It cleans dishes well, but plastic items come out wet. Understand this before ordering! bad assumption on my part, as I've never seen any d/w with no heated dryer...

title: Did research on several brands of dishwashers and found that the Bosch 300 series would be the be...
txt:
Did research on several brands of dishwashers and found that the Bosch 300 series would be the best for our price range.
Very quite and easy to install. After several uses finally figured out how to get the dishes dry. There is no heat element in the unit to help dry the dishes.

title: Quiet cleaner
txt: The dishwasher works very well.  Holds alot of dishes.  It's very quiet. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Who Knew?
txt: The Bosch diswahers were recommended by my appliance repair person.  He could not save my old one which was doing a great job (I thought).  With the same detergent and rinse aid, this dishwasher actually made may dishes and flatware shine.  I was just expecting clean but got a whole lot more.  Going into the flatware drawer almost requires sunglasses!  With the top level drawer for "funky" stuff, I am hand washing fewer and fewer items. One of the best features is that it is sooooooo quiet!  Gotta love that. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Great Dishwasher
txt: Cleans great, really really quiet, lots of room - wonderful design. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: We've had this dishwasher about 2-3 weeks now. The stainless front is beautiful and the controls ...
txt: We've had this dishwasher about 2-3 weeks now. The stainless front is beautiful and the controls very easy to use. It's incredibly quiet!! We installed ourselves and the instructions were very clear and it wasn't hard. I'd say most people can save the $100+ for install. We like all the wash options. We usually use the 60-minute speed wash to save energy and it gets dishes clean, even pots that don't have food caked on. I like the adjustable upper rack, but the top (3rd) rack isn't very useful. It doesn't always get silverware clean, even on the longer cycle - I think the spray doesn't get up there very effectively. We do use it for large cooking utensils and plasticware lids. Mostly we use the basket for silverware, it holds a lot of silverware. As others said, there is a slight odor after washing but it seems to be fading. Also, plastics stay wet, although we haven't used the high-heat setting, as we want to save energy. We either let the washer sit open to air dry or put the plastics in the rack in the sink to dry. Our main problem in all this was in making the order on the Home Depot website. It seemed buggy, and it never gave me a way to say we wanted the washer installed. It also gave two choices of equipment you might need for the install, but didn't provide the information to help you know which you needed. I tried calling the customer service number and it kept hanging up on me, both before and after someone picked up. I tried the chat function and the guy couldn't see that there was no installation option. The delivery guy said another customer had complained about this. I spent WAY too long making this order. But the washer is incredibly quiet!

title: It's amazingly quiet!  I love the third rack for utensils and silverware.  We were using a portab...
txt: It's amazingly quiet!  I love the third rack for utensils and silverware.  We were using a portable dishwasher and it didn't have much room for bigger pots and pans,  this dishwasher has loads of room for even the biggest pots.

title: Great dish washer!!! Love Bosch...
txt: Great dish washer!!! Love Bosch

title: Bosch 300 Series Dishwasher
txt: Smart design with ease of use. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Flawless and Noiseless
txt: So glad we chose to go with Bosch after suffering for years with another manufacturer’s one that was useless. This one does even the toughest jobs with ease and we can barely hear it running! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: We are pleased!
txt: When researching our options for a new dishwasher we received mutiple recommendations from trusted friends about the quality delivered by Bosch products. We knew that we would pay more than bargain brand products. We know we made the correct choice in purchasing our new dishwasher. It works well and we marvel at how quiet it performs its cycles. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: So Far So Good
txt: So far we are very happy with our new Bosch dishwasher. It is extremely quiet in operation. We especially like the separate pull out section for silverware and the warning that you are out of rinse aid. We have the stainless model and find it easy to clean. Overall we are very happy with it. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Only had it a few days but so far it’s...
txt: Only had it a few days but so far it’s quiet and seems to clean the dishes.  The installation was challenging and they almost gave up. There is a strong chemical smell inside after the cycle runs.

title: This washer is so quiet you don't know it is...
txt: This washer is so quiet you don't know it is on. So I would give it Excellent on that. The only thing I don't like is that the machine and any plastic stays very wet even on the extra dry cycle and there is a smell.BOSCH needs to work on this. I hear from owners of other stainless inside washers that their machine is dry and there is some water left on plastic. This machine leaves it too wet.

title: I LOVE this dishwasher. It is VERY quiet and has...
txt: I LOVE this dishwasher. It is VERY quiet and has plenty of room.

title: This dishwasher is designed to hold dishes for 14 place settings and is intelligently arranged to...
txt: This dishwasher is designed to hold dishes for 14 place settings and is intelligently arranged to do so. It's unbelievably quiet and gets the dishes very clean, especially glasses. I like the fact that the upper rack is height adjustable and that the third rack on top is available to place utensils. I bought this dishwasher for our second house where our son lives 3 months ago and liked it so much that I bought another one for our main house a month ago. I haven't figured out yet exactly where to place large cookie sheets, but I seldom use them so I put them upside down flat on the upper third rack and they were cleaned perfectly.

title: I am amazed how quiet this is! I had to put my ear to it the first time I used it to make sure it...
txt: I am amazed how quiet this is! I had to put my ear to it the first time I used it to make sure it was on. Does a great job in getting my dishes clean. Worth every penny.

title: Vague instructions for electrical component ...
txt: Vague instructions for electrical component

title: Very quiet!  Home Depot installation department refused to install,...
txt: Very quiet!  Home Depot installation department refused to install, claiming it needed a special adaptor.  Had to install myself, wasn't hard, and didn't need adaptor.

title: Not that easy to assemble - adaptor kit required, but...
txt: Not that easy to assemble - adaptor kit required, but the end result was great.

title: Best Dishwasher
txt: This dishwasher is so quiet, it’s amazing. My dishes, pots and pans come out so clean and dry. The adjustable racks are a joy. I like the front panel and the different cleaning programs available. I have and will always only buy Bosch appliances. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Awesome dishwasher
txt: When we moved, we left our Bosch dishwasher behind.  Our new house had an old and loud Whirlpool that didn’t even get our dishes clean.  After a year of having a sub-standard dishwasher, I’m now the happy owner of a Bosch again.  It’s quiet and it always gets my dishes clean.  I like the third rack for utensils and lids, the sanitize setting, and the extra dry feature.  In my opinion, it’s the best dishwasher and I won’t own anything else.

title: I love, love, love, my new Bosch dishwasher!
txt: I've had a KitchenAid dishwasher for many years and they are great. The one I just replaced was 30 years old and still running but some break down of the upper rack.  I found out the Bosch was a top brand and reviews were great so I went for it.  I couldn't believe that a dishwasher could be so quiet with water spraying around inside.  I also love the size. It holds quite a bit more dishes than my old Kitchenaid.  Great if you have a big family but I'm by myself so I can go a couple days without running it... and maybe longer if I didn't run out of dishes!  I use the extra rack at the very top for my silverware and they come out shining.  The glasses are super clear and everything comes out shiny clean.  I used the rinse aid to begin with because there was a sample but it's all gone now and doesn't seem to make a difference.  You can't go wrong with a Bosch!

title: So quiet!!!
txt: Oh my gosh!  This dishwasher is so quiet!!!  I have to get down and put my ear to it to make sure it's running!  I researched several different dishwashers and this one scored very high with Consumer Reports.  I've had it about a month and just love it!  The third rack up on top is perfect for all those big spoons and spatulas, the adjustable tines allow for many different combinations, and everything comes out clean and dry!  I love it!

title: So quiet!!!
txt: Oh my gosh!  This dishwasher is so quiet!!!  I have to get down and put my ear to it to make sure it's running!  I researched several different dishwashers and this one scored very high with Consumer Reports.  I've had it about a month and just love it!  The third rack up on top is perfect for all those big spoons and spatulas, the adjustable tines allow for many different combinations, and everything comes out clean and dry!  I love it! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Best Quality Available
txt: This is our second Bosch dishwasher.  The only reason it's the second is because we had to move and leave the first behind in our previous home! We knew we would upgrade our builder-installed dishwasher in our new home the first chance we got. Looks great, runs great, cleans great.  Any time a contractor enters our home, they comment on what a great decision it was to get a Bosch, saying "that's the last one you'll ever buy!"

title: So far, so good...
txt:
My overall impression so far of this dishwasher is very favorable! It has done an excellent job of cleaning everything thrown at it. It is very quiet. My only concern is the use of seemingly flimsy plastics. On install, it was not possible to adjust the front height without distorting the plastic feet. Both the flip down stem ware holders and the silver ware baket make me worry about their life span. 
 Like I said, we'll see. Time will tell...

The 3rd drawer comes in handy when you have a large amount of silverware to clean. Does an excellent job of getting the dishes clean as well.

title: This dishwasher performs so much better than I expected.  Didn't think I would use the third shel...
txt:
This dishwasher performs so much better than I expected.  Didn't think I would use the third shelf very much because I thought there could not be much cleaning at that upper level - wrong I was - cleans great and I find it a nice convenience for stuff that does not fit well in the lower levels.  We pretty much run this on the quick wash (one hour) rather than the normal program, which can go two hours, since everything always comes out clean.  (With our old dishwasher, we always ran it at the longest pots & pans setting.)  It does get very very hot inside the unit, so we quickly understood the importance of the manufacturer's instructions not to put any plastics in the lowest level.  
Yeah, this was marginally more expensive than some other models, but it is worth it.  
I hope it stays as reliable as its initial performance.

Only minor negative note is  the installation instructions for the side bracket connections to the wood cabinet.  The graphic is impossible to comprehend and I had to go to youtube to finally get it figured out.  Not a big deal, just a bit of extra time to install.

title: Great dishwasher! Super quiet, cleans really well, and the racks are very efficient. Yes my dishe...
txt:
Great dishwasher! Super quiet, cleans really well, and the racks are very efficient. Yes my dishes come out dry every time. I love the fully stainless interior  

There are quieter models but I can not hear this one in the next room. Two things I love a little less: First, the buttons are actual buttons not smooth panel buttons, seemed kinda old school to me. Second, if you set the delay start timer, and some one opens it to add another dish, you have to hit start again to get the timed delay going again otherwise it just won't run. 

DIY'ers: You'll need a 3/4" x 3/8" dishwasher elbow to connect your water supply. And the electrical is a bit trickier than most dishwashers. I actually like the design better but it's a different way to wire up an appliance than normal in the U.S.

I highly recommend this dishwasher.

title: First, the installation went very smoothly.  Delivery people showed up on time, cleaned up after ...
txt:
First, the installation went very smoothly.  Delivery people showed up on time, cleaned up after themselves, were quite respectful and cordial through the whole process.  Very professional.
I'm delighted with the Bosch dishwasher!  Dishes come out very clean, which I would expect.  The noise level when washing is extremely quiet, not expecting quite as quiet as it is.  That's great!  I can get many more dishes in than my old machine which is wonderful as well.  I really like the 3rd drawer for washing flat items.  I put all my knives there so that the silverware basket will work longer.  The only slightly negative thing is that some of the dishes don't dry as much as I like.  I suspect there is a setting that I haven't figured out yet that will fix this though.
All in all, I'm very pleased with this purchase.

txt: It cleans very well, but it does not dry plastic well at all. Tupperware and kids' cups/bottles all end up very wet when coming out of this dishwasher, even when set on Extra Dry and when using rinse aid. I would return this dishwasher if I could and get one that does a better job of drying plastics.

title: Love this dishwasher
txt: We did not notice how bad our old dishwasher was until we got this one. Our dishes shine like never before. We love the top rack and put our silverware there and they get so clean. Also so very quiet.

title: Improvements are needed
txt:
Kept noticing the water left on the bottom of the cups was foggy and had dirt specs in the water after the dishwasher cleaned them. Solution - had to run very lightly solied loads on the heavy load cycle to help this problem. The normal or automatic modes appear to be too much of an energy saver - not using enough water to throughly rinse. Upper flat tray appears to be blocking the next tray down from getting rinsed with plenty of water from above. You can't angle some bowls in the bottom tray even with using the adjustable pegs. You have to crack the door open after clean in order to dry off the dishes. Otherwise, water remains that didn't evaporate if you wait until machine cools down.
Very quiet while running. However, would rather hear all kinds of water spraying noise so you know the dishes are being throughly washed / rinsed. Seems the wash arms do not spin really fast. Plumber checked water pressure and it's set above the dishwasher's min. pressure requirement.

title: Bosch SHEM63W55N Dishwasher. Excellent appliance. Quiet. Cleans well with little water and long s...
txt:
Bosch SHEM63W55N Dishwasher. Excellent appliance. Quiet. Cleans well with little water and long spray arms, but a long cycle time. Third rack fits shallow and long items. Racks are well designed for plates and other items. I use tall drink containers which do fit on the lower rack. Door closing mechanism is too strong, it needs loosening to allow the door to be open at more positions for drying after cycle.
I like more detailed information on Normal wash cycle times (wash, rinse, dry) because I use a circulating pump to pump hot water from the water heater through the pipes while running dishwasher. This info would help me to turn pump on/off when needed.

title: The GoodEasy to install, came with install kit, but had...
txt: The GoodEasy to install, came with install kit, but had to purchase the supply hose separately.  Its attractiveControls are intuitive and easy to use.Looks robust, and middle rack adjustment gives you significantly more room for the lower rack.The not-so-goodLouder than I expected.  It doesn't dry plastics very well, but it is acceptable on the "extra dry" setting.  Make sure you use the liquid rinse.  Third rack is more gimmick than anything, but there are a couple of things you can use it for.  The stemware support rack is kind of annoying to use, doesn't work with three different types of generic wine glasses very well, tends to kick back into the "up" position rather than lock down into the support position.

With sanitize heat on for a 20 mins the plastics are wet! 3.5 stars.

This is my second Bosch brand dishwasher, and I will never buy another brand!   They are more expensive than the other brands, but so worth it!!!   I have the "3rd" rack on this one (for utensils) and I love it! It gives me so much more room  for other things!

title: 4.5 out of 5- Almost perfection with a few flaws
txt:
This dishwasher is great in SO many ways. It's whisper quiet, you don't even realize it's on for 3/4 of the cycle and the rest of the cycle sounds like a fireplace roaring quietly. The dishes turn out sparkling clean, and it looks very nice in my kitchen. I LOVE the little 3rd rack for big utensils and flat items because it frees up a ton of space for other things on the main racks. I also really utilize the way that the bottom rack is laid out. It holds about 1.5 times the amount of plates/bowls my old dishwasher did.

My 2 complaints:

1. It had an awful rotten food smell the first few weeks whenever we opened it. I don't know if old water was stuck in the pipes or the seal was too perfect? it has dissipated some but for a while it was so bad we had to plug our noses while emptying.

2. There is no designated place for the dry finishing powder part of the soap. After reading online we see that they say to sprinkle 1-2tsp on the floor of the dishwasher but I feel like it isn't doing it's job that way. It would be nice if there were a little pocket.

Definitely would  (and I did) recommend to other people. This is a top notch machine. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Excellent product

title: I have had this dishwasher for about 7 months now. It has given an error code (E:22) about every ...
txt: I have had this dishwasher for about 7 months now. It has given an error code (E:22) about every 3rd run. This is because it would not completely drain. I would check for any obstructions and clean the drain area, but never found a reason why this wouldn't work. Now there is a new error message with every run (E:9). This means that the water heater for the dishwasher is now broken. The dishwasher is quiet as advertised, but outside of that characteristic it does not seem to be a good piece of equipment. I bought Bosch because I believed it to be a good brand. This turned out to be a very disappointing purchase.

title: Great washer, a little pricey
txt: I did a lot of research before deciding on this particular washer. Although the reviews were glowing, there were many people complaing about the dishes not coming out dry. Although that did concern me, the manufactures response put me at a cautious ease. I had it installed by the delivery techs and they did a good job. After the first wash it was clear that when the manufacturers instructions are followed, the dishes will come out bone dry. There was a bit of condenstation on the inside surface of the door, but that minimized after a few washes. The top utensil tray could be better designed. It holds the thin utensils solidly in place but not the larger handles. luckily the bottom utensil basket works great without severely limiting capacity. The only build issue I have is the door is not rigid on the hinges. It can be twisted slightly in opposite direction from the top corners. The machine is whisper silent, the only sound i hear in the water running through the pipes at the begining. All in all im very happy with the purchase and would highly recommend it.

title: HORRIBLE HORRIBLE HORRIBLE Dishwasher!!! We recently made 2 very grave errors in judgement. First...
txt: HORRIBLE HORRIBLE HORRIBLE Dishwasher!!! We recently made 2 very grave errors in judgement. First, we made the mistake of buying this dishwasher from Home Depot. Unlike others, Home Depot does NOT give you any time at all to try an appliance to make sure it works the way it’s supposed to!  You can find ones with a 14 or 30 day “no questions asked” return policy, but not Home Depot.  Apparently with Home Depot, once it’s delivered it’s yours. That was mistake number 1. Mistake number 2 was buying this Bosch Series 300 dishwasher. We just bought a home and needed to replace some of the kitchen appliances, including the dishwasher. I read a lot of reviews from many different sources, and while almost every dishwasher has both pluses and minuses, this Bosch seemed to get good reviews. I think all the reviews must have been written by Bosch employees since most people seemed to like the way it cleaned as well as how dry the dishes were after the cycle was done . . . something that seems to be a big problem with today’s “modern” appliances. The dishwasher cleans just fine. And while I’m not that crazy about the way the racks are angled and placed, that’s not the biggest problem. The biggest problem that is my main reason for giving it such a horrible review, is that at the end of the cycle, everything inside – including the inside of the door and the walls – is just as wet as if I had stopped the dishwasher in the middle of the cycle! It doesn’t dry AT ALL!!! I have been married for over 40 years and have always owned a dishwasher. I have NEVER had such a problem with things being dry at the end as I’ve had with this unit, and I put the same mix of items into the dishwasher that I have always used one for, pots, pans, lids, Tupperware/Rubbermaid containers and lids, glassware, silverware and of course, dishes. Up until we bought this Bosch, we might have a tiny bit of water left inside the edge of a Tupperware lid, but certainly not everything absolutely dripping both inside and out! We have tried everything. First, since we have never needed to use any kind of rinse aid, we tried the dishwasher without it. We tried the “Normal” cycle, we tried the “Auto” cycle, we tried “Extra Dry” (that one’s a laugh – slightly less wet might be more like it . . . ), and we’ve tried “Sanitize”. We’ve tried everything and every possible combination, even breaking down and trying all the same options with the rinse aid. NOTHING WORKS! After trying various cycles for about a week, I called Home Depot only to be told “It’s yours . . . there’s nothing we can do for you now”, and that I should have called within 48 hours. No one ever mentioned that to us when we bought it, no one ever gave us the phone number to call at Bosch if we had a problem, nor did we get any information at all about the extended 5 year warranty we had purchased on the unit. No brochure, no paperwork, nothing. I certainly never heard about any 48 hour limit, and I was trying to give every option a chance to see if we could come up with something that would help. The manager gave me the number for Bosch so I called them. They arranged for an authorized repair dealer in our area to come out who told me this is “normal” for these new airtight, energy efficient machines and that I shouldn’t be putting any plastic into it. First of all, if the unit is so airtight that no steam or condensation can escape, why isn’t there some kind of vent or something that opens at the end of the cycle so that it CAN escape??? Duh – that would be a no-brainer. Oh, wait, the whole unit is a NO BRAINER! PureDry? That’s a laugh . . . and a very expensive one at that. Also, since I’ve been cleaning our Tupperware/Rubbermaid containers in the dishwasher for the past 40+ years, why should I have to stop now? What good is a dishwasher that doesn’t wash and dry the dishes you use? The last home we were in before our move had a new, bottom of the line Frigidaire unit in it, and that one came out almost completely dry - plastic containers and all! This Bosch cost twice as much and doesn’t dry a darn thing. The only way we can even get it somewhat dry is to time the cycle so that it ends when I get up in the morning so I can make sure I can open the door partway within 5 minutes of it ending to let the steam and condensation out. And I have to set a separate timer for when it’s going to end as it’s so quiet it’s very easy to forget about. What a pain!!!! I would highly recommend you buy a different machine if you want something decent.  I would like this one to be replaced with a different brand or my money back. It just doesn’t do what it’s supposed to do!!!

title: This dishwasher is so quiet you have to open it to hears it!  Could not be happier with this prod...

We literally have to look for the lighted timer to verify that the dishwasher is still working.  In summary, we are thoroughly delighted with our purchase of our new Bosch 300 dishwasher! title: Quality Product
txt: We have had our Bosch dishwasher since April.  The pros: (1) easy to load with extra spaces; (2) quiet.  Sometimes you wonder if it running; (3) everything you put in comes out clean and sparkling; (4) tremendous capacity.  Cons.  None.  This is the best dishwasher we have ever owned. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Beat dishwasher ever!
txt:
This is my second Bosch dishwasher and it’s only because we updated our kitchen appliances to stainless steel. 
With this change we upgraded from the previous Bosch dishwasher. Having a tray for the silverware makes it so much easier to unload!
Talk about quiet!  I have to bend down to listen to make sure it’s running!  
Love the no heating element approach... all the dishes come out dry. 
And best of all the system does a super job cleaning! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Expected More
txt: I thought I would have liked everything about the name Bosch, but I’m sorry to say this dishwasher disappointed me.  It doesn’t do a very good job of drying no matter what buttons are pushed.  It also has had an unpleasant odor since day one.  And to top it off it is a challenge to load normal glass tumblers so they are not standing strait up.  I’m used to having them on an angle for the water to run off. And you cannot just load without some form of rinsing unless you don’t care how clean your dishes will be. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Nice Washer
txt: Replaced a 15 year old Bosch with this stainless version. Installation: Connections are in the back as opposed to the front with the old unit. Also comes with a junction box that will not fit in the dishwasher space. Not sure what use the junction box serves. Just adds to the complexity of the install. Not a difficult install, just took more time and effort. Operation: Little noise as most have stated. Programming took several attempts but I'm not computer savy. Haven't yet figured out best way to load. I don't use the top rack for silverware. Spatulas, tongs, large utensils maybe. Many complaints about smell, lack of adequite drying. I have no issues. There was a "factory" smell that is gone. Dishes are clean and dry. I have progamed sanitize and extra dry options and use a rinse aid. Overall I'm satisfied. I hope it lasts. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: After only 4 weeks of use I cannot attest to the durability of the unit. Unit Is very very quiet...
txt: After only 4 weeks of use I cannot attest to the durability of the unit. Unit Is very very quiet. I have not noticed any left over residue after washing. The dishes, glassware, and cutlery come out very clean. The nearly hidden at the top of unit- third rack for long untensils is great! Unfortunately, no heated dry so dishes are partially wet/wet when cycle is complete. Does require rinse aid solution to be refilled every few weeks in addition to the usual per load detergent pod. The 2 main racks have angled tines so it takes some trial and error to figure out best loading configuration. The 2 main racks have some handy adjustable features to hold items. The cutlery basket is easy to access and remove. I give the unit a 4/5 star rating. I would recommend this dishwasher.

title: We have had a Bosch dishwasher for about 5 years and it has never dried the dishes at all as far...

title: Cleans great and is unbelievably quiet!...

title: Awesome Dishwasher!
txt: This is hands down the best dishwasher we have ever owned, and unfortunately we've had quite a few non-Bosch ones. We've had this Bosch dishwasher for a couple of months, and every time we've used it (which averages about twice a day), all the dishes and utensils come out spotless. We've had a few dishwashers that did a nice job initially, but they were nothing like this Bosch. My only regret is that we didn't buy this dishwasher years ago (assuming it was even available then). This is also the first dishwasher we've owned where we trust and only use the auto cycle. It takes about 2 hours to run on the auto cycle, but it still appears to use little energy (at least based on our electricity and water bills). And the dishes come out smelling nicely as well, as you can tell by the steam released when opening the door that this dishwasher sanitizes very well. This dishwasher is amazing. We highly recommend this dishwasher. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Extremely disappointed. We paid so much for this dishwasher and...
txt: Extremely disappointed. We paid so much for this dishwasher and it does a very poor job of cleaning our dishes. Half of them still come out dirty. We follow the guidelines exactly as recommended, use their special detergent, and even had a Bosch service person out to look at it. Still much worse than our old GE dishwasher. And because we bought it online Home Depot won't let us return it. Serious buyer's remorse. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone.

title: Extremely quiet, attractive, good cleaning
txt: Like the Bosch dishwasher.  A couple of improvements would make it much better.  Pull out drawer for us is not useful.  One forgets you have anything in there, and items don't dry too well on that rack.  There is moisture on the door most times after the cycle is over.  Not sure why this is so.  Dishwasher performs better with Cascade liquid then Finish pellets or gelcaps.  The gelcaps did not remove tea stains from the tea cups, but Cascade did. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Bosch is the BEST
txt: Never had I realized there was such a marvelous dishwasher being sold. This dishwasher is the quietest ever! It loads so nicely. The racks tilt to accommodate large items. It’s great for my large baking dish and other pots and pans. The top rack lines up silverware so you don’t have to sort them when putting the away. All my dishes are sparkling clean when it’s finished. No water drops and everything’s dry ready to put away. It’s a little pricey but you get what you pay for. It’s a great machine and I’m sure it’s going service my family for years to come. Love it. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Dishwasher is very quiet and has had no problem handling...
txt: Dishwasher is very quiet and has had no problem handling everything from standard dinner plates to greasy pots and pans. I was torn between this and a less expensive Bosch model without the 3rd rack. Glad I opted for this model - the 3rd rack is perfect for silverware and odd utensils. It is also great for smaller items or lids that won't stay secure in the standard racks.

title: New Toy
txt: I've never been one to use a dishwasher but we really needed a new one even though it was hardly ever used in 20+ years. I read a lot of good reviews about BOSCH so it was a no brainer that I was going with it. Since getting it I have used it more times than I ever did the old one. It is so darn quiet you don't even know its on. If it weren't for the red lights on I'd never know. I haven't been pre-washing the dishes either at their recommendation & they come out squeaky clean. I am now learning to love using this dishwasher!!! The hardest thing for me is knowing how to load it! Hahahaha [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Great Dishwasher
txt: We have had our new Bosch for about a month now and I am so happy with it.  It cleans better than my old one ever did.  Dishes nearly always come out perfectly clean.  There is a bit of an odd smell at the end when I first open the door after washing - not sure what that is - but I will take that for the clean. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: satisfied
txt: I am happy wwithe the purchase of the Bosch 300 series dishwasher. It was easy to install, but I had to purchace an adaptor for the discharge hose because the hose was1/2 inch and my garbage disposal had a 3/4 inch pipe. The dishes get very clean but they do require a short period of air time to finish drying after the cycle is over. I open the door for 15 Minuits to do this. A minor inconvience compared to the old dishwasher that I replaced.I like the countdown clock that tells me how much time isleft in the wash cycle. the main reason for buying this dishwasher was the leak bucket on the bottom that will allert when there is a leak and shut down the dishwasher. My old dishwasher had a leak and mold devdloped under it before I was aware of it causing me to have to do a mold removal and a floor replacement. The hazard warnings that came with the instructions caused a lot of worry for my daughter. They need to be better written. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: its ok

The buttons dont feel very sturdy so i hope it works for a ling time  Lastly, the install went terribly with the installer causing a leak. HD refunded me but still a pain.

title: I love it.  We've used it about a month now.  I see no issues with drying as some have commented....

The tall tub takes a little getting used to in terms of layout and it might be harder to jamb as much into the two main racks as the old Kitchen Aid it replaced.  But it's more than made up for by taking out the silverware tray and using the 3rd rack.

title: So far, we really like it.  Lots of space...
txt: So far, we really like it.  Lots of space and great set up with the 3 shelves.  I wish the buttons were hidden, because I can see my kid hitting them once she gets a little taller.  The other quirky thing is that when it is done running, the panel still stays lit up, until you completely turn it off.  I do wish it was like other dishwashers and just one light would stay lit to tell you it was clean.  Otherwise, we like it and so far, it's done a great job.

title: Found: The Perfect Dishwasher!
txt: After three months, I couldn’t be happier with my new dishwasher. The outside is sleek and elegant, and the stainless steel interior is clean and easy to see.  I love the simplicity of the display in full view, with clear lighted choices; plus, the machine is both easy to start and instantly stopped if necessary. Instructions are explicit, with lots of smart tips and suggestions. The rinse aid, a new feature for me, is a definite bonus – every glass comes out squeaky dry. There’s a wealth of choices, whether it’s just us or an extended-family dinner, with several wash cycles and flexibility in loading, like flip tines, an adjustable upper rack and special supports for stemware. I appreciate the fact that a single feature adapts to more than one purpose – for instance, the 3rd rack is great for long or wide utensils, and can also be removed for extra space to accomodate tall items. And finally, the SILENCE is sweet – never dreamed a dishwasher could be so quiet! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Bought this dishwasher for three reasons...good projected reliability, long lasting, quiet. It c...
txt: Bought this dishwasher for three reasons...good projected reliability, long lasting, quiet. It certainly is very quiet (without the red light you could easily think it was off during some parts of the cycle. Capacity is very large. The stainless interior ought to be long lasting. Curious to see how energy savings and reliability play out

title: Excellent Dishwasher
txt: We have had this 300 series dishwasher for over a month and everyone is very pleased with it. We wanted one with front controls and this one with a recessed handle is perfect. Although we are still getting used to new configurations for our dishes and glassware, they come out clean and very shiny. It is quality made - especially the heavy, sturdy door. Because we slightly rinse our dishes first, we are able to use the Speed60 cycle and it works fine. We are still unsure how to fit bigger bowls into the racks, but we keep experimenting. We will try putting all silverware in the narrow top rack instead of the silverware holder, which will free up space. There isn't as much room for glasses as our previous dishwasher, but again, we have to be creative and try things. We are impressed with its quality, quietness, and options. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: I've used the Bosch 300 dishwasher not quit a month. WOW.. Just WOW!  Cleaned an unrinsed crockpo...
txt: I've used the Bosch 300 dishwasher not quit a month. WOW.. Just WOW!  Cleaned an unrinsed crockpot first wash. Only 2 of us so went 3 days before full enough to run & everything cleaned. NO pre-rinsing.  I had no idea how fast I'd become attached to the 3ed rack.(didn't think I really needed it...) 3ed rack takes alittle more time to organize, but putting silverware away really fast if you sort it when loading.My corelle dishes fit other racks very nicely. Very quiet so it can run  anytime I appreciate the time readout showing when cycle will be done..  Installation was alittle involved, but hubby felt good when done because it was done the way he felt was better than the way our set-up was previously. I. I hope it lives up to Bosch's low repair reputation.

Air dry only - does not heat air for drying.TBD: 3rd "rack" not yet used.

txt: The dishwasher looks great and is very quiet. The only negative for me is: it extends farther out by about 1.5 inch from my counter. Other than that I am quite pleased.

title: Bosch Dishwasher 300 series
txt: We have used the dishwasher about one month. It has met our expectations. We like the silverware tray and how quiet it is. It is easier to clean and to be able to get at the filter when the time comes. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Completely Satisfied
txt:
After looking at many reviews, my wife and I decided on this brand and this model to replace our short-lived GE brand.  It has a large 
capacity, so much so that we nearly run out of dishes and cookware before it is filled. We particularly like the top (third) rack that holds knives, measuring spoons, lids, and other small items.  Most importantly, the dishes come out sparkling clean!  To be sure they come out clean, we follow all of the directions removing chunks and using the rinse aid. Also, we regularly clean the screen. Be prepared for this dishwasher to take about two hours to cycle through the wash.  We highly recommend this dishwasher. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: This Bosch 300 Series has a ton of space. It...
txt: This Bosch 300 Series has a ton of space. It does a great job cleaning, and is no louder than a cat purring. The reason for 4 of 5 stars is that for the price, it ought to do a better job drying. I'd still recommend it.

title: BOSCH 24" Recessed Handle 300 series
txt: This machine produces consistently clean and dry dishes. It is quiet. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Unbelievably quite
txt: Love it. Unbelievably quite [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Great Washer
txt: This washere has been a great upgrade from the "builder special" that came with our home. It's so quiet and efficient. The rack design is top notch. I kind of wish the buttons were solid state so that they were easier to clean, but other than that, this is a 10/10. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: It works great, cleans the dishes as advertised...

title: Child Lock is misleading!!
txt: I chose a Bosch because it had better reviews than other brands. However; I'm very disappointed in the SHE863WF2N . The child lock only works if the dishwasher us running!! What toddler waits until it us running to punch buttons? My little one punched enough buttons enough times that it messed with the memory. So a technician came, checked it out and determined it needed a new computer board. Certainly glad we bought a 3 yr warranty. Now I have duck tape and cardboard over the controls so he cant get to the buttins.

title: I LOVE THIS DISHWASHER!
txt: This is the best dishwasher I’ve ever owned by far (and it’s my fifth)! Dishes come out spotless! It’s quiet. It has a rinse cycle and quick cycle and third drawer. It has a count down timer and cleans perfectly on auto cycle. I like the recessed buttons so no one can accidentally bump them and stop or start the cycle. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Far and Away the Best Dishwasher I've Owned
txt:
Got this to replace an older Bosch, which was a great machine in and of itself; this 300 Series unit is easily the best dishwasher I've ever owned or used.  Not dead silent like the more expensive machines but still barely audible; excellent selection of cycles and options; so much room for dishes and silverware; flexible loading options; and does an outstanding job cleaning the dishes!
Installation was pretty simple even when replacing a 12 year old Bosch - but make sure you buy a new hot water hose and adapter.
My favorite feature is the third row silverware rack - saves even more space and makes unloading incredibly quick - just group each size of utensil together and then scoop them out in a batch.
Overall just an excellent purchase - and so much room we've probably cut back our number of times running it per week by a third. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Love it!
txt: I am so happy with this dishwasher. Dishes are spotless and the dishwasher is very quiet. Drying is good and if I have any complaints it would be it is a little small.  Certainly would recommend it [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Had this dishwasher for 7 months. Got an error code E24. Went on you tube to see what it meant. T...
txt: Had this dishwasher for 7 months. Got an error code E24. Went on you tube to see what it meant. This information was not in their instruction manual. Found out that younger to disconnect then hoses and pressure then out plus clean the filters. I am 62 years old and have no means to do this so I will have to call someone. I understand this happens every few months. Really Bosch!!!! I had a dishwasher for 14 years and this never happened. I would not recommend. Check out the you tube before you buy to see you want to do this all the time. Also I don’t like that when the dishwasher goes off there is no light to tell you it is done. When you open it then you remember that you ran it and see the dishes are clean. I would never recommend this now I will have to clean my dishes before they go in and have an ongoing cost of $200 to get some to come to clean the hoses everytime I get an error code.

I arranged for delivery, haul away, installation and all necessary parts over the phone.  It was delivered and installed exactly as scheduled and installed in the presence of my friends who were using my Condo for a couple of months.  They repoarted a quick install, hookup and test run for the dishwasher.  Once again, I am pleased with Home Depot and their attention to customers' needs.

My wife continually worries that the dishwasher isn’t working because it makes virtually no noise. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: new

title: Excellent product
txt: This product works very well for us. Dishes and utinsels are clean and come out nearly dry. The machine is very quiet. We have had a similar Bosch in another house for 5 years. It has been very reliable with excellent performance. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Amazing Dishwasher
txt: We have been using our  new dishwasher for over a month. This machine is so quite you hardely know it is running. Cleans everything without prerinsing. It even cleaned wire rack that had been used to cook bacon in oven. I am 77 years old and have used and owned many dishwashers but this Bosch is the best I have ever seen. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Whisper Quiet
txt: Love my new Bosch. Not only can I have a normal conversation in the kitchen but even my wine glasses come out spot free. I have followed the suggestion to empty the appliance from the bottom first. It makes a difference so that any remaining water on the upper racks does not fall on lower rack. The utensil rack is one of the dishwasher’s best features. I have been using the Extra Dry feature all the time. Another cycle that is super helpful is the 9 minute rinse. Never have to leave a partial load of dirty dishes all day. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Bought this without clearly understanding what condensation drying meant. What it means is that i...
txt: Bought this without clearly understanding what condensation drying meant. What it means is that it doesn't dry. Plan on having everything in the machine sopping wet when you open it. Every time. Takes three hours if you tell it to sanitize and do extra drying, and it still doesn't dry. I tried to get the company to buy it back and was told they wouldn't even consider it unless it was non-functional. That point could be debated as I think it's non-functional now, but as always, the big company makes the rules and us lowly customers get stuck with them. Won't be buying from Bosch again and will be listing this for sale on Craigslist.

title: Love My Dishwasher!
txt: What an incredible dishwasher. Probably the quietest I have ever heard. Cleans great. Love the 3rd level for additional small items. Can’t say enough good things about this product. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: My husband was pleased with the easyInstallment...

title: Bosch "The Quiet Dishwasher"
txt: I owned a Bosch before that I purchased in 2007.  When that dishwasher died, I didn't hesitate to order a new Bosch.  In 12 years, Bosch has definitely improved their dishwashers.  I like the three shelves.  Shelf number two being adjustable for those "tall" items.  I have a special place now for easy to lose items that kept falling to the bottom in my old dishwasher.  It is great for plastic lids that were not fitting before and couldn't be put on lower rack or they warped.  The best part of my new dishwasher is so so quiet.  I have to look at the countdown to make sure it is actually running.  I had bad luck with other name brand dishwashers.  Bosch is an excellent dishwasher! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Silent Machine
txt: This dishwasher is roomy for everything I need to wash and cleans to perfection.  Very quiet compared to others I have heard.  The only time you know it's on is when the water empties out into the drain.  All other operations are silent!  Love it! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Our second Bosch dishwasher. The first one was great. This...
txt: Our second Bosch dishwasher. The first one was great. This one even better. Quiet, loads of room, cleans and dries extremely well.

title: Love this dishwasher! Super quiet and easy to use. ...
txt: Love this dishwasher! Super quiet and easy to use.

title: Just got it - this dishwasher is very quiet. It...
txt: Just got it - this dishwasher is very quiet. It does take a long time to go through the cycle and it leaves dishes a touch wet if you open it too quickly after the end of the cycle. So we run it overnight to accommodate that. Overall a pretty good dishwasher so far.

title: I haven't used the product much, yet.  It is super quiet and the installation  went easy for the ...
txt: I haven't used the product much, yet.  It is super quiet and the installation  went easy for the installers.  Be sure to ask for a manual, because I didn't get one and had to go back to Home Depot to get one.

title: A Little Noisier Than I'd Expected
txt: The flat bottom of the Bosch required a rerouting of the electrical connection; the previous dw had a hollow bottom so the wiring had come up through the center of the floor opening.  The noise is more apparent when the water is discharging into the pipes below the sink.  The ANGLE of the tines works well for dishes, not so well for cutting boards and trays and objects without a lip.  The third rack for silverware limited the height of objects put into the second rack, so we've removed it and adjusted the second rack for maximum height.  Abt promised a free cleaner for the stainless steel door, but it was not included.  Design of the rinse aid dispenser makes it difficult to load without spilling. I've heard modern dishwashers don't have the same reliability of old dishwashers; I'm hoping for the best.  Dishes have come out very clean so far. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: So far so good
txt: Bought this dishwasher about 5 weeks ago.  Mainly bought because Bosch is one of the more reliable brands.  We’ve been pleasantly surprised by how well this dishwasher cleans and dries.  There is no exposed heating element like older dishwashers; however dishes are usually dry.  Also, the unit is very quiet.  Very happy thus far and hope for years of trouble-free performance. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: I bought this dishwasher for the condensation drying system and the adjustable lower tines. After...
txt: I bought this dishwasher for the condensation drying system and the adjustable lower tines. After I ran the first load of dishes, the bottom of the dishwasher was standing in water. I tried again on a different cycle. The inside of the dishwasher drum was covered with condensation after the cycle was completed. I tried again on a different cycle and used the extended drying feature. It was no better. Also, when I pulled out the racks to empty the dishes, water from the runners poured all over my clean dishes and I had to them hand dry them. So, I read complaints about the drying system. The bottom line is, it doesn't work. The entire dishwasher stays dripping wet. I don't mean the dishes, I mean the unit itself. And, the high-tech solution is that you have to leave the dishwasher open to finish drying the unit out. And, you can't do it before 30 minutes after the cycle ends or over 2 hours later, and then you have to leave the unit open for 2 hours. REALLY!! I just don't have time to mess with that. Also, I live in a humid climate. I figure, after a while, something is going to mildew. Some have tried to say that more liquid drying agent was needed. I can assure you, that absolutely would not dry out this dishwasher. The bottom line is, condensation drying systems do not work. So, I sent this one back and got a dishwasher with a heated drying cycle, like they've always had. Going green is one thing, but my dishes turning green from mold and mildew is quite another. I do not recommend any dishwasher with a condensation drying system.

title: Relatively easy to install (it was a replacement). Installation instructions were lacking in a f...
txt: Relatively easy to install (it was a replacement). Installation instructions were lacking in a few areas. The dishwasher itself operated flawlessly once installed.

title: Great dishwasher

It is extremely quiet, is exceptionally adjustable fitting small items, large items and allowing me to wash plastics without warping them. txt: Read the manual carefully.  There are loads of options to customize the cleaning experience to your specific dishes.  After three weeks, I'm still experimenting.

title: Best Dishwasher We Ever Prchased
txt:
We purchased this dishwasher on December 20 of 2018. We have lived in our home for 35 years and owned 3 dishwashers; this one being number 3.
It is absolutely the best dishwasher we have ever owned. It cleans the best, uses less detergent and is QUIET. So quiet you could take a nap beside it while it is running. The only thing I think you could improve is the silverware basket. The slots are not all the same size and a lot of our utensils have thick handles and don’t fit. Thankfully there is that pull out rack at the top for large serving spoons etc. So we put the problem silverware up there. This is  minor issue but it would still be nice to see it addressed. We LOVE this machine! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Best Dishwasher
txt: Bought this dishwasher back and January and love it!!!! It’s quiet and my dishes come out so clean. I’ve had other brand name dishwashers and they don’t come close to the quality of Bosh. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Perfect
txt: We had a Bosch before this one that we used everyday and it lasted 10 years.  This one is even quieter than our previous one.  When we first used it, I had to check up close to see if it was running it is so quiet. Really like the top drawer for flat items. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Quiet Cleaner
txt: Amazing dishwasher. We couldn't even tell if it was running or not because it is so quiet! Dishes are still a bit wet coming out, but very clean. Love the silverware rack on top and lots of good space for dishes throughout. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: So far so good!  Delivery went well. Installation went...
txt: So far so good!  Delivery went well. Installation went well. First wash went well. Extremely quiet operation as one can barely tell it is washing.  Only did one load so far. Dishes got very clean. Let’s hope it is trouble free for a long time.

title: Amazing Machine....
txt: We’ve had this washer for ~3 years. It works flawlessly each time. We like it so much that we even took it with us to our new home. We took HD’s rep advice to lightly pre-rinse and simply use the quick 60 min. cycle - never an issue - and always brings a clean load. Installation is simple and quick. It’s a quality appliance that seems to have been designed well. Even looks great, front controls, quiet, stainless tub, etc... Hopefully it continues to perform for years to come. But after years of use, it appears it’s built to last.

title: You have shut off the energy saving features to get...

title: Best dishwasher during our 63 years fo marriage *
txt:
My wife and I (has I help more and more in the kitchen) believe this to be the best design, quite, and most featured dishwasher we have ever owned in our 63 years of marriage.  To be honest however, we had our first dishwasher (other than 2 kids) in 1965.  In the service we moved a lot and so have had quite a few different brands of dishwashers.
My son turned us on to the Bosch brand, as they have several of Bosch appliances.  What we like best about this dishwasher is the style, how quite it is, and it's features.  We particularly like the Delay, variety of loads supported, and the sanitize features. 
When we replace our other appliances we will definitely consider Bosch brand. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Best dishwasher I've ever owned
txt: Purchased this dishwasher about a month ago or so and it never ceases to amaze us how clean everything gets.  We really love using the top 3rd drawer for silverware and other small utensils. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

txt:
We purchased this dishwasher more than a month ago and we are very satisfied. It is easy to load and operate. It is also very quiet. It does an outstanding job cleaning all dishes and we really like the silverware tray! The sales group did a great job as did the installation crew.
 Outstanding! Thank you. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

txt: Excellent dishwasher. Quiet and cleans very well. Be wary of installation team. First team screwed up the install (both scratched the unit and wired incorrectly and claimed it was dead on arrival). Took 2-weeks and many phone calls to get straightened out.

title: This Bosch dishwasher is of excellent quality, way better than...

title: Does what it says it'll do and does it quietly!
txt: Had a BOSCH dishwasher previously and LOVED it. When the one we had at our new home died, we replaced it with another BOSCH. The review title says it all. This one does an even better job of cleaning than the previous one and is every bit as quiet. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Okay dishwasher
txt: Okay dishwasher however I use a lot of bowls and the racks are not well designed for washing lots of bowls [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Best dishwasher yet
txt: Replace a Whirlpool dishwasher that wasn't cleaning well. Bosch is quieter, cleans better, takes less time, and has more room inside. I like the fact that it uses hot water to dry. No heating element. A great product. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Great Dishwasher
txt: This Bosh replaced another brand. The old one could never compare with my new Bosh. I discovered the old one didn’t rinse well and left a film on my dishes & glassware. The only thing about the Bosh is that after the cycle has completed, I slightly open the door and place a small wooden wedge to keep it open so my dishes and glassware are all dry in the morning. I do love my Bosh! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: 5 Star Review

title: One week later — but too late to return, according to Home Depot ‘s too short 2-day return window...
txt: One week later — but too late to return, according to Home Depot ‘s too short 2-day return window — I have nothing but regrets.  Feels cheap, the door is extremely light and doesn’t stay open, the normal wash cycle is over two and a half hours long, and finally, the dishes and especially the silverware and anything on the top shelf come out dripping wet — and I mean wet, like you just hosed them down. I’m so disappointed in my first (and last!) Bosch dishwasher.

title: Amazing, Cleanest Dishes I've ever seen.
txt: I did quite a bit of on-line research before purchasing this exact unit, it had numerous high ratings and I can see why now having first hand experience with it in my own home.  The Bosch SHEM63W55N is very quiet, and cleans dishes like nothing we have ever had in our home before.  This is the 3rd dishwasher we have had in this home, this first two were other well known brands. The Bosch cleans better then any other.  Efficient, quite, asthetically appealing and well made of good quality! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: This was the first dishwasher in an almost 100 year...
txt: This was the first dishwasher in an almost 100 year old house.  We needed plumbing, electrical & cabinetry work.  The dishwasher is amazingly quiet and really updated the look of our kitchen.

title: Installation was easy. Don't fall for the installation kit. All you need is an adaptor elbow (abo...
txt:
Installation was easy. Don't fall for the installation kit. All you need is an adaptor elbow (about $5) for hose to pipe thread and a braided flex water connector (save the one from the old dishwasher). It comes with an electrical box for hardwiring but you can use a power cord (again, salvage the one from the old dishwasher) and wire it into the box. You'll need a clamp to tie down the wire in the box. That should be about $0.50. 
The dishwasher works beautifully. Dishes come out clean and without stains, unlike the LG we had that always left food deposits.

title: Our new Bosh 300 Series dishwasher seems very well built...
txt: Our new Bosh 300 Series dishwasher seems very well built and it is extremely quiet to the point where we forget it is running.  Dishes and glasses come out sparkling clean. Our only complaint is that we are still trying to find the best way to efficiently load the machine.

title: It is a good dishwasher. I did lots of pre-purchase...
txt: It is a good dishwasher. I did lots of pre-purchase online searching, review reading, and consumer report advice before purchasing this dishwasher. One bonus was that it was very easy to self install.

title: So far its been a great dish washer. Great baskets...
txt: So far its been a great dish washer. Great baskets and design. Very, very quiet. The key with modern appliances is durability so time will tell.

title: It's quiet
txt:
I've had this washer 5 weeks now. Install was a breeze. It cleans great and lives up to the decimals level. Washers have changed in 8 years I assume. I say that because I'm use to a true drying cycle without any issues. Unless you open to air dry get the towel. It washes great that's it. Some said the sanitizing cycle would do it, nope. The unidentified smell after a load is another issue no one seems to be able to correctly address.
Some say its mold which it isn't. It smelled from day one. I have run bleach and vinegar thru with no luck.If I dont open as soon ad the cycle finishes the dishes smell.  This is why I can't give it 5 stars.  These machine aren't cheap. I likely wouldn't buy it again. Besides there are other brands now that are almost as quiet which I would gladly trade for the wet dishes and that smell. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]
