title: The 300 had a lot more insulation than our old...
txt: The 300 had a lot more insulation than our old Maytag but fit with patience. Don’t know why you’d need to spend more on an 800 as this unit performs sooo well and is absolutely silent.

title: For the price of this dishwasther, the Bosch 300 falls well below expectations. The overall const...
txt:
For the price of this dishwasther, the Bosch 300 falls well below expectations. The overall construction of the unit is very cheap. There is a fair amount of low grade plastic integrated into the design and the metal parts are very flemsy. For example, the water inlet connection is plastic and is inegrated onto a plastic cover that is only held in place by small retaining clips. You definitely want ot use a flexible water line. Even with a flexible line, the turning force exerted on the inlet connection pushes the retaining clips to their breaking limit. The parts with some metal are not any better. For example, the front loading door flexes like a cheap cookie sheet.

As far as the operation of the dishwasher, it has lots of room and is quiet. However, if you want your dishes to be dry after a wash cycle you'll have to use a chemical additive to make this happen. Without it, the dishes come out dripping with water.

If you are looking for a great dishwasher for the money, the Bosch 300 is not it. Save your money and go with a lower cost unit that will have a better chance of meeting your expectations.

title: Very quiet. Was amazed at how little dishwasher soap it takes to get the dishes perfectly clean! ...
txt: Very quiet. Was amazed at how little dishwasher soap it takes to get the dishes perfectly clean! I know it uses less water and energy than my old Kitchen Aid too. I do use the rinse agent with each load. I have always done air dry so don't mind if the plastic is still a bit wet after running the load. I took the silverware basket completely out and use the top 3rd rack for silverware. Leaves more room in the bottom rack for larger items. Nice to have the middle rack that moves up and down to customize your load depending on what height you need for each section.

title: The machine is super-quiet with a light that is on...
txt: The machine is super-quiet with a light that is on when running. Cleaning is excellent. Loading patterns are somewhat different than US machines and requires some adjustments depending upon dish designs and shapes. Drying takes longer than heated machines. In all, we are very satisfied.

title: I don't normally provide reviews but I will with this dishwasher. This is the most expensive dish...
txt: I don't normally provide reviews but I will with this dishwasher. This is the most expensive dishwasher that I ever bought. Did a lot of research before choosing this one. Never had a Bosch brand of anything but wanted to try one. Glad that I did. Did my own installation and went pretty easy. Note for DIYer's, make sure you measure the length of supply and drain hoses needed. The installation kit's supply line and the drain line I bought was too short. Extra trip to the store. Instructions are good. The brackets supplied for side location really don't work. Top location will work perfectly. Also, Bosch recommends powder or pods, not the year supply of dishwasher liquid that I had on hand. So, after getting some pods, I tested the unit out. I was impressed. Very quiet, can't hear it across the room. Been using the auto function, and everything has came out clean and dry. Like the three racks. One of the features that drove me to this one was the ability to fold down some of the tines for bigger pots. Works great. Use the utensil (3rd) rack more than I thought I would. Either location for silverware cleaned as good as the other. Overall, very impressed.

title: Awesome is all can say!
txt: Remodeling kitchen and replaced our 15+ year old washer with the Bosch.  Very quiet...tons of room..and cleans everything well.  Half load feature is great. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: The Best Dishwasher
txt:
This dishwasher is the best appliance purchase we have made to date. It replaced a worn out appliance. I bought it solely on customer reviews. I found several aesthetically stylish dishwashers,but the reviews on this one sold me. This is so quiet I have to double check that it is running. Easy installation; my husband did it in a jiffy. The top slide out came in very handy , and I wash sponges, spatulas, spoons etc on that rack. Dishes come out sparkling clean and I mean sparkling like new glasses. We have tried every wash cycle and it’s the same. We did take the advice and make sure hot water comes out of the faucets before we start the cycle. 
We have had this dishwasher only a month and so far, so good. This dishwasher is surperb in every way and do not regret our purchase at all. Thanks to everyone that took the time to write legitimate reviews and helped me decide on a dishwasher. Those reviews are an enormous help in making a decision. I’ve owned a minimum of 15 dishwashers in my lifetime, I’m 65, and this is one of the very best in cleaning to a sparkle. Even my old dishes looked brighter and I’m not joking. My yucky looking stainless forks looked so much better. Now if it holds up mechanically I’ll be thrilled.

title: I am soooo pleased with my new dishwasher!!! It is...
txt: I am soooo pleased with my new dishwasher!!! It is so quiet and cleans like a dream. I had left some traces of food on some plates and silverware, and the Bosch cleaned everything perfectly!! It is so nice to have dry dishes when I open the door to get anything out!!!!

title: We're thrilled with the product. We've done installation ourselves and...
txt: We're thrilled with the product. We've done installation ourselves and while it wasn't without any hiccups, it's all been fine.

title: quiet and high quality
txt:
I had always been told to buy a Bosch dishwasher. My kitchen remodel contractors also said it was the best dishwasher money can buy when they saw it. I bought this model partly for the 3rd rack, which I love. It makes it so much easier to put away silverware. The dishwasher is nice and quiet; the loudest thing about it is when the water drains into the pipe under the sink. 

We have the intensive drying turned on and use rinse aid and plastic is still wet. Might try adding on the extra dry eventually, but it's no big deal. We've tried the Auto and Normal cycles and I do think Auto cleans a little better.

Be sure to install the drain hose with the high loop under your sink. The instruction book says the loop needs to be at least 33" off the cabinet floor, but my cabinet isn't even 33" inside. I have it as high as I can. There is still some kind of odor when I open the door, not sure what that is but if something was clogged up apparently it would give me an error code.

I love how the display tells me how much time is left in the cycle and how the machine auto turns off at the end. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Best dishwasher I’ve ever had
txt: I had a Bosch dishwasher in my previous home and loved it, so when I needed a new one I knew it had to be a Bosch. I love how quiet it is! My pots, pans, flatware, glasses and dishes are all cleaner and much drier at the end of the cycle than with the dishwasher I replaced. I use the auto cycle most. The only criticism I have is the length of time for most cycles. I love the third rack for flatware. I don’t ever use the basket so I have room for more on the bottom rack. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Love Our New Cleaning Machine!
txt:
Easy to use, great job in cleaning dishes, has a lot of space and versatile in configuration of dishes, like option of three racks to use, drys dishes well with drying solution, very quite, 2-hr cycle for wash to dry.

Would like the bottom of wire rack for middle rack to be flat instead of the hump in the center.  Makes loading/placing dishes awkward as they tend to tip one way of the other due to the angle of the hump. Minor complaint. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

title: Whisper quite as promised with features you need.
txt: Bought back in June and to this point I have nothing but excellent praise for the dishwasher. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]
